title: Exciting Trekking Trip To Kilimanjaro
description:
Tanzania Kilimanjaro is one of the highest altitude trek and this is the reason that it is one of the most popular one. You can simply walk up, you need no ropes or any special climbing equipment for climbing it. That doesn’t mean it is so simple rather this fact makes the Tanzania Kilimanjaro climb more exciting and demanding adventure.

This climb is simpler than other climb on other mountains. You may not require buddle of experiences, but you will need some essential things for this trek. Altitude is the main problem as the fact is that it takes many days to get to the top and the levels of oxygen keep on decreasing with height. If you have previous experience of trekking, then you can adjust the pace and hence you can walk for many hours.

As the path gets steeper, the steps get smaller and rhythm remains same and that let you cover amazing distances and heights. While climbing mountains, if you talk and keep walking slowly and steadily for an hour or two, and when you stop for break, you will be amazed to look down and find that you have climbed to such a great altitude without even noticing. If you can walk in hilly areas for about six to eight hours and again next day you can do the same thing then you are more than fit for going for trekking on Kilimanjaro. That is all you need for this trekking.

You need to just find a comfortable rhythm so that your body switches to autopilot and your brain becomes neutral. This is the most efficient way by which your body copes with such situation and you will need least energy and oxygen. Suppose you need more breaks, then you have to walk faster, and you have to make sure that your speed constantly varies.

Camping is another aspect of Tanzania Kilimanjaro climb. People have to sleep in tents and sometimes with minimal facilities. This trekking is physically demanding so you need to sleep well. If you hire the travel guide, then they will ensure that you get all the necessary facilities in your tent. There are thousands of people who are able to tackle this trek without any prior experience with help of our guide but it’s also true that if you have any prior experience then you can definitely benefit from that.

title: Preparing Child For First Class In A Nursery School
description:
When parents think that their child is now ready to go to school then they just search for a good nursery school and get the child admitted there. But going school for the first time is difficult for any kid. It would become a challenge for a parent too, if they don’t know the proper ways to tackle this situation. By just choosing the best Nursery school in Pune or in other cities is enough for the child as it is not going to solve the problems of the child until the preschooler is ready to adapt and adjust with the environment.

Often toddlers don’t want to get introduced to new environment as they fear to meet new people. If you are a parent and your child behave similarly, then this article is all about you. First thing that you must do is avoid worrying find out ways in which you can handle and prepare your child for the new surroundings. These ways will them to adjust to the environment. Below mentioned are some ways by which you can help your child learn to adjust to the new environment:

  • Tell about school: Initially, you must talk to kid about the school. You have to explain in detail what the school is all about then speak to them about the all positive aspects of the school. You must tell them that they can make new friend there, they will get new toys and a playground to play. This will help them to easily adjust to the environment as they already have a picture about the same from your conversion.
  • Ask child about his/her feelings: Many child fear to meet new people, there are some who avoid entering the preschool premises. Ask your child what he/she fears the most. Once you know about their feeling then it will be easy for you to make him/her cope up with that fear.
  • Visit the school with the kid: On the orientation day you must visit the school along with the kid. This will help them to become familiar with the classrooms, teachers and the location and next day they can easily adjust with that environment.

 You might have selected the best Nursery school in Pune for your kid but it is essential that you make them smile on the first day of the school.

title: What Is Meter Billing

title: Rising fuel costs: Who profits by charges on petroleum, diesel?
description:
Expenses on fuel costs 

The Modi government has raised the extract obligation on oil and diesel nine times previously its single decrease of Rs 2 for each liter a year ago.

Duties on oil and diesel are an imperative income hotspot for both the Center and state governments. The Center forces extract obligation, traditions obligation, and a cess on oil and diesel. For states, deals duty or Value Added Tax (VAT) is the primary wellspring of acquiring from petroleum and diesel. 

As of now, the extract obligation on petroleum is Rs 19.48 for each liter and Rs 15.33 on per liter of diesel. The Modi government has raised the extract obligation on oil and diesel nine times previously its single decrease of Rs 2 for each liter a year ago.

                                                                         

The Center has collected over Rs 4.6 lakh crore from extract obligation on oil-based goods - Rs 2.42 lakh crore in 2016-17 and Rs 2.29 lakh crore in 2017-18 - in the last two monetary years. 

Unrefined petroleum doesn't draw in any traditions obligation, however, there is a 2.5 for every penny traditions obligation on oil and diesel. At that point, there is the 20 for every penny oil industry advancement cess on rough oil and a National Calamity Contingent Duty (NCCD) of Rs 50 for every metric ton. As unrefined petroleum remains the greatest import for India, these charges contribute vigorously to income age.

For instance, the retail cost of oil in Delhi was Rs 82.06 for every liter yesterday (September 17). Around Rs 38 of it involves charges towards the Center and the state government - similarly separated between the two. In addition, the state government gets 42 for every penny of the extract income earned by the Center as per the Finance Commission grant.

Income for states through VAT on oil-based goods expanded from Rs 1.66 lakh crore in 2016-17 to Rs 1.84 lakh crore in 2017-18. Maharashtra forces the most elevated VAT on oil of 39 for each penny. It earned Rs 25,611 crore from the VAT on oil-based commodities in 2017-18 - the most noteworthy in the nation. Maharashtra's petrol-income is trailed by Uttar Pradesh's at Rs 17,420 crore and Tamil Nadu's at Rs 15,507 crore.

Just four states including the survey bound Rajasthan and Andhra Pradesh have cut VAT on oil and diesel to cut down their costs. Rajasthan started the pattern with a four for every penny VAT cut on oil and diesel bringing about a decrease of Rs 2.5 in oil costs. 

The move was trailed by Andhra Pradesh, which cut expenses by Rs 2 and West Bengal, which diminished duty by Re 1. The Karnataka government, as well, reported a VAT cut by Rs 2 on oil and diesel yesterday.

title: Terrorism and the Indian Economy
description:
How Does Terrorism Affect an Economy?

What is Terrorism?

Terrorism is not new and even though it has been used since the early times of recorded history, it can be relatively hard to define terrorism. It is not an ideology like communism or capitalism. Rather, terrorism is a tactic – a strategy used to achieve a specific end.

Terrorism is often used when a weaker person, or group, is fighting against a powerful nation-state. The violence is aimed at creating fear in the targeted population and often provokes a prompt and violent response from the state. Terrorism is, in its broadest sense, the use of intentionally indiscriminate violence in order to achieve a political, religious, or ideological aim.

Effect of Terrorism

Besides the injuries and deaths immediately brought about by terrorist attacks, survivors often suffer from post-traumatic stress disorder, anxiety, and major depression.  The economy suffers an immediate impact due to building and infrastructure damage, but it also suffers long-term effects from trauma to financial markets, a rise in spending on security and defense, and the impact on supply chains of enhanced security at land, sea and air border crossings.

Terrorism in India

Terrorism in India, according to the Home Ministry, poses a significant threat to the people of India. Terrorism found in India includes ethnic-nationalist terrorism, religious terrorism, left-wing terrorism, and narco-terrorism. The regions with long term terrorist activities have been Jammu and Kashmir, east-central and south-central India (Naxalism) and the Seven Sister States. In August 2008, National Security Advisor M K Narayanan has said that there are as many as 800 terrorist cells operating in the country.

As of 2013, 205 of the country’s 608 districts were affected by terrorist activities.  Terror attacks caused 231 civilian deaths in 2012 in India, compared to 11,098 terror-caused deaths worldwide, according to the State Department of the United States; or about 2% of global terror fatalities while it accounts for 17.5% of global population.


Effects of Terrorism On Indian Economy

With India facing the fourth largest number of terror attacks across the world in 2013, such incidents have a significant and long-lasting negative impact on the economy, according to Moody's Investors Service. "More than 60% of all terror incidents in 2013 were concentrated in just four countries: Iraq (24%), Pakistan (19%), Afghanistan (12%) and India (5.8%)," it said in a report. 

World in recent past has witnessed several economies burning with disaster & crisis. Today every nation faces some of the other economic, social or communal unrest. Further, globalization has enabled the impact of these tremors to be felt even at remotest part of the world.

Many believe that terrorism can't hamper one’s economic activity as it only destroys a small fraction of the stock of capital of a country. However, a broader look at the geopolitical & economic scenario can easily erode this misconception.

India has been facing the terrorism threat as long as since 1970. Over this period of time, terrorism has severely affected the Indian economy.

Let’s not forget that the enemies of our nation have vowed to bleed India through thousand cuts. Even if terrorism represents a small fraction of the overall economic risk in India, it may have a large impact on the allocation of productive capital across the country.

In any part of the world, terrorism is unwanted as it not only kills the human life but also the infrastructure, industry ultimately shackling its overall growth.

title: Haven’t  you invested in digital marketing yet? Think again.
description:
How many times have you heard about large companies’ bankruptcy? Blockbuster, HMV,Clinton’s, Borders, Kodak is only some examples of companies that lag behind from innovative technology and went bankrupt. Digital marketing is evolving, and companies that do not keep pace with it are condemned to fail. With the advent of the Internet, customers have unlimited access to information and can compare products/services. Respectively, more and more people spend much time on the Internet or using its mobile phones to make purchases. As a result, what it works in the past for a business will not working the future as the market is becoming even more competitive. The history reaffirms this notion. It is the norm. 

If it be so, what are you waiting for? The Digital age is here and it comes tostay. With this article, I am going to change your point of view on Digital Marketing. It’s time to capture the attention of your customers.

Let’s see the eight core advantages that you cancapitalize...

1.   Make online purchases an attitude for customers and experiencesignificant profits: Thisis a long-term advantage for your company. Customers should be able to understand the benefits offered by your company. So, what you should do is to exhibit explicitly the advantages provided by adopting a “can-do” attitude.  In nutshell, give good reasons to your customers to trust you and adore online sales. 

2.   Lower barriers to getting entry into the market: This advantage is precious for small companies that have not yet built their reputation in the market and cannot afford the increased competition due to thelack of “big budgets” and capital. So, the only thing that you have to do is tolearn about the international regulations and start your own business having a strong IT team. If you are a start-up company, do not miss the chance to become the “new disruptive innovator” of the market.   

3.   Become an international company

E-commerce sites do not have a physical location but instead, they operate as an online platform. Therefore, your target customers can stem from people all over the world. So, Digital Marketing helps you to get into various market segments,increase your customer basis and claim a huge brand positioning in the market. 

4.   Cost-effectiveness: From afinancial perspective, becoming digital is the best way to save resources and money. No “big” capital is needed but only a strategic plan and devotion toyour goal. 

5.   Achieve agility and flexibility: Being online means that you have the flexibility to make amendments or additions toyour site accordingly to the customers’ demands only by making some “clicks”. 

6.   Not interruptive: Advertising on Television is frustrating for many viewers. Adversely, online ads appear to viewers according to their preferences. This feature makes ads less interruptive and increase the potential to attract the attention of viewers. 

7.   Don’t forget the social media impact. Gain in publicity andcustomers’ trust and engagement: Design an impeccable content, create interesting articles, provide information about the company and share them in social media. Reaping the advantages of social media is a “must” in our modern world for those that target in achieving brand loyalty and higher exposure. Also, don’t disregard that having many followersand taking many “likes” lead people to believe that your content is worthy. In essence, all you have to do is to build a strong presence in social media andthe word-to-mouth marketing method will benefit you. 

8.   Exploit IT technology to learn from your competitors and be aleader. Measure the effectiveness of your marketing plan, collect data and getreal-time results:  Hiring expertise employees and establishing strong software programs can help you to know each strategic movement of your competitors and consequently to have a direct response and take proactive measures, so that beat the competition. Try to use GoogleAnalytics and enjoy better ROI rates. 

Are you still doubt?

title: Will technology reduce human employment?
description:
Technology is killing jobs, and only technology can save them…

Technology is playing an important role in human life nowadays. These technological machines got involved in every area of our life; ranging from smartphones in our pockets all the way to the human robots. Whereas, machines have become an integral part of our daily lives. Robots are already replacing the labour force in some industries. At this point, many questions arise like, is the hypothesis of “robots bring unemployment in future” true? Will they change economy negatively or positively? Answering these questions, economists believe that, Robots not only decrease unemployment but also improves the economy of a country. Robots will replace the human being in the market, however, there still will be new jobs for human labour.  

Technology never replaced a human being in the labour market. In fact, technology adds value to labour and increase efficiency. For instance, if now one accountant can do the job of 10 accountants with the help of a computer, one perspective is that technology killed those other 9 jobs. While on other perspectives, technology made this one accountant able to work 9 times more efficient. In addition, technology paved the way for other businesses to step in. because when the cost of doing business dropped down, more businesses come up, and economic cycle works faster.

Machines help to create more job than before existed. Economist Henry Hazzilt believes that two out of three of us owe our jobs as well as our lives to machines. (Hazlitt, 1946) Let’s suppose the clothing manufacture company. Manufacturers after getting profit from their business, will spend their money in one of these three ways. He/she will buy more machines to expand their business which he/she will obviously need to hire more employees. Or the manufacturer will invest his profit in other businesses which will create employment for other entities. Or lastly, the manufacturer will spend the money to fulfil his daily needs which provide the job for small-scale businesses like tailor and baker and much more. Whichever way he spends the money. he directly or indirectly increases the employment and takes part in distributing the wealth among people.

In brief, technological improvement in a country do not kick people out of the work. It helps the economy to improve and jobs become more efficient after the interference of the technology in the market. 

References

Coopers, P. W. (2017). Automation in the workplace. Price Waterhouse Coopers.

Hazlitt, H. (1946). Curse of Machinery. In H. Hazlitt, Economics in One Lesson. Harper & Row.

title: Maintain valuable partners and employees to your company even if they leave from your company
description:
One of the harsh market realities that we frequently observe in the market practice is that you will never be able to keep all your employees, especially the most charismatic one who have the most mobility and the strongest demand. They are hunted by competing companies, while there are many who decide to start their own business. Others simply find other opportunities that your company cannot compete with. 

This is very disappointing for the manager and the company as a whole since a great part of customers’ satisfaction relies on the work of charismatic employees. For this reason, some companies strive to develop a rate of renewal of their employees as a part of their policy. 

However, the fight to keep good employees in your company is ultimately a lost game. Either because of death, retirement or job withdrawal, they all leave at some point. So, what rational managers can hope is to have some influence on who leaves and when he/she leaves

As it is stated above, managers do not want to lose invaluable partners. So, when this happens, a dozen of question overwhelm their minds, such as “What iswrong with me?”, “Could I have done something to prevent this person fromleaving?” After that, the consequences of employees’ withdrawal start to occupytheir minds: “What happened will not improve my performance evaluation at all. Will this upset the others? ”. Still, they wonder on how they can fill the gap of employees’ withdrawal and what it will cost in time and money for the company. Particularly, managers need to talk to the Human Resources department to start preparing the description of the job, publish the vacancy, examine in detail dozens of CV of each level, organize interviews and approve thousands of dollars in travel expenses. Then, they have to put the new person in pace, while all this time theywill still hope to find an employee as good as the person who left.

Without a doubt, losing a good partner is a big headache and creates nothing but negative thoughts and additional work. But do not let the negative thoughts affect your separation from the employee. In some cases, you do not even have to use the word separation.

Modern and smart companies they use the employees’ withdrawal to empower their relationship with those charismatic employees by monitoring their progress in their new position, by keeping update the confidential lists oftheir former employee, listing available positions and candidate information, providing free access to the company's latest research, and organizing events that bring alumni close to active workers

The whole essence of these programs is to keep former workers in touch with the company's business cycle even if their official ties have been cut.This is good for business. It also makes the business more than ever attractive to potential candidates who are interested in their careers and understand that by working in such a company they become part of a larger network of business professionals.

Keeping contacts with quietus workers can lead to new business activities, market information, and occasional re-entry of good people who have temporarily left. 

But the effectiveness of these measures is determined by how the company managed to retire. When a good employee announces his/her impending resignation, did you deal with him badly? Did you disdain him?

Some useful tips for sustaining good relationships with former employees

You should:

· Congratulate the person for the new step in his/her career

· Ask the human resources department to help the leaving person to complete the issues that relate to his/her withdrawal

· Showyour appreciation for what he/she has contributed to your company by organizinga farewell party

· Schedule to contact with him/her one or two months to see how it goes with his/her new job

· Keep him/her informed about job opportunities within your company


If things do not go as well as the leaving employee aspired, then this charismatic employee will definitely return back to you!

title: Electronic City
description:
Electronic City is an information technology hub in Bangalore, India, located in Anekal taluk. It is one of India's largest electronic/IT industrial parks, spread over 800 acres (3.2 km²) in Konappana Agrahara and Doddathogur villages in Bangalore. It consists of three zones called phases – Phase I, Phase II and Phase III. Electronic City was established by Keonics, Karnataka Electronic, a pioneer in information technology infrastructure development. There are approximately 200 IT/ITES companies located in Electronic City, which include main campuses of IT/Bio-tech majors Infosys, Wipro, TCS, HCL, Tech Mahindra, Biocon etc.

Electronic City was the brainchild of R. K. Baliga, the first Chairman and Managing Director of Keonics, Karnataka Electronic. He dreamt of making Bangalore the Silicon Valley of India when he developed the concept of Electronic City. In 1978, Keonics established Electronic City on 332 acres of land in Konappana Agrahara and Doddathogur villages. The liberalisation of the Indian economy in the early 1990s by the then Indian Prime Minister P.V. Narasimha Rao and then Indian Finance Minister Dr. Manmohan Singh helped Electronic City to become what it is today — the outsourcing capital of the world.

In 1997, the maintenance and upkeep of Electronic City was handed over by Keonics to ELCIA, the Electronic City Industries Association, with representatives from units in the enclave, for effective local governance and management. Security is provided by ELCIA, who have deployed around 500 security officials and also installed CCTV cameras on strategic locations. On 18 March 2013, a notification by the Urban Development Department has brought Electronic City Phases I, II, III under the E-City Industrial Township Area.

Electronic City has well developed infrastructure in terms of connectivity to other important localities of Bangalore City.

Road
1) Hosur Road
Electronic City is on Hosur road which is a major arterial highway of Bengaluru city. Many BMTC buses and interstate buses ply in this route.

2) Elevated Expressway
Main article: Hosur Road Elevated Expressway
The four-lane mixed corridor elevated highway from Silk Board Junction to Electronic City was opened on 22 Jan 2010. The 9.985 km long expressway is one of the (second) longest elevated national highway in the country. This elevated stretch, promises to help a commuter reach Electronic City from Silk Board in less than 15 minutes.

3) NICE Road
The NICE road connects Electronic City to other key areas in the west of Bangaluru city like, Bannergatta Road, Mysore Road, Kanakapura Road and Tumkur Road. This is a 63 km 6-lane access controlled tollway.

Rail
1) Metro
Electronic city comes in the Bangalore Metro yellow line (R V Road - Bommasandra line). The project is expected to complete in the year 2022.

2) Suburban Rail
The Heelalige railway station, about 4 km from Electronic city phase 2, has become part of the Bengaluru Suburban Rail (Bengaluru Commuter Rail) system. The South-Western Railways has introduced a fleet of Diesel Multiple Units (DMUs) on this route.

Air
1) KIAL
Kempegowda International Airport (IATA: BLR, ICAO: VOBL). Distance from Electronic City: 54 km. Travelling time : 2 hours by road.

2) Heli Taxis
Helicopter Taxi Service to Bangalore International Airport was launched in March 2018. Travelling time to / from Electronic City is 15 minutes.

3) Hosur Airport
The proposed Hosur Airport in Belagondapalli on Thally Road, an UDAN project, is expected to be nearer to Electronic City. Travelling time: 30 minutes by road. Distance from Electronics City: 28 km

title: Agribusiness
description:
The world’s population is predicted to reach 10 billion in the year 2056. This growth combined with urbanisation—both in developed and developing nations—will increase the demand for preservative-free, fairly produced, and sustainable food. Because the purchasing power of the middle class around the world has increased, global food consumption patterns will shift from basic staples to more varietal that are produced with a high standard of safety. This change will impact global food demand and security. In India, where the farmer is not yet equipped with the latest technology nor trained to adopt it fast, digital farming is slowly entering Indian farms to assist farmers in better decision making.

Digital technologies that were once barely imagined are now a reality in today’s farming practices and they are replaying an increasingly critical role. The digitalisation of agribusiness, which involves leveraging the massive amounts of data from agricultural equipment, soil, weather, seeds and chemicals and using modern computer science to automate agriculture, is playing a key role in meeting global food demand. Growers with access to the right information at the right time are gaining access to insight that is helping to improve their production exponentially.
A growing number of technology industry experts, entrepreneurs and investors have taken notice of the digital agriculture opportunity and are investing in agriculture technology. Indian agtech start-ups—nearly 300 of them—in the hunt for a sustainable farming solution to a rapidly rising population are changing the face of agriculture, one step at a time. With the global smart farming market set to grow at a compound annual growth rate of 13.27% to reach $12 billion by 2021, India is at the threshold as it is home to one-fifth of the global smallholder farmers.

Digitalisation has changed how the agriculture business is operating, from the way dairy farmers tend their cows and get micro-insurance against bad weather to how they determine the most scientifically optimal time to plant crops. However, there is still a digital divide in agriculture, not only with technological infrastructure and connectivity, but also in terms of an ineffective knowledge exchange, management of information content and the diverse needs of different groups.
Farmers are always challenged to grow more while coping with volatile weather to meet the rising demand for more food of higher quality. This demands improving efficiency on inputs and outputs and various technologies have evolved in order to improve the efficiency.Biosciences offer great potential to significantly impact agricultural technology, particularly biotechnology. To increase yields and reduce costs, farmers are using a wide variety of new bioscience technologies that optimise inputs to agricultural production.
A Bengaluru-based startup has developed a product in bio-stimulant segment to provide growers with a reliable solution to improve crop quality and productivity.
Providing inputs to farmers on crop and soil management during their entire cropping cycle by a startup led to remarkable results in Madhya Pradesh, achieving increased yields of 40% for garlic.

Precision agriculture is adopted by the farmers to optimise their use of resources—be it water or fertiliser—aiming to bring efficiency to the farm in terms of cost, yield, etc. Further, it will support decision making in irrigation, crop management, water optimisation, and the like. Precision agriculture technologies ranging from robots, sensors, drones, satellite imagery, big data and Internet of Things (IoT), among others, are employed in various stages of agriculture from environment analysis, irrigated landscape mapping, soil analysis, to crop health analysis. These technologies bring in reliable quality data which help in timely crop damage assessment, advance crop planning, diversification and contingency planning.

title: Confidentiality clauses and start-ups
description:
The confidentiality agreement/clause is the unilateral or reciprocal agreement by which the parties undertake to maintain absolute confidentiality for all confidential information provided to them or information that will be provided to them in the future as well as for all the information that receive due to their properties or their cooperation with the company. 

The confidentiality agreement protects all confidential information, whether arewritten or not which is the exclusive property ofthe enterprise. Such information may relate to products, methods, techniques, procedures, formulas, development plans, research results, clinical studies,financial and personal data, and the main lists of customers and suppliers, as well as prospective business customers. The confidentiality agreement is also used in the case of trade secrets that secrecy provides a competitive advantage to the business.

In general, a confidentiality agreement must state who  is contributing and with what properties, what information is considered confidential and what the duration of the contract is.

The main obligations of the recipient of the information in these contracts are:

- not to disclose confidential information to third parties 

- not to use confidential information for purposes other than the fulfillment of the obligations the counterparty has entered into with the main contract 

- not to reproduce confidential information and preserve it under safe conditions.

In many cases, in the confidentiality agreement, there may be a clause that protects the recipient of the information, so that if he or she obtained the information legally or from other sources, it is not required to maintain confidentiality

When a start-up begins its operation activities,namely it is in search of individuals, associates, clients, investors; founders need to communicate with them much information to attract their interest. However,the information disclosure to these parties always involves the risk that critical and confidential information may fall into the hands of competitors who may develop the idea and enter the market more quickly. For this reason, the confidentiality agreement provides the consequences in the event of an infringement and hence it acts as a deterrent to anyone who deliberately intends to disclose or make use of the infringing information. 

Some tips of start-ups

Do not frightenyour prospective investors

Do not rush to suggest a confidentiality agreement to VCs and angel investors unless the discussions with your investors reach to a good point and you are able to recommend a contract that is very specific to its terms and has logic duration. That is to say that VCs and angel investors are members of the Board of Directors in multiple companies and they will probably reject without a second thought an overly binding and general confidentiality contracts. If you play the confidentiality agreement paper very early, you risk being considered inexperienced

Be able to discriminate truly confidential information from those that are not and do not cut off from the market

In many cases, founders filled with creative excitement become overprotective with their ideas and refuse to share information about their work. While extravasation is a necessary condition to be developed a startup, allowing the company to understand the others’ feedbacks and the markets’ response to this idea is also important

For this reason, a very good strategy could be to divide the information into what you are trying to do, such as your idea and market opportunity, and that information relating to how you realize such ideas. In other words, you can discuss your idea but do not provide technical information on how your project will materialize without a confidentiality agreement

In summary, confidentiality agreements are a good way to show seriousness, accountability and alert the person who receives confidential information about the start-ups’ commercial value and the commitment they undertake

title: Information Technology as a Modern Tool For Development
description:
In this modern age, Information Technology is considered to be an indispensable tool that people of all ages and levels need in their everyday life. Indeed, IT has brought forth a major change in the world and the people that live in it. For one thing, Information Technology has changed the way that people look at things. A teenager considers his computer and software systems as means of making his everyday school chores much easier to accomplish. A company assigns specific business programs its every department to make their task easier; and hence, enhancing business productivity and efficiency in the workplace. No doubt about it; there are endless possibilities when it comes to computers and Information Technology, and the positive changes continue as the world advances.

Information Technology has brought about an unprecedented change, it has completely reshaped the way we look at things. The possibilities with technology are endless and it continues to grow as we move towards a more advanced world.

How is Information Technology of Great Use?

1. Employment Opportunities are plenty
People can see that jobs that are related to computers and Information Technology are aplenty these days. Hence, it is fortunate for those individuals with skills and experience in this field. The abundance of IT jobs in the industry is the reason why more and more of the youth are going for computer and programming courses. Job seekers are just overwhelmed that IT job fairs and events happen regularly where hundreds of lucrative positions are ready for the taking by those who are competent to handle them. Professionals who join the industry are assured of a decent livelihood. Most of all, they become part of a strong driving force that contributes to the development of the economy.

2. Assures globalization
Information technology and computer system have resulted in globalization and networking that made the world into a small place where people, companies, and ideas easily become connected with another. Taking advantage of IT allows information to be spread across boundaries and barriers. With the use of Information Technology; great amount of progress have been made in all aspects of people’ lives.

3. Offers continuous educationAs IT continuous to grow and develop, it proves to offer a wealth of information that people can use in dealing with and enjoying their lives. When it comes to education, there is so much that this field has to offer. With the continuous development of IT, it gives people the assurance that they can learn more about it in a convenient and easy way. As it is, opportunities abound once people get a good grasp of this field, and they can very well use such Information Technology as a Modern tool for development.
4. Affordable technology
IT is becoming more and more affordable as years passed that it has become easily available to everyone, making their lives much easier. The Internet, for instance, with its cheap availability, has allowed people to become connected to everyone else in the world 24/7. Needless to say, IT continues to create avenues that make various aspects of people’s lives easier.

title: Sales Tips From Worldwide Top Sales Trainers Ryan Stewman AKA The Hardcore Closer & Josh King Madrid
When should you use a recruiting office?
description:
Rapid economic growth and a high rate of staff turnover over the pastdecade have created a tiny business class that mediates between employers/companies and job seekers. These mediators operate under different names, such as employment agencies, recruiting staff, and executive search companies. Some of these offices are involved in general activities, while others specialize in specific fields, such as accounting, information or counseling sector.

Most offices charge contractors, i.e. pay only if the candidate is recruited.The payment generally amounts to 30% of the salary received bythe newcomer in the previous year. Those offices that are directly hired bybusinesses to gather a small number of qualified candidates receive a non-refundable advance or bureaucrats and expect to cover their expenses. So, the cost is rising.

These offices, if used properly, can save you time and money. In many cases, they do a lot better work. For example, specialized agencies generally have very active networks of suitable individuals in the industries they serve.

If you have a vacancy in a remarkable position, headhunters will release your new vacancy quickly and confidentially to qualified individuals who may not be able to learn the position. They also carefully scrutinize who responds so that only qualified candidates are presented to you for evaluation. Finally, they can handle part of the deal, which can spoil acompany's future relationship with the employee. However, you have to decide iftheir services are worth the cost you will incur. It is clearly not necessary to use professional services when the board of directors is aware of suitable external candidates or when it plans to cover the position from the inside.

So, let’s see some cases in which these services are not needed:

·        when all the candidates are known to the board of directors, 

·        when the requirements for the vacancy and the merit of the successful candidate's qualifications areclear,

·        when the position to be covered does not require a highly qualified employee

Nonetheless, in many other cases, there is a dire need of recruiting offices. This happens when a company recruits a person for a very highposition that has a big impact on the low levels of the company. In addition,executive recruitment offices are often better than internal managers inconducting fast and confidential searches, which often require high-level jobpositions.

Also, external assistance has also a contributory role when the expansion of a business creates new categories of job positions that companies do not actually understand, or when someone has to come from another industry with skills that are unknown to the company. Nonetheless, assigning the mission to employees’ hunters does not mean that the company recruits them or that its executives can be relieved of their responsibilities. Companies should continue to be involved in the employees’ search. 

So, let’s see some tips that can help you to organize your HR management:

·        Select a consultant, not just an office: Select a consultant as you would choose a prospective employee by interviewing the person who would be responsible for finding your employee and check the recommendations that he/she has from previous clients. How satisfied were they with his/her services? Will his/her consultant team remain intact during your cooperation? 

·        Be aware of the potential conflict of interest: An office paid with commissions is usually not paid if the candidate selected is already an employee of the company. This may affect the staffing office to exclude your staff from the pool of candidates although its purpose is to find the best candidate for you. The remuneration for service provision can counteract this type of conflict.

·        Work as a team

title: What are the prime skills that a talented HR manager should have?
description:
Human Resources Management is an integral part of running the most successful companies as it can constitute an important competitive advantage for organizations. Companies with a good HR department succeed in having pleased employees and competitive business models. Nonetheless, the key role in the organization of the HR department plays the HR manager. So what makes a good manager stand out?

Talented HR managers have the following five features:

1. Management and education skills: Effective HR managers should be committed to the development and the guidance of staff, regardless of the department belonged and their specialty. When HR managers act as mentors and support a company’s employees, they can benefit the whole company as they are able to elevate their morale and set the company’s expectations more clearly.

2. Focusing on interpersonal relationships: Companies that are strictly divided into departments with little or no communication with each other are condemned to fail. Because of this, HR managers who aim at developing interpersonal relationships with everyone involved in the company help employees to be more effective at their job. Some ideas for doing this are organizing group activities and developing inter-relationships workshops (for example, through charts or through an online collaborative platform that encourages cross-project collaboration). These steps assist to unify the business and create a collaborative environment in which all employees are able to express their opinions and exchange ideas that benefit the companies’ activities.

3. Wide knowledge: HR managers should have both general knowledge and knowledge of the industry that the company operates in terms of labor law and benefits regulations. Therefore, a well-rounded HR manager is able to create an environment with equal rights and ensure that all employees' rights are respected. 

4. Being a model of behavior: The best HR managers show employees what their expectations are on their own by being a model of behavior. For example, managers who want to implement a new protocol, they can help their employees learn it by applying it first. 

5. Predictability: The best HR managers do not expect the problems to be solved randomly. Instead, they act proactively,saving time, effort and unnecessary stress for themselves and for the company.For example, a good HR manager would notice that an employee creates tension inthe workplace and he/she would try to solve the problem with him/her before complaints from other colleagues arise. This would strengthen the morale of the workers and prevent personal conflicts. 

6. Being a great communicator: HR managers should have definitely Communication and negotiation skills as they are responsible for directing employees’ actions and decisions. They should have persuasive arguments to convince employees to follow the organization’s goals and expectations. For this reason, it is essential to be great influencers and has savvy ideas to approach employees that are more resistant to changes or adaptation.

7. Have critical thinking skills: HR managers are responsible for taking a variety of decisions that relate to how employees should be better at their job, which employees should be hired, how effective is the outcome of the work of each employee etc. For this reason, they should think out-of-the-box to ensure that they take into account all the pros and the cons of each employee and be able to exploit the competences of each employee for the best interest of the company. 

Without a doubt, it is crucial for companies that want to succeed in their industry to have a strong HR department. When HR managers possess the above five characteristics, they are better placed to manage and improve the operational activities of the company and ensure that employees' rights are protected equally. It does not need effort, but just the right mood and proper skills.

title: Smart Stadium : Using Technology To Improve Football Stadiums
description:

The Internet “boom”, about 20 years ago, has changed the way people communicate. The technological advances, have dictated an approximation between the soccer team and the adept.At present, soccer teams have many more ways of producing content and interacting with their supporters.

title: The "viral" phenomenon. How could your ad go "viral"?
description:
Viral marketing refers to the distribution of online marketing campaigns among consumers who possess the motivation to share a message with others, which has either commercial nature or not. The main characteristic of the viral phenomenon is that it can be quickly shared on social networks and become popular through the number of views, likes, and subscriptions.

In fact, viral marketing has capitalized the Internet invention to influence people to pass along messages through peer communication. For this reason, viral advertising is characterized as a “new media” advertisement that helps companies to disseminate the message wanted. Yet, it can bring about unexpected publicity because viral or buzz marketing is primarily based on the word-to-mouth marketing method. This kind of advertising seems to be very effective as companies are not involved directly in the expansion of the company’s image, but common people; entailing the empowerment of credibility and impartiality of the processing message. 

In addition to this, viral marketing is an effective mean to combine the culture of your brand with the particularities and interests of the community to show that imbues with the same ethos, values, and virtues creating empathy among the customers and provoking an intimacy to the brand. 

 

Now, how could you manage to make your ad go viral?


Without a doubt, companies launched viral ads provide a fresh approach to marketing communication. This is achieved by using visual content, storytelling, and emotional copywriting to provoke positive feelings to potential customers and create strong bonds with them.

In particular, by inventing an influential, emotional, dynamic, and enchanting story to tell your customers contributes to building brand preference and maintains consistent the marketing ROI. 

Another piece of advice is that the ad should include a short-time video that doesn’t make the viewers be tired by barraging them with too much information. Instead, it should disseminate a clear, short and simple message at the end of it so as to be imprinted in the customers’ mind.

Apart from that, you should focus on finding social modern or vintage themes, such as the universal power of love, friendship, affection moments of people, families or animals, namely themes that provokes intense emotions that remain inedible to people’s mind. For example, in global rankings, animals’ ads have taken the first place in the customers’ preferences as it has proven to be one of the most favorable and popular subjects of the viewers on the social platforms and on internet searching. Tried it and tested it. Do not forget that imitation is the prime psychological effect on advertisement nowadays. Therefore, many people are receptive to share a popular social theme, as the concept interests the majority of viewers.

After finding the ad’s theme, it will be clever to combine such themes with a lot of images, pictures, and entertaining content so as to offer amusement to the viewers. In a nutshell, the imaginary and the positive feelings that emotional ads offer urges people to trust the brand and make them want to share the video, hence making it viral.


Once again, you should always bear in mind that if you want your ad to go viral your prime goal should be to cause lovely, cozy, and pleasant feelings to the customers so as to be motivated to see the ad again and again, and share it with others.

The key to successful marketing is to focus on captivating customer’s fantasy and creating an unforgettable content that ends up going viral.

title: What is 3D printing ?
description:
3D printing is any of various processes in which material is joined or solidified under computer control to create a three-dimensional object, with material being added together (such as liquid molecules or powder grains being fused together). 3D printing is used in both rapid prototyping and additive manufacturing. Objects can be of almost any shape or geometry and typically are produced using digital model data from a 3D model. There are many different technologies, used in the 3D printing process. The most common by number of users being fused deposit modeling (FDM). Thus, unlike material removed from a stock in the conventional machining process, 3D printing or Additive Manufacturing builds a three-dimensional object from a computer-aided design (CAD) model, usually by successively adding material layer by layer.

The term "3D printing" originally referred to a process that deposits a binder material onto a powder bed with inkjet printer heads layer by layer. More recently, the term is being used in popular vernacular to encompass a wider variety of additive manufacturing techniques. United States and global technical standards use the official term additive manufacturing for this broader sense.


A large number of additive processes are available. The main differences between processes are in the way layers are deposited to create parts and in the materials that are used. Each method has its own advantages and drawbacks, which is why some companies offer a choice of powder and polymer for the material used to build the object. Others sometimes use standard, off-the-shelf business paper as the build material to produce a durable prototype. The main considerations in choosing a machine are generally speed, costs of the 3D printer, of the printed prototype, choice and cost of the materials, and color capabilities. Printers that work directly with metals are generally expensive. However less expensive printers can be used to make a mold, which is then used to make metal parts.
ISO/ASTM52900-15 defines seven categories of Additive Manufacturing (AM) processes within its meaning: binder jetting, directed energy deposition, material extrusion, material jetting, powder bed fusion, sheet lamination, and vat photopolymerization.Some methods melt or soften the material to produce the layers. In Fused filament fabrication, also known as Fused deposition modeling (FDM), the model or part is produced by extruding small beads or streams of material which harden immediately to form layers. A filament of thermoplastic, metal wire, or other material is fed into an extrusion nozzle head (3D printer extruder), which heats the material and turns the flow on and off. FDM is somewhat restricted in the variation of shapes that may be fabricated. Another technique fuses parts of the layer and then moves upward in the working area, adding another layer of granules and repeating the process until the piece has built up. This process uses the unfused media to support overhangs and thin walls in the part being produced, which reduces the need for temporary auxiliary supports for the piece. Recently, FFF/FDM has expanded to 3-D print directly from pellets to avoid the conversion to filament. This process is called fused particle fabrication (FPF) (or fused granular fabrication (FGF) and has the potential to use more recycled materials.

title: Supercomputer
description:
A supercomputer is a computer with a high level of performance compared to a general-purpose computer. Performance of a supercomputer is measured in floating-point operations per second (FLOPS) instead of million instructions per second (MIPS). As of 2017, there are supercomputers which can perform up to nearly a hundred quadrillion FLOPS. As of November 2017, all of the world's fastest 500 supercomputers run Linux-based operating systems. Additional research is being conducted in China, the United States, the European Union, Taiwan and Japan to build even faster, more powerful and more technologically superior exascale supercomputers.


Supercomputers play an important role in the field of computational science, and are used for a wide range of computationally intensive tasks in various fields, including quantum mechanics, weather forecasting, climate research, oil and gas exploration, molecular modeling (computing the structures and properties of chemical compounds, biological macromolecules, polymers, and crystals), and physical simulations (such as simulations of the early moments of the universe, airplane and spacecraft aerodynamics, the detonation of nuclear weapons, and nuclear fusion). Throughout their history, they have been essential in the field of cryptanalysis.

Supercomputers were introduced in the 1960s, and for several decades the fastest were made by Seymour Cray at Control Data Corporation (CDC), Cray Research and subsequent companies bearing his name or monogram. The first such machines were highly tuned conventional designs that ran faster than their more general-purpose contemporaries. Through the 1960s, they began to add increasing amounts of parallelism with one to four processors being typical. From the 1970s, the vector computing concept with specialized math units operating on large arrays of data came to dominate. A notable example is the highly successful Cray-1 of 1976. Vector computers remained the dominant design into the 1990s. From then until today, massively parallel supercomputers with tens of thousands of off-the-shelf processors became the norm.

The US has long been a leader in the supercomputer field, first through Cray's almost uninterrupted dominance of the field, and later through a variety of technology companies. Japan made major strides in the field in the 1980s and 90s, but since then China has become increasingly active in the field. As of June 2018, the fastest supercomputer on the TOP500 supercomputer list is the Summit, in the United States, with a LINPACK benchmark score of 122.3 PFLOPS, exceeding the previous record holder, Sunway TaihuLight, by around 29 PFLOPS. Sunway TaihuLight's is notable for its use of indigenous chips and is the first Chinese computer to enter the TOP500 list without using hardware from the United States. As of June 2018, China had more computers (206) on the TOP500 list than the United States (124); however, US built computers held eight of the top 20 positions; the U.S. has six of the top 10 and China has two.

Supercomputers are used for many different things in today’s society. For example, supercomputers are used to help predict the weather. Meteorologists use them to do research on the climate and global warming. Scientist use them for molecular modeling, which gives them the opportunity to compute the structures and properties of biological compounds. Supercomputers are also used for simulations, for example, the effect of wind and turbulence on an airplane; and the simulation of the effect of a nuclear weapon if it were to be detonated.The military also uses supercomputers for many different reasons. The US Army Tank-Automotive Command-Tank Automotive Research Development & Engineering Center uses supercomputers to test new vehicles being engineered, to see how they will function in combat.

title: The costs of unethical behavior to business sustainability
description:
Many businessmen face the concept of business ethics with wariness. This is because they believe that morality and entrepreneurial activity cannot coexist. Undoubtedly, there are entrepreneurs who act with the sole purpose of maximizing profits, having no moral barrier. However, nowadays, business ethics is indeed a reality, since the overwhelming majority of companies are acting responsibly and loyal to ethical values. If companies do not embrace the ethical values of the society, it is certain that they will lose their sustainability in the long run as society itself will fight against them. 

Businesses as economic and legal entities that operate in society function at multiple levels: legal, economic and social. The moral dimension of corporate responsibility is involved at all levels and therefore the determination of various issues and what is right or not in decisions is influenced by the constituents of all these levels. So, for sure, a company must not violate the laws but be economically viable without, though, avoiding the demands of society, something that proves the complex role that each business plays in our modern world.

Today, businesses tend to draft a code of conduct in which the objectives of the enterprise will be the pursuit of profit and the satisfaction of all those parties that are directly connected with the enterprise and, on the other hand, its contribution to the realization of social harmony and the rise of the living level of society.

Every business has certain responsibilities towards the community and the state in which it operates, such as:

·        The supply of goods at acceptable prices to enable people to meet their needs. 

·        Compliance with legislation and avoiding any undue action. 

·        Making investments for society’s development and hence contributing to the economic growth and prosperity of the country where it operates. 

·        The payment of taxes to the state according to its real possibilities. 

·        The development of charitable and cultural activity that has beneficial effects on the community.

As far as unethical behaviors are concerned, when an enterprise prefers to approach its goals by following paths that do not respect social values and violate human rights then it will inevitably be faced with unpleasant situations. The cost that such firms attempt to burden on the community by adopting unethical behavior is automatically passed on to it with a set of controversies and social responses.

For example, one of the ways in which workers react against authoritarian and unethical decisions which, in general, do not respect their rights are the pressures of the trade unions and the strikes which cost a lot of money for the company that is called upon to deal with it. Still, when unethical business conduct consists of environmental pollution and the inexhaustible use of natural resources or non-compliance with the legal or economic framework in place, the company is faced with large financial penalties or even the possibility of shutting down. It is further confronted with the defamation of its public image, which is a key determinant of its long-term viability and its long-term financial results.

However, the most significant cost comes from the drop in the morale of workers who accept the negative climate of society and feel trapped in a system that does not play its role properly. The decline in unethical businesses’ productivity and profitability and consequently their increased costs is of minor importance compared to the detrimental effects that society’s reaction has to the business reputation. 

So, keep in mind this. Business ethics and social responsibility are not just theoretical concepts but have also a practical and severe impact on companies’ sustainability.

title: The role of mentors in the workplace
description:
American culture applauds self-made people. Nonetheless, a few successful people are completely self-made. Most of them owe their success to a relative or a mentor who helped them to take the full advantage of life “courses” and guided them in their spiritual evolution.

The term "mentor relationship" refers to a personal and professional relationship between two people, in which an exchange of knowledge and experience with the aim of personal and professional development takes place. The mentor relationship is like a journey, in which the mentor and the mentee are fellow travelers. In this journey, the mentor strives to cultivate a climate of support and trust, to enhance mentees’ learning and to contribute positively to shaping their personal and professional identity.

In many cases, within the workplace, the role of the mentor is undertaken by people who have worked in a certain job for many years and have a great deal of work experience in a specific field. So, the prime objective of mentors is to translate their knowledge into the youngest at work in a simple way and encourage them to feel that by their self-improvement they can offer important work and be valuable to the company that they work for. At the same time, there are significant benefits for the company because it exploits the knowledge of the mentors who have many years of work experience at a much lower cost.

Mentors have the following characteristics. They set high standards, they are at employees’ disposal, and they are able to unify developmental experiences.

The role of mentors is preventive, educational, evolutionary and therapeutic. As for the preventive role, mentor prevents, anticipates, or sometimes blocks out various difficulties that may arise at the workplace, such as conflicts between employees. Also, the mentor's second role is educational /evolutionary, as they help individuals to make the best possible use of their abilities and modify the attitudes that are inefficient and dysfunctional in employees’ everyday life. Finally, mentors have a healing role since they support employees who are experiencing a challenging and very difficult situation. In addition to the above, mentors have many other roles, such as the researcher, when the mentor deals with research issues in counseling and an administrative role when providing administrative work to a counseling center or rehabilitation center. Other roles that mentors can take are the advocate, the human relations officer, the psychologist, and more importantly, the guider.

As a matter of fact, mentors create a strong bond between the employees and the company. The strength of this bond is undoubtedly determined by the effectiveness of the mentor and the intensity of the counseling relationship. This indicates that mentors should be chosen with great caution. So, if you are looking for a mentor, the perfect mentor is the one that can be identified with an employee who faces particular challenges, have nursing skills, they are the best example of the company culture, and they establish solid links with the company. So, the last thing you want to do is to develop a bond between a promising employee and a possible renegade. Nothing could spoil more the image of an employee for the company than to see a trustworthy mentor to leave from the company.

Some companies ensure that each employee has an identifiable official mentor. Others hold mentors for employees that are well-qualified and talented. If your company does not exploit effectively the mentors to develop the employees’ abilities, think about creating a consulting program. Start by recognizing people who would benefit from more than one programs with the collaboration of your leadership team and the human resources department, identify who would be effective and available to become mentors.

title: The value of time management
description:
Do you feel the need to become more productive? 

If you feel that 24 hours of the day are not enough for you to do what you need and what you want, do not panic because you are not the only one. As it is commonly known, time is precious since it cannot be replenished in any way. Nonetheless, the rapid rhythm of modern life has made most of us run to fulfill our working obligations, something that fills us with anxiety. 

Time management can help you to resolve this problem by organizing your time. It has been argued that time management is a habit and as with all habits it can be changed. To do this, you need to identify which habits are wrong, why there are wrong, and what needs should be done differently. 

This is a topic for which dozens of books have been written and it is now taught inmany colleges and business studies universities. However, it can be summed up in two simple tips: Organize your daily schedule with notes and ... do not be hasty!

Particularly, the basic thing is to realize that as long as you are organized, the time does not change and the day continues to have 24 hours. What you can manage is yourself and what you can do with the time you have.

So, the goal is to change behavior and not just the way of your thinking.

A strong motive to start changing your behavior is to know the effects of poor management, which are the reduction of the hours of relaxation, the increase the level of stress and the lack of leisure time which in general leads to negative results in the long run and the development of an anxious or immature personality. 

Particularly, bad time management leads to stress that is caused by the work that should be done and no one knows where to start. It is the biggest source of managerial stress. It leads to crisis management where one begins to react depending on who is pushing more and yelling louder. Mountains with documents are being formed and the office narrows below the burden of constantly postponed work, documents that have not even been seen, and challenges that have not been decided whether or not to be accepted. 

Time management means getting control over how time is spent and making rational decisionsabout how to use it. It also means making better use of time, doing more in theavailable time, not spending time on unrelated issues, spending more time onimportant parts of work, and avoiding last-minute panic. 

As amatter of fact, effective time management is about identifying the activities that should be under our control, recognizing periods where we do not really have control over our activities and generally changing the way of our life inorder to be able to have control over our obligations.

Now,let’s see some possible errors in time management

·        We do what we like before what we do not like

·        We do what we know how to do it quickly, from what we do not know how to do it

·        We do the easy activities before the difficult ones

·        We do everything that takes less time than those that need a lot of time

·        We act on the demands of others before ours

·        We react directly to emergency crises

·        We do what promotes our personal goals 

·        We wait for delaine before we act

·        We do what is done immediately

·        We respond based on who asks for something

·        We react based on the consequences that each activity has to us

·        We are dealing with small projects before the big ones

·        We deal with issues based on time of arrival

·        We are working on the principle of "squeaky wheel"

So, what you should do, it can be summarized in two keywords that you should have in mind before you decide seriously to manage your time. The one is ORGANIZATION and the otheris PRIORITY. Nothing can start unless you first organize the obligations you have to do, and then if you do not set priorities.
