title: How to make a business plan
description:
Many people wonder how to start a business and make it work well.
Nonetheless, a specific recipe does not exist, but there are some directions that one can follow and set the right bases! Below we will simply try to show the great importance of "business planning" to the success of the business and we will see how entrepreneurs can start their own business plan.

To start a business, it needs innovative business ideas, a strong management team, and an appreciable capital.
When these are done then we have the business.
However, having the capital and making the business to operate effectively is something different. It requires knowledge, business planning, and vision.

In which questions a business plan should answer?

· Where is your business now?

· Which would you like to see your business in the future?

· How do you plan to get there?

These are the three basic questions where a business plan calls for answers whether you have a kind of business or are planning to open a company in the future.
In any case, the business plan should be a clear and comprehensible presentation of the goals and activities that the business is about to develop.

Also, some useful questions you can ask yourself are:

· Why do you think your business idea will be sustainable?

· What products and services do you sell?

· Why should you choose a consumer rather than your competitors?

· What else can you offer?

· What market needs do you plan to cover?

It should be noted that many businessmen do not have clear answers to these questions and this can prevent the company from developing and profiting.

 Drawing your business plan, you can make a description of your products by placing a special emphasis on how to use their customers.

What will be the benefit for the consumers if they purchase your product?

Also, it is imperative to show the reasons why your product will be successful on the market and continue with an analysis of the market you plan to operate by specifying the customers you address, and the profile of the consumer you are interested in making your customer, their habits, and income. What’s more, being aware of the competition that you may encounter is also very important for placing your business on the market. After doing an analysis of your products and services, customers and competitors, you can then describe who you would like to see your business after a few years, namely which is the vision that you have for the future and the personal lifestyle that you would like to live with. Finally, you should develop a strategy and set individual goals.

In the end, determine how you will reach the desired point in the future.
In this part, you should analyze the viability of the business according to the activities it is going to be developed.
All possible costs and revenues of the company should be calculated to allow proper planning for the achievement of the company's objectives. Cost calculations are made after you have taken into account the cost of setting up your business, the cost of purchasing equipment, operating expenses, staff salary costs, and working capital needed to start the business.
The company’s revenues need a careful estimation and are calculated on the basis of sales forecasts.
Sales forecasts are based on the calculation of the competitive advantages of your products, the size of the market you targets, the current competition and sales of past years, if your business is already operating, or sales of similar businesses if you are starting now.

I hope all the above steps not to seem to you as a "mountain". It's not something that should scare you.
It takes determination and self-discipline to complete it.
Think that the business plan you make will be the "bushel" in your business and does not need to be static.
If you want to change something you have all the freedom to do it!

title: Leasing agreements: Operating and capital lease
description:
A lease agreement is a convention between the lessor and the lessee in the context of which it is agreed that the lessee will use a facility, such as equipment or other asset and as an exchange of these benefits, the lessee should give a predetermined amount of money to the lessor. As a rule, the lessor has the ownership of the asset and the lessee acquires the right to use it in exchange for the rental payments. So, if a company decides that it needs more assets to function well, then leasing may be the most beneficial solution as it is cost-effective and flexible concerning the payment conditions. 

There are two types of leasing arrangement, the operating and the capital lease, each of which has certain features. The type of leasing agreement is imperative to be determined in order to be categorized accordingly to the GAAP rules, something that also affects the depreciation expenses of companies. 

The operating lease is a rental lease which has a short-term duration and is referred mostly to the current assets of the company since with the expiration of the leasing; the equipment is returned to the owner. Also, it is a good choice if a company does not have adequate capital to buy equipment or an asset in general which can reinforce the dynamic of the company and usually the company’s operating activities. However, as it is stated above, for the use of this equipment and the assets that temporarily offered to the company, the latter should pay an amount of money (a periodic fee) as an exchange of the benefits that it earns. Such leasing agreement does not entail to be recorded in the balance sheet of the company according to GAAP provisions and thus companies save a lot of money since such transactions do not appear in the financial accounts of a company. Moreover, its usefulness is of paramount importance as firms can replace obsolete equipment with new one, thus increasing the capacity and the flexibility of company’s activities temporarily without needing to buy such equipment and acquire the risks that are followed from the ownership. As a matter of fact, the operating lease comes with a rental agreement and therefore the assets and the liabilities do not appear in company’ s balance sheet; though the lease payment is incorporated in the income statement as a rent expense (operating expenses) and lessen the company’s  operating and the net income. 

On the other hand, the capital lease is associated with long-term investments; it has a long-term duration and aims to companies’ long-term assets. For this reason, it is like a purchase from an accounting aspect, as it permits the renter to utilize the leased asset for a long period.  In particular, companies that are involved in the capital leasing procedure assign some risks concerning the possession of the equipment, while they have the ability with the expiration of the leasing to buy the equipment and thus toacquire an asset that has been already recorded to the company’s accounting books. 

Nevertheless, a capital lease should have certain characteristics according to the GAAP provision. In fact, the duration of the lease should transcend the 75% of the assets’ life, the present value of the lease payments should exceed 90% of the fair market value of the asset, and when the lease comes to an end, the ownership of the asset is passed to the lessee. Otherwise, an operating lease may be more beneficial for a company. In general terms, the advantage of a capital lease is that the company incorporate an asset that has already used and tested; it has tax benefits due to the depreciation expenses and enjoys an increase on the book value of the asset, while the disadvantage is detected on the fact that the company bear the danger of becoming obsolete its leased asset at the time of purchasing.

title: Does power corrupt? Ways of avoiding corruption
description:
Leadership determined as the empowerment for influencing people toward ways of thinking, ways of action, and ways of renewing a tradition and culture. Given the crucial role that leader play in the organization of companies leaders tend to conglomerate more power than employees. Based on this statement, Lord Acton wrote that “power tends to corrupt and absolute power corrupts absolutely”. This means that when people accumulate power, they tend to be more autocratic, believe in themselves exorbitantly,and disregard the opinions of others.  

This phenomenon has also been explained by many researchers who illustrate the notion that it is in peoples’ nature to have greed as a trait of people’s personality. So, people have the ability to develop this feeling or mitigate it depending on the circumstances, the environment, and the opportunities emerged. This perspective has been stressed by Aristotle, who suggested that people are potentially good and potentially evil, and the goal of a person is to achieve well-being. To accomplish this, it is necessary to reach the medal. 

In the business environment, many leaders who are extravagant ambitious or have an unexpected success seems not to control their feelings and are characterized by selfishness. As a matter of fact, they tend to behave in an authoritarian manner because they believe that they are always right due to their position and achievements. Therefore, the more power it has a person, the more corruption exist. On the contrary, when power distributes among the employees, each member feels responsible for their actions and their collective purpose. 

History has ascertained this aspect. An indicative example is Adolf Hitler, who was an ambitious person thirsting for power. He deluded people appearing himself as a charismatic leader and convinced them to trust him. The consequences are commonly known. He led millions of people to death and “polluted” the minds of many people with immoral ideas. This example constitutes a distinctive indication of the corruption that an extravagant power causes. 

However, power does not always induce corruptive behaviors. When leaders have an ethical attitude and imbue with virtues and courtesy values can administrate their power in good purposes and prompt to transformational leadership. To go one step further, this kind of leaders may teach and inspire other people to follow their steps and exemplifies by their code of behavior. In such a situation, leaders function as a model of behavior and may have a positive effect on other people and especially employees. They can direct other’s people step by providing guidelines for more ethical behavior. Therefore, ethical leaders must consistently make correct moral decisions and judgments, even under challenging circumstances.

There are many ways that a leader can avoid corruption from power. The key to success is self- awareness. Leaders who have much power should be aware of their capabilities and their weakness to achieve self-control. Apart from that, motivators play a major role in people’s action. When leaders have a purpose, they do the best they can to achieve it. For example, Machiavelli said that the purpose justifies the means. This statement has triggered heated debate, because it led him to justify actions that considered as unethical, besides his prestigious personality. So, the purpose, the motivators and the means to achieve a goal should be clarified and assessed. If these three elements align with an ethical consideration, the actions of such a leader should reward given that strengthen socialize power by providing guidelines to people. This means that self-satisfaction should not be the prime mover for leaders’ actions. 

So, leaders should understand that in all democratic organizations, the power originates from the trust of others and thus leaders should be responsible for the administration of power in a way that serves the purpose of society to eschew from corruptive behaviors.

title: The importance of returning former employees
description:
The fact that a valuable employee leaves from your company does not make you think he/she will  not return back to you. Some women leave their work when their children are babies but they are ready to return after a few years. Some others leave to do what they consider to be a big step in their careers, only to be disappointed and land later in reality. 

In any case, when we get used something, it is very difficult to adjust our behavior and attitude to something new. For this reason, many researchers are convinced that such changes bring about a variety of negative effects on people that are willing to taste something different, especially during the adjustment period. This is because employees should start from the zero, prove their abilities, gain the appreciation and the respect of the others, and build effective professional relationships between their colleagues etc. 

On the other hand, re-hiring employees can be a valuable asset for each and every company for many reasons. Firstly, they know your business and how things work there. This gives them the big advantage over other employees recruited for the first time who generally take many months to learn the work and become productive. Respectively, this entails costs and time for the company which should train new employees to ensure that they are able to keep pace with the rhythm of the company, its culture, and strategy. Secondly, the employees that return to their previous job can benefit the company by disseminating and exploiting the experiences and in many cases, with new skills acquired by the new job. Particularly, if such an employee worked for a long time to your company, it is more likely that such absence may rejuvenate them and when they return they will be able to share with others what they have learned and how other companies work. Finally, every renegade promotes to others a strong and clear message: that the stranger is no sweeter!

 

Some things that can be done to increase the number of employees that they re-recruited:

·        Eliminate the problems that urge your employees to leave. 

·        Make interviews with employees that want to leave from your company and direct investigation of the reasons of employees’ leaving. This is the best way to determine the underlying causes of excessive numbers of employees’ resignation. 

·        If you find that a bad manager drives your most skillful and talented employees to quit due to his/her behavior, replace him/her and then call the best of employees who left to return.

·        Keep open communication lines between your company and your best employees that chose to leave. 

·        Strive to communicate with employees that left frequently. Ask them how they go to their new life and keep them informed about the job vacancies in your company.

·        Make the re-recruitment as easy as possible. There is a relative concern about returning someone to the old company. Eliminate this concern through public statements, such as “our door is always open to precious former employees”. 

 

Celebrate every return, as you would for returning a former customer!

title: Why capital budgeting decisions may be risky?
description:
Capital budgeting is the planning process that helps to be determined whether an organization’s long-term investments are worth the funding of cash through firms' capital. Capital decisions depend on the availability of funds, the relationship between the proposed projects, the company’s basic objectives, and the risk associated with a particular project. For this reason, the main responsibility of a manager is to examine all the available investments and opt for acquiring or selling assets that can bring more profits to the company by predicting the cash flows that will be received from the alternatives recognizing the characteristics of each project, and evaluating their credits. So, while capital budgets assist a manager to systematically analyze potential business opportunities and select investments that add value to the company through its expansion or the amelioration of its activities, it involves lots of risk factors that should be taken into consideration. 

A capital budgeting decision is very difficult for a manager because the outcome is uncertain since the decision is based on assumptions and predictions for the expected future year’s cash flows. At the same time, large amounts of money usually involved and a long-term commitment is required. Also, there is always the danger of a misleading plan that is set incorrectly at the beginning thus demotivating department staff. In fact, the identification and the measurement of the costs and the benefits of an investment in fixed assets require endless calculations and lengthy process. This becomes even more difficult when the period for calculation is very long given that the manager should consider multiple parameters to conclude in an accurate outcome. 

Furthermore, the decision could be difficult or impossible to reverse. The investment decisions regarding the funding of long-term assets are not easily reversible once it is applied given that if it emerged such a need, then the firm may burden with a significant financial loss. Another situation in which capital budgeting can be risky for a manager is when the company does not have sufficient resources to fund all the available projects, meaning that the funding needs exceed the funding resources. In these situations, many managersmay get carried away with the elegance of the investments and fund so many projects that are not affordable by the company in the long run. This combined with the management reluctance to issue external financial reports because of projects’ higher costs will lead the managers to abstain from the marginally acceptable projects to maintain reserve NPV projects that may be detected later. 

In addition, capital budgeting emanates some ethical issues that are arisen when the manager starts to think about investment. In fact, biases are another factor that can endanger the efficacy of a capital budget. Managers tend to reject investments if these investment request for the manager to collaboratewith someone with whom they have negative feelings. This also happens even if the projects have high expected value and is less risky than the alternative investment. Simultaneously, if manager’s feelings are characterized by more affection due to the interpersonal relationship created, then it can lead to the same unfavorable outcome.

What’s more, it is observed that managers are more prone to make a decision when faced with limited alternatives. So, when there is a great variety of alternatives, managers hesitate to make a decision, especially when they are less experienced in investment projects. Finally, studies have shown that managers that try to overcome risk projects tend to turn down investments that show a positive impact on the company and have a low level of risk. Conversely, the same people seem to take risks only if the option was chosen was failed and thus they decide to invest in projects that have a high level of risks. Undoubtely, such behaviors are dangerous for a company.

title: Employees’ career development as a long-term strategic asset of the companies
description:
As a career development considered the educational experiences, commissioned work, and the advisory relationships that promote people in their professional areers. Each company that aims to keep its most valuable employees and fill gaps created by retirement and expansion needs to devote resources to career development. 

Companies that give opportunities for career development create a strong body of people who will one day lead the company as skilled professionals, managers, and senior executives. For this reason, it is commonly known that career development is a form of internal recruitment. In essence, when a reputable company supports career development, it can attract individuals who are serious about building their careers.

Human resources specialists when they talk about career development are often referred to career scales. The career ladder is a rational succession of stages that progressively drives to a charismatic and dedicated employee into more challenging and fulfilling positions. For example, in the publishing industry,a n employee with ambitions can go through different positions in production or marketing to become an assistant editor and finally an editorial editor. 

Formal training of the career development procedure is generally considered an important element in the various stages of the career scale. For example, an ambitious publishing director may need to attend a 3-day lesson on electronic publishing and perhaps another one on legal issues, such as contracts and intellectual property laws.

Some companies systematically analyze employees’ current level of skills and experience and contrast them with the skills and experience required to reach the next scale. After that, the gaps identified between employees’ skills and the attributes they needed are dealt with through a plan that includes a formal training design, assignment of specific tasks, and endless consultancy by specialized seniors’ managers.

In terms of employee retention, the career scale method has better results as it avoids stagnation. Employees should always feel that they learn something and are motivated through a range of new responsibilities that they can manage. In other words, there must be plenty of enthusiasm. Otherwise, employees may fell that they are stuck in a stagnant career. This sense creates a prospect of retirement. 

If conditions hinder the progress of a promising employee, the manager must assign to these employees a sort of side-by-side job that will attract the employees’ interest and provide them with cognitive experience. It is the managers’ responsibility to ensure that the employees have a gradual upward course in their careers. Their development is good for employees as it increases the likelihood of staying in the company that they work for.

Employees' development have significant benefits for the company since:

·        it exploits the value of the company's human resources which are the main resources for many companies in a growing number of industries

·        it ensures that qualified people are ready and able to be promoted in an increasing number of disciplines

·        it creates a pool of employees who know the company and the industry and who are ready to take the lead as the business evolves.

·        it contributes to the effective maintenance of employees

To sum up, investing in employees’ career development albeit it entails a significant budget for the company, it can ensure big profits and pleased workers, hence the company’s good reputation!

title: The value of product/services from a customer’s perspective
description:
Without a doubt, customers are an invaluable source for business, and for this reason, there are many things that managers should consider to explore the factors that affect their purchasing decision. However, from the beginning, it should be clarified that the value-added features that make customers to prefer a product/service instead of the other do not only rely on the products/services amelioration as a commodity merely. 

Besides, if that is the case, the only differentiate advantage between companies would be the prices, a fact that will quickly lead products to become obsolete and companies’ strategies less effective. As a result, companies would not have any chance to achieve a high margin of sales and expect to have long-term growth. So, the thoughtful examination of the factors that add value to them is very important to be done.

The traditional theory of the consumers’ behavior which investigates this theme supported that the brand name, the location of the business, the packaging, the reputation, and the product/service price are some factors that add value to the customers. This is because, as value elements consider all the things that influence the costs and profits of the offering in the customer’s business. Simultaneously, the wide range of all these factors explains why customers have different perceptions about what they need from a product or service and why they have different interests.

For example, for some customers brand name and company’s reputation are of primary importance because they symbolize a kind of prestige and enhance their status quo. Moreover, product placement and location of the business is also very significant since customers expect to have comfortability. Hence, if a company locates in a very isolated place, then the customers will find difficult to approach the business, and they will be more likely to underestimate its value. For this reason, e-commerce has achieved to dominate as a new way of marketing since the available products are accessible easily to them whenever they want.

Also, the aesthetic of the product may be pivotal in some cases especially if the nature of the product based on this. For instance, a mobile phone or a car should have not only a competent function but also an attractive packaging because customers do not only care about products’ functionality but also for their appearance.

What's more, pricing is another parameter that adds value to customers since the cost of it, in many cases, shows if the company respects the customers’ needs and if tries to make its products/services approachable to them. Another feature that adds value to the product/service is its real or perceived characteristics to the customers, meaning that it should have some specific features, and especially premium quality that differentiates them from other similar products and benefits customers.

In this context, it is supported that the product or service should be functional exhaustive, operational connective and aesthetic coherent. Therefore, a manager should know very well the target customer that he/she addresses and their need. However, knowing the customer needs requires maintaining a great relationship with them, so that feel that they participate in the delivery of the product or the service. Hence, the frequent interaction between the company and the clients along with the provision of excellent customer services through which the demands of the customers are satisfied at once is an effective way to increase the value of the product in the perception of a company and a successful tool to “beat” competition.

Finally, the features that add value to the customer are those that encourage customer satisfaction and offer a life-changing experience. All the above characteristics are only some of them that a leader should consider when it comes to the design thinking process.

title: Corporate Social Responsibility: How to create your own strategy
description:
In order to enable a company to properly and responsibly implement policies related to Corporate Social Responsibility, it should follow some steps that will help it to reach the maximum. The key steps are: identifying the purpose and vision of the business and designate a person responsible for Corporate Social Responsibility, setting priorities, identifying stakeholders, setting priorities, idetifying the stakeholders, setting up a business plan,  application -application tracking – measurement, communication - disclosure.

In addition to pursuing or maximizing profit, a firm should integrate reasonably beneficial to customers and the environment more broadly within its immediate goals and visions. So, one of the  business executives should take over the coordination and control of Corporate Social Responsibility actions within the company. The role of the executive is multiple and important. The main objective is to involve and impart the concept of Corporate Social Responsibility to all departments of the enterprise, such as Human Resources, Sales and Marketing, Communication, Quality, Hygiene, Safety and the Environment, and to coordinate the activities of all departments. 

The inclusion of Corporate Social Responsibility in a company's strategies does not mean that all activities need and can be applied together. Depending on the specific position of the business or industry in which it is active, priorities should be set. For example, a business that is engaging in an area that is burdensome for the local environment should set aside as a matter of priority the environmental issues that will arise. Priorities are set by working groups that identify and analyze dangerous areas or behaviors that could jeopardize the firm's reputation and identify responsibilities. Consideration should also be given to the potential of CSR implementation for innovation, greater efficiency and higher productivity. A roadmap for Corporate Social Responsibility should therefore be formed including short-term priorities and long-term goals.

CSR concerns all those who are directly or indirectly affected by the activities of the business and are included under the term "interested parties". The main stakeholder groups are workers, community, consumers, the environment, the wider society) and should be mapped out to illustrate the relationships the business has with them. Regularly discussing and consulting interested parties can actually improve the reputation of the business at very low cost. In addition, through the dialogue, objectives of mutual interest can then arise which can then be applied to CSR strategies.

The definition of a business plan, depending on the stakeholder group and includes the undertaking's commitments for the environment, employees, and suppliers.

Monitoring of implementation of business strategy requires the involvement of all employees. However, in many cases, the process starts with a group of drivers that have been defined as having priority. The first concern of the team is to shape, where necessary, new policies and procedures and then to make them practical in this field. The team should be composed of employees in different hierarchical positions including people who have the overall strategic view of the business. Ideally, an assessment each year helps to better understand the occasional relationship between applicable CSR practices and the results achieved.

The disclosure of how a business operates within Corporate Social Responsibility indicates that it has taken its social and environmental responsibilities seriously. Communicating the publication of good practices improves relationships with stakeholders, motivates staff and improves access to new markets and business partnerships.

title: Internet and communication
description:
If there was any interest in the revisiting of the "interpersonal communication" within the alleged international web village, it would be appropriate to complete the image with a similar brief glance on the Internet features. 

The ethological observations we have seen from time to time may be valid concerning to the communication via the Internet. However, here it has its place-a more general observation. As in various other issues caused by the development of technology, the new technological means of communication (typography, telegraph, telephone, radio, Internet), it seems that the fresh ethical challenges are not at all new. They are simply enlarged but without introducing a new category of reflection: the multitude of their repercussions, their intensity and the temporal depth of their consequences are all increased significantly. However, there are no "new" qualities of ethical concern.

In principle, the low cost, the fluency and the almost unlimited scope of communication between individuals and ideas have already contributed to the productive and cultural development. However, we do not yet have sufficient empirical data on the malfunctioning of the Internet in order to establish a convincing theory and to be able to move rationally towards an optimization. Nonetheless, we must to systematically record the disputes and the side effects. And for those associated with Internet use for advertising purposes, we apply what we noted for the advertisement last time.

For the more specific direction of the confirmatory communication between individuals (a direction whose feuilleton underline particularly importance), it is interesting to note that the Internet has actually created new conditions:

A) The number of messages you receive may give you additional choice and time available, though,with adverse effects on your mental health. And the potential consequences of 'solitary ' work, somewhere here are classified.

B) The prevalence of English has broadened the communication between people that come from different cultural backgrounds with all the humanistic consequencesof this event. 

C) The phenomenon of "friends" search on the Internet has not yet been sufficiently analyzed. No one can disavow the fundamental communication pleasure that this street offers. However, it has been recognized that anonymity and heteronomy (the possibility of retiring completely and unilaterally from the relationship) may invalidate the benefit of the institution.

D)The ability to harm individuals or groups via the Internet (from promotion to abuse, to theft of funds), sometimes sounds nightmarish. And it shows how muchcommunication can be put in a society. The scale differs only and unfortunately differs exponentially.

Finally, we should take into account that there are millions of disabled people around the world (blind, deaf, paralyzed, etc.) who, thanks to additional Braille software, vocal composition etc are now able to communicate on the Internet, study and communicate with anyone staying pinned in the wheelchair or in the prison room. 

To sum up, Internet is a modern way of communication that facilitates our lives in various ways and achieves to increase its quality. As this constitutes an important asset, we should not forget that Internet is a blessing to some extent!

title: The quality management and the exploitation of the human resources
description:
The quality management strategy is a relatively recent phenomenon which is the result of the constant search for a stable competitive advantage in the context of growing market competition. The strategic approach to quality, due to its preventative nature, is considered the most appropriate for the diversification of the services offered, as opposed to the occasional effort to improve the quality that is expressed in response to market needs and therefore is passive.

Critical variables for the success of quality management have identified the time, organizational transformation towards aculture of quality with modern technology. The intensity of quality management activities is considered to affect not only the quality but also the ability ofthe business to respond to the customer's needs in a flexible way.

Quality management, as a universal approach, is based on specific fundamental principles:

• A client orientation that includes both the outside and the interior, as a common goal of the efforts of the whole organization and its members

• Process orientation that enables them to be analyzed in key tasks, as part of the quality chain with specific customers and

• The continuous improvement of products andservices through the use of people in identifying and implementing the appropriate changes.

To improve service quality, companies should:

• Focus on the market and the customers that allow the diagnosis of their needs and expectations and the manifestation ofsuch actions

• Independent responsibility of first-lineworkers that gives them the power to make important customer service decisions

• The existence of properly trained staffwith development opportunities and reward systems and recognition and performance evaluation; and

• The existence of a clear service qualityvision that precludes the arbitrary interpretation of quality service and the inconsistency of its efforts to improve and the variability of the results

Of course, a strong competitive strategy cannot be realized without the existence of stable and competent human resources, as the high dynamism of the markets has made it an important source of competitive advantage.

The human resources capabilities and theircontinuous upgrading and enrichment are a strategic determinant of quality andhigh economic outcomes. The more skilled and knowledgeable the human potentialis, the more appropriate it is to design processes and offer services that bestmeet customer needs.

Proper encouragement and the provision ofdevelopment perspectives are favorable conditions in this direction. The needto continually improve quality and increase productivity often leads companiesalong with their dramatic cost cuts, to reductions in their human resources,which entails additional staffing difficulties for the remaining staff. Qualitymanagement requires a flexible, competent and high commitment to the commonhuman resources objectives.

Finally, technology is referred to as a means oflimiting the complexity of service processes, expanding the possibilities ofoffering services of many different choices, with significant economies ofscale. The use of technology, in addition to the partial substitution of humanlabor (as in the case of ATMs), gives new dimensions to the skills and skillsof workers. It is believed to upgrade their knowledge and enhance thedevelopment of their skills in the services they provide and in customerservice

title: The importance of soft skills
description:
Soft skills are often referred to as people skills, social skills or interpersonal skills and in contrast to hard skills, soft skills are widely applied in many different professions and fields. In particular, soft skills have to do with skills and behaviors related to how we interact with our colleagues, our supervisors, our partners on issues, such as communication, flexibility, innovation, leadership, passion, persuasiveness, extroversion, problem-solving ability, team spirit, entrepreneurship, time management, orientation to the end result, change management skills, and risk-taking.

Unlike the past, today, it is of the utmost importance for employees to possess these skills that can make us stand out from a multitude of well-trained people and can, therefore, be the determining factor to find or not work. A typical example that highlights and summarizes the importance of these skills is the phrase of many specialists we often hear or read that hard skills can bring you to the interview but you need soft skills to get and keep the job.

However, before you begin to feel anxious we must note that soft skills are relatively easy to learn and transfer from one person to another because it is in peoples’ nature to involve in human interaction and interpersonal relationships. 

Some of the most important "soft skills" are communication, teamwork and collaboration skills, adaptability, problem-solving, and time organization and management.Communication capability refers to being able to express accurately and clearly and to be able to provide information or explain arguments in a structured way, whether in the case of an oral presentation or a written report, while the collaboration is related to the ability to work successfully and efficiently as part of a small or larger team with a common goal. Additionally, the adaptability skill is about the flexibility and ease with which one can both resolve any problems that arise and manage the ever-changing needs of a company or the market in general. 

At the same time, soft skills are also some elements of personality, such as courtesy, integrity, optimism, self-confidence, responsibility, strong working ethics, as well as other personal traits such as creativity, logic and critical thinking, determination and speed of decision-making.

A candidate should be able to give solutions, not answers, something that can be made clear by the interview process. Employers hire people who can act at the time of the crisis and the candidate is judged to be successful at this level when the solution he/she has given is essential. It is also crucial for the candidates to understand that they are not units. The production that comes out of the group cannot be compared to the individual. That is why the candidate's ability to join and work as a member of a group is essential.

Finally, it is very important for employees to be able to give their employer the right information about how a process, meeting, etc. have evolved. It is essential to give their employer a good idea of what happened without having hide or embellish some information. 

Now, executives must have a combination of skills, since a new trend is created for more flexible and creative workers ready to propose new things and take risks, have creative thinking and business orientation. The modern labor market requires employees who are productive and not workers who just work on a job.

Consequently, we conclude that in today’s competitive and demanding labor market soft skills are the most important skills that employees have to acquire. These skills are those that give employees significant competitive advantages and constitute the assets to stand out through competition hence contributing to their career success.

title: Limits of fixed budget performance report from a manager’s perspective
description:
Fixed or static budgets are financial budgets that characterized by stability and do not change in the course of the year, even if the costs of actual activities are modified. In fact, fixed budgets are constructed before the beginning of the fiscal year and based on the financial data that the company collects until then. While fixed budgets have a number of advantages, given that they urge employees and managers to be consistent with the budget plan, and facilitates the calculation of tax liabilities there are certain limitations and disadvantages to its usefulness for a manager.

So, the fixed or static budgets encompass many restrictions, as it focuses only on one level of activity and has a single planned volume including a specific amount of money that the company decides to allocate in its activities. This decision relies on the production expectations without taking into consideration unpredictable facts, meaning that the manager is restricted by the budget that should be followed strictly. Thus, even if a department or an activity needs to be empowered emergently, the manager cannot allocate additional sources to be improved even if this action is profitable of the company in the long run hence putting a burden in the cost allocation process.

As a result, such consequences can affect negatively the company's revenue flow due to the fact that it can provoke an extensive lack of trust and extra stress on the behalf of employees for overcoming the budget besides their efforts. For this reason, in practice, fixed budgets do not serve the needs of the real market world because many unpredictable events may emerge that demand to be arranged at a specific time. 

Therefore, the basic limitation of the fixed budget is the lack of adaptation to changes. Moreover, new companies may meet challenges using fixed budgets because in the majority of the cases, the data retrieved may be based on past data or past experiences of other companies or competitors. Hence, new companies or start-ups may need to put an additional effort (time and money) to combine these data with the particularities of its company frequently falling to do so due to the lack of experience and customers’ demand. 

Furthermore, as it is previously stated, given that companies operate in a dynamic market environment, they dealt with unpredictable changes and thus they should be able to balance their variable expenses. 

Nevertheless, the costs in a fixed budget may divergent with actual costs leading to an increased uncontrolled situation in the fiscal period that a fixed budget applied. As a matter of fact, the fixed budget can prove to be deceptive and impractical, given that the units are ignored in the cost’s comparison and hence it is an inappropriate method of controlling a company’s costs. 

Consequently, the only situation that a fixed budget can function well for the purposes of the company is when the company has a monopoly thesis in the market, the market is characterized by relative stability in this particular field of operation and when the company’s costs are basically fixed costs.

title: What do retain employees in their job?
description:
Employees remain in a company for various reasons. Some of these reasons are the permanence of work, the company’s culture, the company’s acknowledgment of the importance of balancing personal life and work, the flexible working hours and the sense that they belong to a family or a team with strong bonds. 

These reasons may vary from country to country. However, in cultures in which people are thought to be free to change jobs, the main incentives to remain in the company are:

1. Pride for the organization: People want to work in well-governed companies in which they are led by resourceful leaders with knowledge and experience, i.e. to pexecutives who have a clear vision of the future of the business, they can plan strong strategies,they are successful and they are able to motivate others to realize their vision. 

2. Are  spectable leader:E ven more important is the relationship between the leader and the employees. People are more likely to remain if they have a leader that they respect them and support them.

3. Fair pay: People also want to work in companies that offer fair wages. This includes not only competitive wages and benefits but also intangible incentives in the form of learning, development, and success opportunities.

4.Collaboration: The opportunity to work with respectable and cooperative colleagues is another element that many people consider essential. Many researchers support that building strong and friendly relationships between colleagues are one of the most important assets for companies that want to retain their valuable employees. This is because the individual success many times depends on the collaboration with other employees. Such collaboration may take the form of advice or a proposed solution to a difficult problem. 

5. Meaningful work: Employees want to take on companies that allow them to engage in work that focuses on their deeper interests. The job that raises interest and causes a jolt makes everyone more productive.

Companies can attract and retain talented employees if they perceivedthe employees’ job as a value proposition to the employee. The value proposition to the employee is something similar to the value proposition of the company, consciously or unconsciously, because it offers to its customers a measure of perception of value fora particular cost. They argue that if companies want to be more successful in attracting and retaining talented employees they need to evaluate and enhance value propositions for their employees.

In order to create an irresistible value proposition to the employee, the company must provide the basic resources that executive management seeks-exciting work, an important company, attractive pay and development opportunities. Some additional earnings, tedious dressing or more generous care programs will not make the difference between a good and a less good value proposition. 

If youwant to substantially enhance the value proposition for your company's employeebe prepared to change fundamental things, such as business strategy, companystructure, even culture, and moral stature of leaders.

Again.Think how important is to retain your talented employees and take measures toensure their staying to your company!

title: Finding the Perfect Dropshipping Supplier
description:
The whole dropshipping model will be based with the suppliers doing their job really well and are fulfilling orders efficiently and punctually. Therefore, it goes well without saying that selecting the right suppliers are the most important initial step towards opening a successful brand. When it happens that the supplier messes up your order, your business and you are the one responsible for it, so the key is to look for someone that will stick with the plan and have an open communication when there are issues that will arise in the future of team-up.

Below are some of the factors to bear in mind when selecting the dropshipping supplier:

1. Look for the experienced dropshipper with helpful sales agents. Nothing beats experiences. A dropshipper who is aware of the pitfalls of dropshipping and about how you can handle them effectively, coupled with the sales representative that will answer any queries will surely put your mind and worries at ease, and it will make a really good team-up and will definitely reflect a positive impression on your business.

2. Look for a dropshipper that will provide high quality, top-notch products. The high quality products give way to a high level of consumer satisfaction and that means a lower cost of unsatisfied customers and returned items. Testimonials and product reviews will go a very long way in boosting business, thus, having the best quality products are imperative.

3. Look for a dropshipper that has technological capabilities. When choosing your dropshipper, be sure that they know some technological abilities in keeping up with the time. When you want to scale up your business, it might be a disgrace if you have to break the great business alliance with your dropshipper just so they would not be able to maintain with your growth.

4. Look for the dropshipper who is efficient and punctual with the dropshipping process. Dropshippers that are shipping products within 24-48 hour period is the great way to make sure that the customers are being satisfied and happy. Because of the market’s competitiveness, long shipping times may be unattractive to your customers. This can be advisable to put on your test orders with the suppliers to see how they process their work and to have the best idea before you come up with the final decision of choosing them as your suppliers.

This may sound really simple, but, Google will be a best bet when searching for your future dropship suppliers. Some of the websites and startup incubators dedicated to Ecommerce, which pop up as hunt results, will have the entire directories of Dropshippers with the contact details. The moment you have acquired the contact details for the dropshipping supplier that are providing products you have an interest in selling, then, send them some polite, short email asking a few of your relevant questions. By this way, you will be able to gauge about how rapidly they respond and about how helpful the sales representatives are.

It is not always likely to know whether your suppliers and you will be of perfect fit right off a bat, but, it is likely to ask some questions that can make the vetting procedures more efficient.

Josh King Madrid better known as Jet, is a successful serial entrepreneur, investor, marketing specialist, coach and CEO of Team Jet Set, he specializes in the industries of e-commerce, marketing, business consulting, and fitness.

title: Leasing agreement and its importance in companies’ depreciation expenses
description:
The leasing arrangement plays a huge rule in the depreciation expense, since the February 2016, the Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB) decided that the leases apart from the short-term one (operating lease) should be capitalized; thus posing a major effect on the companies’ balance sheets. However, the accounting ramifications concerning the tax regulations and the way that the lease is booked depend on the type of leasing, namely if it is an operating or a capital lease. 

In the case of the capital lease, the leased equipment is listed on the fixed assets of the company, is appeared on the company’s balance sheet and is prone to depreciation. In particular, the money paid for the leased equipment is cited as a liability on the accounting books and equals the asset value. In essence, the value that is attributed to the asset could be either the fair market value of the leased material or the present value of the lease payment and it is also illustrated on the company’s income statement. Moreover, the interest that the company pays for the leased equipment is considered as an interest expense and the depreciation of the equipment as a depreciation expense which, in turn, lessen the taxes that the company should pay to the government since the expenses decrease the net income. Therefore, the book value of the asset decreases with the passage of the time. As a matter of fact, these additions in the financial statements of the company affect the company’s competency, because it reduces the return on assets, the assets turnover ratios, the profitability ratios, and the company’s financial leverage(long-term solvency ratio). 

On the other hand, an operating lease is deemed as an operating expense and the lease payment is recorded as operating expense, while the leased equipment is not involved in the income statement either as an asset or liability because the company that it uses the equipment does not have the ownership of it.  Thus, the company that leases the equipment should record the payments that have made as rental expense and credit its lease in the payable account. Finally, when the periodic lease obligation is amortized, the company documents credit to the cash account and debit the lease to the payable account. Respectively, the lessor should record the periodic depreciation by charging the depreciation expense account and crediting the accumulated depreciation account on his/her balance sheet. 

To sum up, the nature of the leasing arrangement and the type of them affect companies’ cash flow and determine companies’ opportunities to benefit from the depreciation expense from a tax-deductible perspective. However, the choice of an operating or a capital lease should be done according to the needs of the company and the objectives that it has.

title: The statement of cash flow and its particularities
description:
The statement of cash flows, as one of the fundamental financial statements, is undeniably an important statement for both internal and external users, because it can be used in evaluating a company's financial standing. Cash flows enable the company to pay expenses, debts, employees’ wages, taxes, and investments in assets needed for its operation. As a matter of fact, without sufficient cash flows, a company cannot grow and prosper. 

In particular, the cash flow analysis is a financial statement that depicts the cash receipts, the cash payments of a company and the relevant activities of it that help the manager to make crucial investments and operational decisions. Moreover, while the income statement presents many similarities with the cash flow statement, they are not the same, because, the fact that a company appears to have profits on its income statement, it doesn't mean that it will not meet barriers later because of the possible inadequacies in its cash flows. 

So, the contribution of cash flow in assessing the healthiness of company’s financial situation is of primary importance, because the manager can accurately predict the cash difficulties that a company may encounter and create an effective strategy and a cash budget plan by comparing the company’s finance at the beginning of the fiscal year with the end. Besides such information are also significant to investors that are interested in companies that have a great amount of money to display on their operating activities and make appropriate developing investments. For all these reasons, it is important the cash of operating activities surpass the net income. 

Regarding the categories of the activities that are involved in the cash flow, they are recorded values that stem from operation activities, investment activities, and the financing activities. The operation activities are those that include the amount of money that the company gives for goods/service sales deducting the costs of manufacturing them. Important categories that are associated with operating activities involve the cash associated with accounts receivable, accounts payable and inventories. In fact, operating activities constitute the main internal source of company’s cash production, because the manager can design the future budget based on these relevant activities. Furthermore, the investment activities represent the amount of money that the companies pay for the facilities to maintain the company thriving, namely the company’s assets that stem from selling a number of its investments or the investments in which the company should pay to obtain them. In this context, the changes in the investment cash flow are precious for business profitability because they are related to the expansion of the company and the improvement of its products or services. 

However, it should be noted that the assets should be adapted to the nature of the company, because different businesses need different assets so as to function well. As a matter of fact, the cash inflows can be derived by selling fixed and intangible assets or investments, while the cash outflows can stem from payments to purchase fixed, intangible assets and payments to purchase investments. 

What’s more, the finance activities are compromised by the inventories and the intangible assets of the company that derives from external funding and help the firm to start operating. For this reason, they depict the relationship between creditors and owners and capital markets and investors. Consequently,  the financial activities are valuable sources of investors who are interested to be informed about the financial situation of the company and specifically the amount of money and the frequency that the company increases its capital, as well as the way that amortizes its debts during the fiscal year.

title: The role of corporate governance in our modern society
description:
Nowadays, the more important the role and presence of private businesses is, the more critical it becomes to analyze and critique business ethics and social responsibility. 

Ethicsis characterized as a system of values, rules, and perceptions which decisively influences the character, the action and the attitude of citizens and social groups. It is a system that determines the will and the actions of people, the origin, the essence and the content of the rules and values that determine peoples’ choices and behaviors as good and right.

In many countries, there has been an increased interest in corporate social responsibility and ethics. Social responsibility consists mainly of business relations with the external environment. Administrative ethics is a broader concept, which consists of the business relationship with its internal and external environment.

Today's ideology gives companies social roles within every social or political system that they have to serve. The prevailing view of the business is integrated into a more general economic system, a subsystem which it ought to serve.

From this perspective, the enterprise is composed of employees and sometimes conflicting groups that have requirements from its resources. Therefore, the business manager should combine the realization of economic goals within a pluralistic political environment that respects and creates human values. All these features depict the need and the cultivation of the concept of corporate governance. 

The concept of Corporate Governance is not new as it appears alongside the creation of the first Public Limited companies in the 19th century. Corporate Governance is nothing more than a system of principles on the basis of which an enterprise is run and managed to preserve and satisfy the legitimate interests of all those related to the company within the company's interest. In other words, it aims at permanently serving the interest of the company as a legal entity of the stakeholders and not just the shareholders in procedures of full transparency and providing vital information so that they also have an active role in the company's activity.

The principles of Corporate Governance are voluntary commitments that contribute tothe company's preservation and credibility and aim to promoting the long-term and balanced development of the company. Only companies that apply Corporate Governance principles can have healthy and long-term business growth.

If we try to isolate the keywords in the principles of Corporate Governance we would choose the words Transparency and Information, Stakeholders, Development. If the development of a company is the intended business outcome then the transparency of procedures and the provision of information to stakeholders are the prerequisites for achieving the result. In other words, today anything that makes a business positive or negative is immediately known.

Transparency in business practices is no longer a luxury but a requirement. Customers and consumers want to know what's inside the company. They do not want to deal with companies that do not trust or appreciate. But even when these conditions exist, it does not mean that the desired result is achieved. Close monitoring of products and services, brandsand logos, returns and profit margins is no longer enough.

In the emerging global market, companies are judged on the basis of environmental protection measures, workers' relationships, community relations, and generally, they are judged by their sensitivity and interference with modern social problems. 

So, corporate governance is without a doubt, the only future that businesses have.

title: Why do employees decide to quit their job?
description:
Without a doubt, employees encounter in their career many difficulties that sometimes they may feel unable to administrate them. Family problems, personal worries etc. may provoke bad feelings to employees that influence their mood and their job performance. Due to this situation, sometimes employees tend to put the blame for this situation into the company or other employees or the manager orthe leader as they are unable to detect the root of their problems. At this point, employees are more likely to decide to quit their job and leave companies for many different reasons. Some of these reasons are:

1. Company leadership changes: For example, the quality of senior administration departures declines or a newl eadership which employees do not trust or feel comfortable with takes the lead. Do not overestimate situations in which the leaders change and his/her place is taken by someone adopted an authoritarian leadership style that statistically is not preferable by the majority of the employees. 

2. Conflict with direct deputy: People can also leave when their relationship with their superiors becomes pressing or problematic and they do not see any other alternative within their company.

3. Close friends leave: One or more colleagues whom an employee particularly likes and respects depart from the company thus depriving him/her of a relationship that makes sense to him/her.

4. Difficult change of competences: The responsibilities of a person's position change to the point where his or her job no longer responds to the deeper interests or does not give him/her a meaning or a motive.

What we should remember when considering why people are leaving is that people often leave for erroneous reasons. They leave without really understanding why they are unhappy or what opportunities exist within the company with which they can improve things. For this reason, they move from company to company, committing the same mistake each time in an attempt to enhance their career opportunities.

For all these reasons, you should not panic or get mad. There are many ways and preventive measures that you should adopt and implement to prevent employees from leaving the company. 

Some useful tips for tracking people that is to leave from your company:

·        Changes in employees’ behavior. The most indicative example is when employees go to work delayed or leave from their job early. 

·        Decline in their performance.

·        Sudden complaints from an employee who did not complain frequently.

·        Reports of exhaustion.

·        Nostalgic references to other companies that an employee worked for in the past.

·        Alienation from their colleagues.

If you find any ofthese really warning signs then you should start to worry and take actions. Make arrangements to meet the employee as soon as possible. 

Use clarification questions to locate the origin of the problem. 

Most importantly, show that you appreciate them as manager or leader and discuss with them how to work together so as to create better working experience andf ormulate an environment which satisfies all parties!

title: The principles of balancing job and life obligations
description:
The balance between work and personal life is a big issue nowadays. Many people say enough with endless days of work, torn vacations, and nights spent in hotel rooms, and emails that take weekends from their boss. A lot of companies have received the message and responded properly by launching programs that help employees to balance the two sides of their lives. 

Many entrepreneurs consider that any concession made for the purpose of reconciling work and personal life would correspond to significant costs for the companies and a burden to their finances. However, the balance between work and personal life can be modeled through a "win-win" perspective and not through a game with any effects.

Work and personal life are not competitive but complementary priorities. In essence, they have adopted a philosophy that everyone wins. And they appear to be right. The new approach does not bring tangible benefits to both companies and employees individually.

So, if companies want to maintain a good state in their businesses without exhausting their employees but rather keep them happy and pleased, they should read the following advice. 

1. Ensure that employees understand the company's priorities and encourage them to be clear about their personal priorities: The company’s job must be done and the balance between work and personal life must not be an excuse to slip away. Alternatively, work cannot be an excuse to leave important personal slogans to slide. Directors need to be clear about the company's goals and performance. At the same time, they should encourage employees to be clear about their goals as members of a family and as individuals. 

Once all these are done, programs and tasks can usually be customized in ways that meet both sides. The fact that these directors define business success based on the results is definitely essential. For them, the results count more than the process. On this basis, they provide their employees with specific goals but also great autonomy in how to achieve these goals. The combination ofemployees’ autonomy along with the determination of the goals and the expected results is a procedure that helps to be promoted a more flexible schedule for employees’ working hours. 

2. Recognize and support employees as integrated personalities who have important roles outside the workplace: Directors can only handle the conflict of work and personal life if they understand and are interested in the extra-life lives of their employees. The sign of real interest creates a bond and gradually a sense of trust which brings to the company benefits that each manager anticipates.

3. Continually experiment with how employees perform the job: Smart managers know that production processes need to be revised and redesigned periodically for greater efficiency and effectiveness. The balance between work and personal life contains opportunities to experiment with these processes. In the descriptions of directors who have successfully implemented the work-life balance, conflicts between work and personal life priorities can indeed be catalysts for identifying work-related disadvantages that otherwise would be hidden.

These three principles should function as a guideline of each company in order to introduce programs that rejuvenate employees, relax them when needed and make them more productive to their job as they are able to strike a balance between the job and their personal obligations!
