title: The reasons for maintaining employees
description:
Maintenance is the opposite of renewal. Maintaining is not just a matter of good atmosphere. Maintaining good employees is important for three main reasons: it increases the company’s intellectual capital, the causal relationship between the employee's permanence and customer satisfaction, and the candidate's renewal costs of employees.

In the industrial age, the capital stock of a business, such as factories, machinery, and land, determined how efficiently a business could compete with other companies. In our knowledge economy, intellectual capital is what determines the competitive advantage of a business. 

Spiritual capital is the only knowledge and experience possessed by a company's workforce. Today, successful companies stand out with their innovative ideas and leading products and services that stem from employees' knowledge and experience. Indicative examples of people with intellectual capital include computer programmers, network engineers, technical designers, accountants, and direct marketing analysts etc.

So, when employees leave, the company lives up to their knowledge which is gained with persistent effort and their skills that are often expensive to buy. When these employees go to some competitors then the loss is worse. Your business not only lacks a substantial part of its foundations but it's gained by your competitors without having invested time and money in employees’ education. 

Now, everyone realizes that the satisfaction of the customer is one of the most important factors, if not the most important, for the survival and the development of an enterprise. This is another reason that keeping employees is so critical. Employees who are satisfied with work and the company are more likely to satisfy their customers. The attitudes of employees adversely affect customer satisfaction. The high degree of staff renewal reduces customer satisfaction and business revenue.To the extent that business employees understood their duties and the company's strategic objectives, it has a direct impact on their attitude and behavior.

Thus, the bond of the employees entails the link of the client. When employees feel connected with their company, they are more likely to share with their customers their insight and feelings about the company. When customers are exposed to positive expressions for the company, they respond well to it.

Respectively, the high cost of staff renewal is the third main reason that retention is important. Employee renewal involves types of atrocious cost from which its heds the company's final profits.

·        The direct costs including disbursements for attracting, joining and educating replacements.

·        The indirect costs, such as the impact on tax on morale and customer satisfaction. 

·        The opportunity costs including the lost knowledge andt he work that is not performed during the period when executives and other employees focus on filling the vacancy and adjusting the company's replacement.

The costs of losing and replacing an employee depend on the individual and the industry employed. Rarely this cost is low. The cost of losing a most efficient employee is obviously much higher than the cost of losing a common employee, even if the salary and benefits of both are the same. There is also the other side of the currency of renewal costs. Renewal of inadequate people may not create any heir since the withdrawal of such employees may, in fact, eliminate some hidden costs. The price goes up as we look at the deficiency in senior management levels. And what are the costs that you associate with the low morale and the kickbacks they cause? No one can guess ......

title: Defining the proper qualifications for each job
description:
After an interview and before proceeding with an appointment, you need to know why you will want the job. You also need to define some skills and personality traits to suit the requirements of the position and the company.

You need to understand how to identify the job and the skills required in it, that is:

·        the basic competencies and duties of the post

·        the training required to carry out the work (education and experience)

·        the individual features needed

·        the main features of your corporate culture

·        the administrative style and the role it plays for a constructive job position

If you are looking to hire someone for a position that already exists, consider and evaluate the job description. But do not accept any of these perspectives as definitive. Use the opportunity to get you recruited to review the core competencies and tasks of the specific position. Make sure you are able to answer the important question, "What should an employee do in that position?"

Education and experience are the two most important training elements to consider when evaluating candidates. In the case of education, you may want to define a particular degree or a certain level. First, however, make sure that this educational background is indeed necessary. 

Experience requirements must be based on an extensive analysis of the specific tasks and responsibilities of the position. What would be more desirable: industry, practical experience?

Also, individual features can reveal how the candidate will approach his/her work and how he/she will work with his/her colleagues. Evaluate the following features regarding the tasks and responsibilities you have listed for the position you want to cover:

Analysis and Creative Skills: The skills of candidates in these two areas determine how they will assess the problems and find new ways to solve them.

Decision-making style: The style with which each individual takes his/her decisions is completely personal. Some people are overly complex, analytical and evidence-based. Others rely more on their instincts. Some are quick to make decisions while others are thinking about it for a long time. Some seek consensus while others have their own plans. It is important to determine whether a particular style is required for someone to be in that position and, if so, what is it.

Interpersonal skills: Since interpersonal skills and behavior are closely linked, understanding a candidate's interpersonal skills is an important part of the recruitment process. To determine which interpersonal skills most fit into a given position, take into account all the tasks that will be performed within this post. What feature will guarantee the good performance of the individual, especially considering the contacts with the superiors, his peers and the direct contacts he will make?

Motivation: A person's goals, interests, work levels, and progress at work often indicate the level of mobilization. So ask yourself “Does this position match the candidate's personal aspirations? Will he work in this position with enthusiasm and energy”?

After that, post and check again the job description which should include the title of the position, the business unit and the company name, the responsibilities and positions of the post, the manager who will recruit and the manager to whom the employee will refer, the duties, responsibilities and objectives of the post, the pay, the hours and the place of work, the qualifications required, and the individual characteristics required. 

Many of these issues should be clarified with the human resources department. However, developing a job description can be an opportunity to redesign this job and not just to fill the existing position.

As you format the job descriptor, please note the following:

Make the distinctionbetween knowledge, skills, and abilities.

Spend as long as you need to do it properly.

Make sure you comply with all legal limitations.

title: Quality management: How can you apply it?
description:
Companies can take various steps to improve the quality of their service. Business quality improvement initiatives can be explored based on the following key concepts - principles:

1. Customer focus

Quality management is based on the suggestion that meeting the requirements of customers is the purpose of business activity. The qualityof products and services exists if they meet their intended purpose and in particular customer requirements. Only customers can provide clear and immediate information about their needs as well as the extent to which they have been satisfied with regard to competition. The determination of customers’ requirements is achieved through meetings with them in various forms and through adequate information from suppliers.

2.Leadership                                                

The most important factor for the success of quality management is the behavior of the managers and leaders, particularly concerning their perception and commitment to companies’ goal. However, managers’ and leaders’ commitment to companies’ vision is not sufficient to maintain quality improvement for a long time. There is still a need for immediate and active involvement, which confirms their commitment. Their responsibility in implementing quality management involves agreeing on objectives and measurements, securing the necessary resources, delegating responsibilities, setting deadlines, monitoring progress, measuring and rewarding progress towards the goals

3. Continuous improvement 

Continuous improvement is the cornerstone of quality management strategy and requires very good management and operation of all systems and processes. An important method for the continuous improvement of products’ and services’ quality is the competitive comparison between the practices followed by other companies in the same sector. Other effective methods are the stimulation of the personnel, changing the organizational culture, staff training, controlling of processes, investing in technological equipment, controlling of purchased products, better logistics, and the standardization of businesses’ procedures

4. Strategic quality planning 

Strategic quality plans deemed as the cohesive fabric that holds together the quality improvement efforts. The degree of commitment to the quality and stability of the whole effort is shown by the fact that quality management is embedded in an organization's business plan. The necessary organizational structures to support the project are the clear responsibility of the top management, the existence of mechanisms for coordinating activities and the creation of group shapes for the implementationand implementation of the improvements. Quality programming is a component ofthe management strategy. Thus, when implementing the organization's policy,there is a guarantee that quality policies at each administrative level stem from and are consistent with the business plan

5. Quality, speed, and prevention

Quality design and the prevention of defects anderrors are considered to be the primary aim of implementing quality systems. In order to do this, quality should be incorporated into the products and services provided, as well as in the processes that produce them. 

6. Management of Human Resources 

If a company aspires to offer products and services of high quality to satisfy their customers, it is important to engage all employees into their tasks. To do this, the employees of businesses should be distinguished by a high degree of commitment, education, and involvement in all quality improvement activities.

7. Fact-based management

Achieving high quality and performance goals requires that the organization's management is firmly based on reliable information, data, and data analysis. Work flow performance and progress indicators and accurate trend analyzes show the characteristics of products, services, processes, and operations, and help track progress and work results.

title: Hiring employees based on rooted interests
description:
People who are deeply and passionately interested in activities that define their work are more likely to be successful in their work. The interests through which people are generally expressed are the application of technology, quantitative analysis, creative production, the role of counselor and mentor, the management of individuals and relationship management, the control of the company, and the deafness through language and ideas.

People with a lifelong interest in implementing technology are particularly curious to find better ways to use technology to resolve business concerns. People with this lifelong interest are often enjoying the work that has to do with the design and analysis of brewing and operating systems, as well as the redesign of business processes. 

Some people are not just good at handling numbers but they are distinguished in it. They see it as the best and some carriers the only way to find solutions. Similarly, mathematics considers fun. These people do not hold positions that reflect this lifelong ingrained interest. In fact, there are few who serve other types of work for mistaken reasons because they had told them that if they followed their real passion, they would limit the prospects of their careers. To locate people with this particular interest, look for those who are thrilled by cash flow, sales forecasting methods and other number-based activities. If a commercial manager is more interested in analyzing customer data than what is said in a queue group of customers, then he is likely to be a quantitative analyst.

For some people, nothing generates more enjoyment than thinking and mixing for abstract concepts. People with this interest can be thrilled by the development of business models that explain competition within a particular industry or analyze the competitive position of a business within a particular market. To mark a man of theory and ideas, look for someone who could easily pursue a university career, subscribe to scientific journals, and enjoy conversations around abstract concepts.

People that are involved in creative production are wide-ranging without putting their thoughts in contexts. They are comfortable and participate in brainstorming sessions. Many entrepreneurs, research and development scientists and engineers have this lifelong interest. It is easy to spot these people. The outfit outside the conventional frames betrays them. They are also less interested in the features of the products that are already in circulation and more about anything new on the market.

Counselors and mentors love to teach. In attendance, teaching takes the form of guidance and counseling. Many people like to feel they are useful to others; some are honestly satisfied by the success of those they have consulted. To find a counselor/mentor just look at the rook that interacts with people you are directly referring to.

People managing individuals and relationships with this lifelong interest enjoy working with people on a daily basis. They draw satisfaction from their relationships in the field of cooperation but focus much more on results than people in the category of symbols and mentors. 

People involved in the business audit are people who like to have responsibilities. They are delighted when they have the power to make decisions. A person with such lifelong interest wants usually to be the CEO.

It is much easier to help employees acquire or enhance their knowledge and experience than to make them feel ever lasting passion for their job. Of course, knowledge and experience play an important role in matching the right person in the right place. However, new recruits must have the appropriate background, experience and ability to perform their work well and fairly quickly. And yet a perfect match of interests increases the likelihood of remaining more of an employee in the company than a perfect match of knowledge and experience.

title: Retaining the employees that benefit your company
description:
In this article, we will present you some tips that will help you to retain employees that can enhance your company’s performance and the company’s operation efficacy. 

1. Do have a good start with new employees: Ensuring agood start is done by hiring people who are fit to the intended position and ensuring that they perceive adherence to the culture of the company, as well as the details of its placement their work. A good attitude is also achieved by setting new employees which makes them feel welcome as members of the team.

2. Create an excellent environment with supervisors that employees' respect: Managers often think that the company's policies and culture define the work environment. They define it to a certain extent. However, policies can be circumvented. Whatever the atmosphere is, the company's culture as a whole is also important. Bad supervisors do not promote an excellent environment. How many of your unit's managers or superiors are being disliked by their employees? How many have outbursts of rage or blaming others for their own successes, or they never say "Thanks, you did a good job". If your directors or supervisors are unpopular, be sure that each employee with tradable qualifications will leave. Ultimately, it is better to replace bad managers and vice versa to replace an endless number of employees.

3. Share information: Having employees access to all information needed shows that you trust them, that they are important partners, and that you respect their ability to understand and contribute to the business as a whole.

4. Give to people as much autonomy as they can handle: Many employees like to work with minimal supervision. So, give people as much supervision as they can handle. In this way, you will make them happier while making your own managerial work easier. Ask a team to explore a new market on its own or solve a business problem.

5. Challenging your employees: Usually, employees enjoy the challenge and the feeling that you trust them. So, place the people you want most to keep on projects and urge them to overcome their abilities, simultaneously supporting them in their attempt. 

6. Provide employees with flexibility: Managers know that minimal working arrangements help to keep workers alive. Flexible work schedules and telework were effective in enhancing retention. Of course, not every manager has the power to introduce completely new working patterns. Nonetheless, almost everyone can afford some flexibility depending on the situation allowing employees to arrange their work, to take care of a sick child or to go to a doctor appointment. Today's employees with many obligations appreciate such flexibility. 

7. Design cautiously the jobs to encourage employee retention: Nothing is more boring than when the same things are repeated. So, if you see unacceptably high refresh rates in a critical category of posts, look at exactly what you ask people to do every day. You may be able to resolve the problem of refreshing by redesigning the job: adding variety to repetitive work, by injecting case-staffed employees into workgroups, subtracting their interest, etc. If a job involves one or more repellent jobs consider removing them or outsource them.

8. Highlight the possible spacers in time: The pleasant working environment and the excellent jobs are a matter of opinion, what fascinates someone can scare you anymore. You do not know how well you do in one case or another if you do not try it. As a manager, you are working on a daily basis and share your views with your existing ones. Think about promoting your communication and tracking of absenteeism. This will help you locate possible distances and get timely responses. Make an interview by asking your employees how they feel about the responsibilities they have been assigned, about company policies, and the work environment. Also, ask them for their personal goals, whether they feel part of the corporate culture or not what would they keep in the company.

title: The benefits of teleworking
description:
Many companies have discovered that telework is an effective tool for achieving work-life balance. The term telework describes the work performed by employees in places other than their physical offices and is facilitated by electronic communications and the Internet. 

In particular, teleworking is the use of telecommunication to work where necessary to meet the needs of the customer: whether it is your home office, a telework center, a satellite office, a customer's office, an airport bill, a room hotel, a local Starbucks, or from your office with a colleague located ten floors below in the same building.

Supporters of teleworking focus on significant cost constraints and benefits, such as lower real estate costs, greater worker productivity, greater employee loyalty and satisfaction, and lower staff renewal rates. While teleworkers themselves report that teleworking helps them to balance work and their personal responsibilities, it was argued that:

·        teleworkers spend more hours on their job

·        telework is more efficient

·        gratification and devotion to project demands are increasing

·        training and retaining good employees is easier

·        the balance between work and personal life is easier to achieve

·        resources are saved by the company due to lack of realestate costs

Nonetheless, telework does not fit into any company. Teleworking is appropriate when companies:

·        focused on new operating modes

·        offer services

·        are dynamic, non-hierarchical, and technologically advanced

·        care commands driven

·        are willing to invest in media and education

Teleworking also requires the adjustment of directors and supervisors. Directors must concentrate on results rather than on activities. This means setting clear targets for each teleworker, ensuring that they understand these goals, and setting up a system to control progress on a short-term basis. Directors need to find ways to integrate teleworkers into the broader set; otherwise, the latter can isolate themselves and not be in touch with developments. Teleworking is clearly a new challenge for directors, but it has significant benefits, particularly in terms of saving work and balancing personal life.

Another great advantage of teleworking is flexible working hours. Flexible working hours are a mechanism that helps workers achieves a balance between work and personal life. Flexible hours allow employees to work different hours from the usual. This enables people to work even when they look after their young children, their relatives,etc.
The flexible working hours can take many forms, such as training hours, reduced hours, home-day work, and programmed hours. Particularly:

·        Training hours: For example, an employee can work from 1 to 5 hours while3 or 4 hours could be devoted to learning new things that contribute to increasing the efficacy of their job. 

·        Reduced hours: For example, a working mother could work from 1 to 6 hours so as to fulfill the need to go her children to their school every morning. 

·        Home-day work: For example, a tax consultant works for about 6 hours a week in the period from January to April to meet the increased need to file clients’ tax returns and 3 hours a week for the rest of the year

·        Programmed Hours: Fore xample, computer technicians to deal with the weekend with the theatrical group devote 4 hours from Monday to Thursday leaving vacancies on Fridays for rehearsals.

Flexible working hours are valued by many workers. Even more importantly, they enlarge the pool of candidate workers. If you define very closely who can work here on a nine-to-five basis from Monday to Friday, then a lot of qualified people will be automatically excluded

title: Quality management in the business competitive environment
description:
Improving quality in products and services is a fundamental component of businesses’ modern competitive strategy. Businesses that are firmly committed to improving quality develop an essential culture alongside a good reputation. 

First of all, the entrepreneurial spirit (in its proper manifestations) is vital. It is necessary to find the golden incision that puts the most modern approaches of management in the service of entrepreneurial spirit, something that can lead to very strong competitive advantages. Many enterprises in developed economies that apply the latest in management, are trying hard to boost the entrepreneurial spirit of managers and their employees.

Secondly, the clients and their needs and desires must listen carefully. Let’s not forget that many businesses have not even begun to move towards this goal. But that's just the beginning. Marketing without the best value product or service is doomed in the long run. 

All companies that are virtually missing from the international competitive game do not have to fall into the trap of irrepressible and defensive marketing. On the other hand, the rules of the international competitive game have already been written by others. On the contrary, it has the trumps needed for innovation, a movement initiative, a daring for new, better products. Not just for good or cheaper products.

Competition leads to a comparison of forces which protects the common interest, ie the mere consumer from the creation of monopolies. Competition between existing companies can be manifested in a number of ways, such as price competition, newproducts, customer service levels, warranties, advertising and better wholesale distributors' networks. It is therefore extremely important tohave healthy conditions of competition in an economy.

Therefore, the key factors for increasing competitiveness are the proper staff training and the proper organization of businesses’ activities. The good organization relates to the organizational capacity of the company, higher information systems, the ability to respond rapidly to shifts in market conditions, the accurate technical assistance, and use smart advertising. Respectively, companies’ staff should be well trained and work in harmony with managers to provide high quality services with a smile, have experience in a given technology, product innovation capability, the ability to use theInternet and manage the various business activities, and have sales skills.

In other words, good quality control expertise and attractive identification are applied. Finally, an element of good organization is the ability to bring new products to the market quickly as well as low distribution costs. The quality of the services alone is not enoughto create a competitive advantage. The most important and successful factor is the ability of a company to add value to the consumer in relation to the value attributed to it by the rest of the competition.

So, in order to be competitive and offer services that are accessible to customers, businesses must be able to follow some basic steps that are:

1. A business is required to put in place appropriate mechanisms to be able to capture customers' expectations of product quality, quality of service and reasonable delivery rates.

2. Customer expectations are always determined in relation to the alternatives proposed by the competition. 

3. Customer expectations are dynamic. This means thata survey simply translates customers' views at a time.

4. Product quality and quality of service should extend to all channels of products’and service’s’ distribution

For an enterprise that wants to be considered committed to customer service, it must be able to translate consumers' needs, desires, expectations, offer of a product, which should contain much more than the product which is perceived by the consumer himself. It is very difficult to think of a productthat is not accompanied and not supported by service components.

title: Allocate your marketing communication budget
description:
The marketing communication budget allocation of any project needs to be determined and selected the media that has the minimum costs with the higher profits and benefits for the company in terms of quick message dissemination and consumer’s attraction. For this reason, quantitative and qualitative media planning should be organized. An appropriate allocation method is to combine both traditional and digital media so as to balance the benefits and the risk of the company’s strategy by developing good communication with the targeted customers. 

The main goal of such an investment is to raise awareness about the product/service benefits, highlights the brand, create a professional image of the company, and inform the customers about the products so as to increase sales. As a matter of fact, the overall available budget should be defined with the propose to be allocated in communication activities based on the above criteria, taking into consideration the budget of previous years so as to measure their usefulness and enhance them with new ad ventures hopefully improving the quality and the efficacy of the communication strategy. 

Traditional media can help to achieve companies’ profitability by increasing sales volume because they transmit messages relating to the particularities of each product, while digital media contributes to ameliorating brand equity and the involvement of customers. 

In particular, digital media is more appropriate to expand product’sspecification, because it offers a strong interaction between the company and customers who are able to give feedback, answer to questionnaires in websites, provide suggestions for product improvement etc. Armed with these tools, digital media can influence the beliefs and the customer’s attitudes about the product and establish a trustworthy relationship between the consumers and the brand. As complementary to the above purposes, the traditional media should also implement at a half percent for customers that are not fond of the Internet. 

Also, the digital media serves to increase brand awareness and company’s image due to the advent of the rapid pace of the technology and a lot of people that they use them. So, for products that belong to the growth or early maturity phase of LPC digital marketing is more preferable as it engages customers into product’s promotion. Besides, through the available online platforms, in which customers can interact with each other and communicate with representatives of the company, the company may achieve a better interface with its customers, as the latter understand that the company try to meet their demands and want to satisfy their needs eventually leading to building strong bonds of trust with the brand.  Moreover, people exchange experiences about the brand, companies start to have funs, followers and thus its reputation is expanded a lot globally. 

Aligned with this, traditional media can have a counter balancing function and companies should invest less money in it so as to be achieved brand visibility for those that are not involved in the digital market. 

Therefore, it is suggested that it should be allocated from $400 to $10,000 to branding, $3,500 to $15,000 in websites, $1,500-$4,000 to social media, $300 per month to $3,000 in ad content, and $250 to $1,000 to events and $500 to $800 in traditional media. In general terms, new companies could allocate 12 to 20 percent of its gross revenue on marketing, while established companies between 6 and 12 percent of their gross revenue. Another interesting approach is to create a  “safe” budget which includes 70% of the budget be allocated to “tried and true” channels, 20% allocated to “safe bets”, and 10% allocated to “experimental”. Undoubtedly, all these values should be examined according to the objectives of the company and the prime areas that they want to focus more

title: Design Thinking and Business
description:
In operation management, structural decisions play an important role in succeeding a business. However, much of this attempt may entail putting a great effort on behalf of managers to coordinate the available companies’ resources and the dynamic of the workforce. On the other hand, design thinking is a solution-based approach that promotes the idea of simplicity as the essential element of business success.

In particular, in the last decades, the design thinking is gaining in popularity as there are numerous examples of prestigious companies that follow this path with exquisite outcomes. This is because design thinking drives marketers’ consideration not only on how to ameliorate the products’ benefits or improve customers’ product perception but also on creating a visualized approach. This approach is human-centered since it puts the creativity at the forefront of the marketing plan. To be more specific, design thinking refers to a method of meeting people’s needs and desires in a technologically feasible and strategically viable way which requires the active participation of customers and rapid prototyping.

The design thinking involves particular steps that managers should follow. The first step includes the empathic understanding of the problem and customers’ needs which entails a lot of research on that. Second, it is imperative to be defined the problem by analyzing the data that gathered in the first stage, while the third stage which is the most important, involves the generation of many ideas. In this step, managers visualize the problem using a human-centered approach meaning that they examine the human needs. To do this, they start thinking about ideas and the alternatives that they have to approach the problem. In this context, it has expressed some valuable ideation techniques that help the managers to more innovative and creative, such as the Brainstorm, Brainwriting, Worst Possible Idea, and Scamper method. The fourth stage is experimental and includes the prototype procedure in which the solutions apply in a small sample of users with the view to re-examining their efficacy concerning the reactions of the users with the product or the service. Therefore, the potential problems are detected making the evaluation of each idea feasible. Finally, the solution that is selected tests in a broader range of users, so that to identify the perception of the people about the invention and their feelings about it enabling the “inventor” to choose the preferable alternative.

 So, it can be said that design thinking is the most pioneering idea expressed in the context of operation management because it solves customers’ everyday problems and satisfies their daily needs. Besides, if we add to this that the rapid rhythm of life makes things being very complicated, it becomes obvious that customers do not want to be involved in extra and sophisticated procedures.

This inclination urges customers not to experience the same things that dealt with daily but to test something new and convenient that makes their life better as the simplicity is what they are really looking for. Apart from that, simplicity becomes a competitive advantage for companies if we take into account the other numerous benefits that design thinking offers. To be more specific, simplicity reduces the costs of manufacturing a product or deliverer services since there is no need for extra expenses for the amelioration of the featuring design but only for imaginary thinking. That is to say that, instead of finding distributional channels or intermediaries to process the products, managers can create new experiences and approach the clients through beginning fruitful conversations with the customers.

Therefore, simplicity ensures customer retentionand their loyalty as customers feel that the company is close to their needsand can meet their expectations.

title: Cultural intelligence and its contribution to leaders’ efficacy
description:
In the twenty-first century with the advent of globalization, Cultural intelligence is admittedly an essential capability that leaders should have so that prospers the organization that they work for, as many organizations have become multinational. This is inevitable since leaders should be able to adapt their behavior to different circumstances and administrate employees’ behaviors that embrace different cultural perceptions. 

To do this, the main cross-cultural competencies that leaders should have are relational skills, harmonizer skills, and adaptability skills. Cultural intelligence skills help leaders to better guide the employees, improve their jobperformance, and establish a cross-cultural strategy that makes easier to be applied in the change management process. Also, understanding the cultural differences between the employees and knowing the ways in which employees should adjust their behavior accordingly to circumstances creates better working conditions and enhance the communication between the leaders and employees; ultimately ensuring not only the employees’ well-being but also greater profitability on their work. 

Apart from that, leaders, who are aware of the cultural intelligence procedure, have the ability to resolve effectively potential conflicts that emerge among employees with different cultural backgrounds as they are great negotiators and function as the best harmonizers. These skills are of paramount importance, given that nowadays; multinational organizations operate all over the world, and leaders and employees should cooperate with people that have different cultural perceptions which sometimes may contradict. 

As a matter of fact, finding a code of communication is very crucial and it is the leaders’ responsibility to ensure and establish a common ground between employees by acting as a model of behavior and by explaining to them the steps that should be followed so as to become culturally sensitive. To achieve this, leaders should first understand and embrace the cultural diversity in order to inspire employees to follow in their footsteps and making them easily involved in cultural training programs that they are sometimes boring for employees. 

Furthermore, cultural intelligence skills and skills related to self-awareness and metacognitive knowledge are also essential in evaluating employees’ actions concerning cultural situations and interpret these results so as to measure the effectiveness of the strategy applied by them and whether there is a need of changing or adjusting specific behaviors. 

Additionally, given that leaders should cooperate with many and different personalities, it is imperative to feel confident about their leading skills and methods so as to be a source of inspiration of them and facilitate their mimic process. 

Finally, cultural intelligence is a very important component of leadership due to the fact that gives a deep insight into the strategies that should be adopted so that employees adjust their behavior to the ever-changing market conditions. As a matter of fact, cultural intelligence facilitates leaders to take quick and wise choices on cultural situations, simultaneously permitting them to focus onother parameters of the project being sure that cultural conflicts will not emerge as they are confident with the way that administrates this issue.

title: Ethical leadership and the businesses’ consequences of lack in ethical leaders
description:
If we want togive a brief description of ethical leaders, we would say that they are people who decide and act on the basis of moral values. Moral leaders have clear values, are fair and honest, have communication skills, are interested in others and are trustworthy. 

Moral leaders as professionals, beyond the key characteristics of leaders, such as the creation of clear vision, motivation, inspiration, they disseminate ethical value to employees, communicate the way decisions are made, keep the promises that they give to employees, they reward the employees’ moral behavior, they scold employees who violate moral standards, they are fair, and they always take ethics into account when making decisions.

Moral leaders honestly exercise their duties and guide and manage employees. Shareholders, employees and other stakeholder groups, such as suppliers and the local community in which the business is active, want and deserve to enjoy a moral response and attitude. 

However, the need for ethical leadership may become more apparent than the analysis of the impact of a company when it is absent. Some of the consequences are as follows:

1. The collapse of corporate culture 

If leaders do not behave in an ethical manner, they lose theircredibility and reputation to the business world. Also, given that an efficient business is based on credibilityand equity, leaders cannot successfully fulfill their roles. As a result of this phenomenon, more and more employees plunge into unethical behavior to the point where practices will become norms. Therefore, the entire corporate culture will collapse.

2. The reduction in the value of the shareholders

Many companies saw the value of their shares collapse as a result of moral problems and their consequences. The role of so-called "golden boys" in precipitating the value of well-known multinational companies and in shaping the gloomy financial crisis is a recenttrend. If leaders are not governed by moral values it is easier to adopt dubious economic and business practices. However, the consequences of disclosing these practices, especially for companies listed on the stock exchange have proved to be disastrous forbusinesses’ sustainability and thus for shareholders’ interest. 

3. The defamation 

The business irresponsibility demonstrated by well-known companies worldwide over the last decades has brought them to court trips and has caused them considerable defamation and harm. It takes twenty years to build the company's reputation and five minutes to be destroyed. As a consequence of this, today, there is a growing tendency for leaders to look beyond the close interest of shareholders, employees, and suppliers. Keep in mind that the general public is a part of a socially responsible behavior of the company which tends to occupy a higher priority in matters of management agenda.

4. The inability to attract talented workers

When it becomes known to the public that a company resorts to unethical practices employees usually are afraid of applying for a job position in these Companies because of their bad reputation to the market. Respectively, talented employees who are aware of their talents aspire to have a brilliant career and therefore, they feel hesitant to be involved in companies that do not inspire trust. Ingeneral, good and talented executives do not like tobe employed in businesses where there are no clear rules and no respect for ethical and moral values

5. The swelling of the regulatory environment 

When businesses experience unethical behavior, the need for amore regulatory environment is growing. This phenomenon makes it hard for allcompanies operating in the economy and resulting in increasing companies’operating costs.

So, the best advice for companies is to try to find leaders that embrace ethical values and are adept at disseminating them to the whole company’s members. In this way, the employees’ morale along with the organization of the company’s structure will be significantly enhanced!

title: Challenges in having diversified employees
description:
Retention is a particularly difficult task when the workforce is highly diversified. And that's the type of workforce that high-ranking executives face in many parts of the world. From age and gender, to part-time and full-time status, ethnicity, race, sexual orientation and physical ability companies benefit from the differences between employees. Uniform strategies for maintaining good staff simply do not work anymore. Companies can improve employee retention rates by formulating creative and specialized strategies for every major part of the workforce.

The members of the temporary workforce, part-time workers, project promoters and temporary workers provide some important advantages, as well as challenging managerial and human resource departments.

The main advantages include:

· Exhibition, as companies can personalize the timetables of these employees to deal with their current workflow and demand by using them only when they are charged.

· Economic capability as businesses employing temporary agents, part-time workers, or freelancers spends money on payroll taxes, health insurance, and other costs.

Challenges include:

· A high degree of renewal that introduces unpredictability and instability into the enterprise culture

· High degree of commitment to the business and its products

· Increasing demand for the same benefits that regular employees enjoy, such as job satisfaction and career development support.

Because the extraordinary workforce is a valuable resource, many companies are currently developing programs specifically designed to maintain these employees.

Also, the younger workers, especially those aged 20 to 30, bring energy, vitality and advanced technology knowledge to the workforce of a business. Young workers are particularly keen to chart their career paths and take up a job that will help them advance to their next jobs.

Nonetheless, many new and young employees are very comfortable with quick changes and flat management structures from their older colleagues. This may create misunderstandings and tensions in the workplace between the two generations, especially when the presbyter and the immediate person come from different expectations of their work.

Many new employees want their employer to determine for them their progress - a career path that will gradually enable them to reach a level of pay that will enable them to maintain their new families. How can your business respond to the needs of newcomers, keeping the best of them?

 You should first understand their background and personalize their work accordingly. Young people know about the contraction in the experience of their parents. They have accepted the reality that sometimes it is not certain in the business world. So, they believe in their own skills. If there is a group for which modifying work or assigning a "tire" project is not just a good but necessary idea, this group is the inactive workers. 

Also, employees that are above 50 years old need attention for two reasons. First, in some companies they represent a good percentage of employees. Secondly, mature workers have extensive knowledge and rich business experience, so they are a big part of the intellectual capital of each company. Many have qualifications, such as credibility, patience or impartial qualifications, acquired only through their daily, multiannual engagement in the performance of their duties.

In order to keep these employees to your company, you may need to create a workplace where the usual practices in terms of job description, hours, earnings, and so on are removed. Remember these tips:

Ask mature workers what their needs are, give them flexibility, make their work more interesting, and adjust the pay system.

Companies cannot scorn the talent they have because they are different from the rest of the people .Every talented employee is valuable and finding ways to stay in the company has business sense.

title: Marketing-based employees’ retention strategies
description:
Marketing-based employees’ retention strategy requires redesigning work personalization, strengthening social ties and hiring people with the least mobility. Linking employees who may leave with the job opportunities that appear within the company is still a clever tool in their quest to preserve them.

Another way is by adopting new salary plans. Those employees consider that remuneration is not a remarkable strategy for retaining staff. Remuneration is important in the sense that you cannot attract or retain the employees you desire if the latter consider their remuneration to be unfair or uncompetitive. Even people who are more interested in their profession and less money are aware of their own as an indication that the company values their connotation and their abilities. If they feel underestimated, they will leave.

However, remuneration is not a credible motive. Incentives often used by employers, including wage increases result in the best possible temporary improvement in performance. It is clear that other strategies are more adept at conservation issues. You must gradually pay out the bonuses you have agreed. For example, bonuses are paid to the new CEO within 5 years. 

Remuneration is of great importance. However, as a matter of keeping staff, it is easier to manage it more easily than corporate culture. Here are some strategies for setting up a proper pay system:

See what salaries your sector offers: You can assign this work to an advisory firm or apply the following economical options:

·        Locate registered adsonline

·        Get in touch with people working in search engines

·        Consult professionalc ouncils

·        Consider Internal Wage Disparities: Ensure that the pay for each job is broadly the same as that for similar jobs across the company.

·        Do not feel surpassed by your competitors: Just make sure that you can meet the most important needs of your employees

Redesigning the job isanother retention strategy. If you can identify those elements that satisfy but also embarrass a worker in a particular position, then you are able to completely remove the unpleasant places and assign them to other people whowill appreciate them. Think about it. What aspects of this work are unhappy with employees?
If we remove the unacceptable seating from that position, we should add something else to consider the position holographic and what is it?
Assuming that someone has to take up the unpredictable tasks which alternatives are there for their handling.
What does it cost more for the company, the redesign of the position or theexisting rate of renewal shown by this workplace?

Companies are almost always trying to match people with jobs. Written job descriptions and workplace scheduling analyze in detail the tasks and the rendered performance by dictating where, when and how the work will be done. The expectation is that people will comply with descriptions of where, when, and how, which inreality can be highly arbitrary.

To understand the power of personalization, study the aspect of the economy for products and services. In this area, competitive markets have led businesses to provide personalized up to a pointof products. Personalization is a powerful tool in any market where demand is less than supply, including the labor market. To personalize a job to meet the needs of both the company and the workers, think about what, where and how thisparticular position.

title: Managing employees who perform poorly in their work
description:
Each company has individuals whose performance varies; while not all employees are capable of promotion. At the top, there are people whose performance is rated A, meaning their contribution is excellent. Those who score B are doing a good job and people with a grade C do a job that is just acceptable. 

The contribution of the groups to the profit increase differs significantly. On average, A-rated managers increase the company's profits. C-rated managers in the same companies did not achieve profits. This raises the question as to where resources should be concentrated on the development of Sigurur career skills, investing in the development of A and B performance individuals are perfectly reasonable. But does it stand with C-rated people? Doyou have to invest in their growth or simply remove them?

Some companies periodically degrade managers with performance C, while others try to make them fall. But most do nothing to deal with the problem. The cost of this indifference is high both from the point of departure of good employees and from the lack of profit growth.
Every C-rated person has a role and hence prevents the progress and evolution of the rest of the people in the company. At the same time, those who perform for C are usually not good nor are they good mentors for others.

Some solutions to combat this problem

·        Recognize people with C score performance. Iti s certain that some of these individuals can substantially improve their performance if they are given the direction and educational support they require. At this point, the types of skills and the quality of training can bring significant results.

·        Make managers responsible for improving or removing people with moderate performance. People with a C performance can run off a company and should therefore be removed into low-level positions where they can be eliminated in A-rated individuals. If they fail to improve on preparing for these new posts, they consider that the interest of the company would be to expel them.

However, investing in people with moderate performance may worth. The only way to learn if such people deserve the attention of the company is by making an estimate of how much a company's performance would improve if it were able to promote a C-rated person to the next highest levels. What would be the cost in relation to the benefits? Are costs less than the benefits? If the cost outweighs the benefits, then the solution is either to move the person to a place where he or she can respond better or ask him/her to leave the company.

An additional tip that I would like to remember is that you should not hurry to your assessment. You should be careful in examining the performance of your company and take the proper decisions that benefit your company and not only the company’s short-term goals. Think big and outside of the box and you will find what to do with your managers’ performance!

title: Computer Science: How do digital signatures work?
description:
Computer Science: How do digital signatures work? 

Applying the Signature

1. When you click "sign", a unique digital fingerprint (called a hash) of the document is created using a mathematical algorithm. This hash is specific to this particular document; even the slightest change would result in a different hash.

2. The hash is encrypted using the signer's private key. The encrypted hash and the signer's public key are combined into a digital signature, which is appended to the document http://idltechnologies.com/DigitalSignature.aspx

3. The digitally signed document is ready for distribution.

Verifying the Signature

1. When you open the document in a digital signature-capable program (e.g., Adobe Reader, Microsoft Office), the program automatically uses the signer's public key (which was included in the digital signature with the document) to decrypt the document hash.

2. The program calculates a new hash for the document. If this new hash matches the decrypted hash from Step 1, the program knows the document has not been altered and displays messaging alone the lines of, "The document has not been modified since this signature was applied."

The program also validates that the public key used in the signature belongs to the signer and displays the signer's name.

Hope it will help

You can apply for the Digital Signature Certificate by clicking on the link. http://idltechnologies.com/DigitalSignature.aspx" target="_blank">http://idltechnologies.com/DigitalSignature.aspx/a>

title: The gold rules of time management
description:
Time management is crucial for every organization in order to operate all departments efficiently. For this reason, in this article, we will present a list of things that managers and leaders should take into accounting when it comes to organizing their plans and strategies. 

The 'Do It' List

1.     Make a list of tasks to be done: Revise it daily. Texts are better left in memory. Note the degree of their importance. Also, make a list of short and long-term jobs. From them create daily lists of the day's work. 

2.     Prioritization: Determine important from urgency. Urgency has a direct and significant effect. Do not be tempted to do it easily by devoting 20% of the work produces to achieve 80% of the results. Locate this 20% and give it priority.

3.      Redefining the day leaving the best time for the best job: Take action for the most important jobs at the time of the day you're in shape. Many keep their best form for trivial things. Keep the routine work for the moment you are tired. 

4.     Productive wait: Think about the time spent in in waiting. Big things are accomplished at shortintervals. It is good to deal with things you do not particularly like. And when you start, you will usually continue.

5. Achieving the great start-up: We usually avoid having to deal with important issues as they push us emotionally. That is why we have usually avoided setting a deadline for our work. Good tactics is to break big projects into smaller ones and until we feel comfortable we get started. This breakage helps to avoid in decision and overload. Set deadlines for smallerp rojects to meet the required time of the big one. Rearrangement will be the feeling of accomplishment.

6. Doubling money: It's about doing more than one job at the same time. Avoid doing something important where much energy is needed to avoid mistakes. 

7. Do it Now: The fear of something grows constantly through imagination as it goes beyond the limits of reality. Preventive anxiety is worse than action. Ask yourself why you are late. There is a lack of information, a lack of self-confidence, a lack of stimulation or a starting point. Indecision is the greatest "time thief". Making it now saves time and effort. In the case of 95% lack of information there will be no better information in the future. If you need additional information, take a shot to get them.

8. Organizing your place: A place for every thing and every thing in its place. Archiving saves time. Horizontal archiving is more effective than vertical. The mountain of papers in the office usually consists of things that you will decide later, you do not like doing it, you hope they will disappear, and they are difficult to be handled.

Following the previous rules will help to create the time you need to protect. If you are exhausted, it is unlikely to work effectively. Take care of yourself, find time to rest and do not face life as a continuous fight. No one wrote in the funeral plaque "I would like to spend more time in the office”.

title: What are the elements of a good team leader?
description:
There are some features that distinguish good from less good leaders and make them stand out. Regardless of where the leader works, small or bigger businesses, NGOs, or government agencies, the only sure thing is that when there is a set of people, someone needs to be able to - and have the right knowledge - to lead. Without underestimating the necessity of the team and the cooperation, there is no doubt that when good leaders are present, their presence benefits the whole team. Especially nowadays, it is important to have personalities in companies that can inspire and guide properly.

However, keep in mind that the team is not a group of people who work together but a set of people who trust each other. Trust is an emotion and cannot be demanded by someone or imposed. People trust each other when they share common beliefs, have the same code of values, and participate in the definition of companies’ vision because they feel that it is their own responsibility to make this vision a reality. When the vision exceeds personal benefits, the purpose is gentle.

So, good team leaders are distinguished by their ability to turn a set of people into a real team. They have the ability to function as a "weight-loss triangle" and maintain the quality characteristics of relationships within a group at a high level.  For this reason, the coaching acts as a catalyst to illuminate black spots in the communication circle and empowers the team leader's empathy to understand behaviors and manage them creating not just balance but also stability that will lead safely to success. Theymust have the ability to tame and curb the momentum of the team members who have the greatest potential and to speed up and strengthen the effort of the weaker members with the ultimate goal of eliminating the gap between them and creating a balanced climate. As a matter of fact, a good team leader is required to demonstrate skills, such as empathy, insight, immediacy, integrity, parity and speed of decision-making and problem management. 

Good team leaders envision not focusing only on the present but also looking at the future. They ask more than they answer. They listen more than they speak. They have no desires or wishes for the future but goals and they are familiar with the targeting process. In other words, they do not set blind goals but objectives that meet the vision.

They set together with their team the criteria of success and achievement of goals, so that the entire team can be recognized as a success. While this happens, they reward their team and celebrate with them. Good team leaders make timetables in planning towards achieving the goal, examining for each step what it can go wrong to be able to manage it better. 

Also, good team leaders should be able to understand the attitude of their team members correctly and objectively. And only with this, we can understand that the good team leaders are few and scarce. If there were so many who thought they were good, then thee cosystem of the business world would be different to the positive. 

Now let’ssummarize some points.. 

1. Leaders give the good example first. They lead by their behavior; they become the model that all employees want to imitate.
2. They constantly keep their team focused on the goal. They know where they want to go and communicate it with their team.

3. They share with their team all their information and knowledge about how to do the job better. 

4. They reward without delay their associates - each member of the team - when they do their job well and much more when they surpass their expectations. 

5. They do not turn a blind eye when employees failed. They explain to them what they do not do well, immediately and clearly. 

Finally, successful team leaders cultivate an environment where all team members can collaborate harmoniously; an environment where each team member transcend himself/herself and meets excellence, recognition and reward!

title: Jet Set Fly Speaks of the 5 trends of e-Commerce to be Taken into Account in 2019
description:
Online purchases continue to increase in the US UU Recent reports show that the e-Commerce industry grew by 16%, or approximately $ 460 billion, in 2017 alone.

We hope that this trend continues and we encourage companies in the sectors of business to consumer (B2C) and business to business (B2B) not to miss this opportunity.

Listed below are the 5 e-commerce trends that will definitely gained highlights in 2019:

Machine learning and artificial intelligence

Machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) are becoming an integral part of many industries, and e-Commerce is no different.

A more personalized experience as an online buyer expectation becomes demanding, AI and machine learning is now necessary elements of a successful web shop.

Negative feedback will be reduces through these technologies as they provide specific shopping experience. These technologies will be increasing in use in 2019.

Search by voice

Voice search is usefulness is gaining popularity. It is now seems as a necessary factor in search engine dominance.

It is now recorded that 20% of all search engine activities are based on voice search. This trend is also applicable to e-Commerce. Forbes reports that the current voice purchase market of $ 2 billion will grow to $ 40 billion by 2020.

This massive increase in market share will only continue as buyers accept Alexa-type voice assistants for their daily shopping activities.

Convenient shipping and collection of products

With 40% of the total participation in the e-Commerce market, Amazon leads the way, especially in regard to logistics.

The normal behavior of deliveries on the same day or the next day will be affected and change as companies compete to immerse as Amazon’s customers first choice.

There will be other changes that can benefit buyers like month monthly shipping subscriptions, unpaid programs, and "buy online / pick up offline".

Augmented Reality

As e-Commerce companies try to improve their sales techniques, augmented reality could become a successful tool.

Most of today's buyers use online stores to collect information about products, but a large percentage is still in favor of making final purchases in physical stores.

So what guides this behavior? Online purchases involve uncertainty which is the factor to this behavior according to research.

When a person shop or buy in the internet, he or she cannot really see the actual item and they cannot touch it either. You have to use your imagination and fill in those blanks. For some buyers, that's good enough.

For others, not so much. With augmented reality added to an existing e-commerce site, companies can help their customers obtain a "real-life" product experience.

Giants like IKEA and Amazon already use these technologies, but we can expect this trend to extend to the medium and even to some small companies throughout 2019 and 2020.

 

Chatbots customer service

Although still underdeveloped in some parts of the world, customer service chatbots are reaching the spotlight with commercial and e-Commerce websites and we can expect to see more of this in 2019.

In fact, chatbots will be the first direct experience of many consumers with automation based on artificial intelligence.

The similarities to human service make this chatbots capable to be on the same level of customer services guidance.

Where they fall short is in non-typical situations, and this can be potentially harmful to businesses.

 

 

The Jet Set Fly movement is really about you, we are inviting you to grow with us. We are about motivating the hungry, purpose driven and determined individuals to take initiative and to go after their dreams but more importantly we are about providing the information for you to utilize once you become motivated so you have a complete roadmap to get exactly where you want to be in life.

Everything Josh King Madrid encourages is backed by real results and years of experience. We want you to speed up your personal learning curve, so you can reach success faster with less setbacks.

title: Customer satisfaction measurement systems
description:
The design of customer satisfaction measurement systems is a matter of particular specifications since the disclosure of results internally and externally raises a number of requirements that should be met. Let’s see eight points that are the main features of a successful customer satisfaction measurement system.

1. Emphasis on integrated measurement systems: Oneof the features of customer satisfaction measurement systems should be their integrated character. This means that the internal quality indicators assessed at the same time with customer satisfaction indicators and that allcustomers contact points are covered. An integrated quality indicator system includes both measurement and coordination issues between definitions, methodologies and implementation procedures on a case-by-case basis. 

2. Developing valid methodological frameworks: Customer satisfaction measurement is based on valid methodological frameworks that are developed by specialized executives to measure customer satisfaction as well as link it to other business concepts, such as customer loyalty, and profitability. Customer satisfaction measurement is implemented on a number of occasions with"discounts" on the completeness and reliability of the methodology. This includes designing surveys, designing questionnaires, sampling, how to collect data, quality control of the survey and finally, analysis of the results. 

3. Separation between design, implementation, and assurance of customersatisfaction measurement systems: In most cases, the development of customer satisfaction measurement systems is a result of collaboration between the quality directorates of the respective bodies, specialized consultants for planning and, finally, research firms undertaking the implementation of the surveys. Accordingly to each case, there are variations in the exact way this tripartite schemeworks, but in any case there is a clear separation between the discrete components of customer satisfaction measurement systems. 

4. Emphasis on setting upcontact points between telecoms and customers: The measurement of customer satisfaction indicators should cover the presence of multiple points of contact between the business and customers. In most businesses, one can measure satisfaction metrics per contact point, such as pre-sale, sales, product and service provision, after-sales service, scheduled visits, and emergency service. It is also needed to add the need for different measurements in relation to the type of business customers.

5.Adjustment: Customer satisfaction measurement should not be based solely on "global standards" and so, in spite of the similarities between different systems, customer satisfaction measurement systems need to be adapted to each country and to any business. Also, customer satisfaction measurement systems are constantly adapted and updated to respond to ever-changing market conditions

6.Proactive - Timelessness: Customer satisfaction measurement should include proactive prevention issues before they become bulk and presented to the majority of business customers. In addition, measurements should be timely so that the firm to be able to monitor the evolution of its"relationship" with customers beyond and along with its sales progress.

7.Integration of the system into the general business culture: Customer satisfaction measurement should be integrated into the overall customer service plan, and therefore what is of great importance is the optimal use of measurements in the direction of improving customer service. This means practically that the development of customer satisfaction measurement systems, after a period of validity and dynamism, are policy tools inside the organization both for allocating resources to different agency activities and for targeting at the operational level and administrative units.

title: Employees’ exhaustion and how to deal with it
description:
Exhaustion is the stress from work. Sometimes it is due to the individual but in many cases, it is the result of the culture that prevails in the workplace. Exhaustion usually occurs through lower job satisfaction, less commitment to the company, and increased willingness to do something different. In some cases, you will also see the following warning signs: reduced self-esteem, a decline in the feeling of being able to achieve it, and a neutral or negative attitude towards colleagues and customers. 

Exhaustion is generally the result of long-term involvement in situations with negative characteristics, such as excessive workload, conflicting requirements, unclear objectives, monotonous work, interpersonal conflicts, minimal reward, minimal recognition of employee contributions, failure to achieve clear success.

Therefore, exhaustion is not only a function of the number of hours worked. Someone can work countless hours and still feel motivated. Unfortunately, most people runout when they feel more pressure and have no support in their working life.

Exhaustion can directly undermine your company's efforts to maintain your employees and if the company gets the reputation of exhausting its employees it will face the problem of not recruiting good employees. Even worse, the more active workers, ie those who are highly committed to their work are even more vulnerable to exhaustion.

Sometimes, some managers contribute to the problem of exhaustion without realizing it. Most tend to load all major tasks to the few people whose performance is top notch. And then when these successors accomplish it with one project, the managers immediately charge them with many projects. 

Some strategies to combat this problem are intelligent staff management, exhaustion management and tactical re-engagement of your top talents.

Intelligent Human Resource Management: One way to avoid excessive workload for employees is to create a long-term, staffed personnel management plan that ensures that there are enough employees who fit with the job. Here's how:

·        Have production supervisors to work closely to human resources and senior management in order to define a staff management strategy that meets the needs of the department and the company.

·        Make sure that the staff is properly trained. People who are properly prepared for their work are more likely to be exhausted.

·        Arrange the workload: If your department has a particular staff shortage and has no capacity to increase its potential, keep a strategy on employee requirements. Assess a job based on the value it adds to customers. 

Managing exhaustion: Another way to avoid the high cost of excessive workload is to minimize managers the work-related stress. Here are some things that can be done:

·        Regularly check your workload, especially top-performing employees.

·        Show your appreciation of the valuable workers. 

·        If a valuable employee shows signs of exhaustion, take a look at the job description. The positions and responsibilities of his/her position may exceed the capabilities of even an excellent employee. In these cases, talk to the human resources department and your staff by redesigning your job.

·        Above all, be a shrewd observer and a goodlistener. 

·        Re-attracting your top talent: Do not take your valuable employees for granted or suppose that they will always want to continue working for you. Remember that the job market for some specialties is quite profitable and provides great mobility for top employees. Consider that at times you have to reclaim these people. Identify people with top performance and then:

·        Remember to yourself that your best employees are a potential target of your competitors.

Show to your hired workers how much they appreciate them and give them little but essentially symbolic gratitude gifts or bonuses.
