title: Spirit of Intrapreneurship
description:
Corporate sector is always looking to extract best of the talent and now they are creating Special teams to bring the innovative ideas.

Case Study :-

In 2015, online furniture store Pepperfry reduced the cost of delivering huge furniture items to customers, by replacing the services of third-party logistics services providers with those of its new entity, Pepkart Logistics. To give an idea of how big and nuanced this is,

Pepkart Logistics has a fleet of 350 trucks, customised to deliver large-sized and heavy furniture.

This last-mile delivery model, which is the backbone of Pepperfry’s large-items distribution system, was born out of the efforts of a four-member cross-functional team.

“Tiger Team”, as it is called, is five years old.

 “The best part of this exercise is that we were allowed to challenge the way things were being done in the organisation,” says Abhishek Das Gupta, who was just a year old in the company when he was picked to be a part of Tiger Team.

Until a few years ago, the spirit of innovation was viewed with admiration. And then, it became an essential aspect of product development. Teams were expected to be disruptive in their outlook and challenge the status quo. And, in some of these companies, these teams were “specially hand-crafted.”

Welcome the intrapreneurs :-

There are now organisations that empower specially-created teams to function like intrapreneurs (in-house entrepreneurs). Not only are these teams permitted sufficient time to come up with disruptive ideas, but are also provided with funding to bring the best of those ideas to life.

Certain large organisations have enabled associates from various sections “to collaborate to create, fail and try again in a more experimental and creative environment” says Puja Kohli, founder, Unfold Consulting.

These corporate entrepreneurs need not always be the top talent and may not be known to all, but they have the ability to turn ideas into profitable businesses.

Start-up Lab, an initiative of Deutsche Post DHL Group, fosters “corporate entrepreneurship” by provided teams with a start-up environment, exposure to senior management, four months of funding and a provision to put ideas into practice. FMCG company Marico Limited has so far had three “Young Boards” — cross-functional teams of eight members each that have worked on business ideas, for 12 to 18 months.

To create an entrepreneurial environment, companies have to take a new look at their systems, structures and process.

“Create an ideas investment pool, that will keep drawing fresh ideas from employees,” says Rajat Garg, leadership coach. It must be inclusive and invite ideas from across the company, he adds.

“Empower people to take decisions and then stand by them. The leadership must be ready to accept failures,” he says.

Removing Barriers :-

For Unfold Consulting, which works with companies to help them identify, develop and retain intrapreneurs, silo-style of working is the main barrier to creating an entrepreneurial and agile environment in companies .

To address this, they work with the top leadership. Organisations that are structured around hierarchical systems rather than networks struggle to leverage its intrapreneurship potential.

Line managers also play a crucial role.“Intrapreneurs think outside the box, so the reporting manager should be the first role model for the individual. He should be able to break the barriers to pave way for innovation.”

title: The gold rules of time management
description:
Time management is crucial for every organization in order to operate all departments efficiently. For this reason, in this article, we will present a list of things that managers and leaders should take into accounting when it comes to organizing their plans and strategies. 

The 'Do It' List

1.     Make a list of tasks to be done: Revise it daily. Texts are better left in memory. Note the degree of their importance. Also, make a list of short and long-term jobs. From them create daily lists of the day's work. 

2.     Prioritization: Determine important from urgency. Urgency has a direct and significant effect. Do not be tempted to do it easily by devoting 20% of the work produces to achieve 80% of the results. Locate this 20% and give it priority.

3.      Redefining the day leaving the best time for the best job: Take action for the most important jobs at the time of the day you're in shape. Many keep their best form for trivial things. Keep the routine work for the moment you are tired. 

4.     Productive wait: Think about the time spent in in waiting. Big things are accomplished at shortintervals. It is good to deal with things you do not particularly like. And when you start, you will usually continue.

5. Achieving the great start-up: We usually avoid having to deal with important issues as they push us emotionally. That is why we have usually avoided setting a deadline for our work. Good tactics is to break big projects into smaller ones and until we feel comfortable we get started. This breakage helps to avoid in decision and overload. Set deadlines for smallerp rojects to meet the required time of the big one. Rearrangement will be the feeling of accomplishment.

6. Doubling money: It's about doing more than one job at the same time. Avoid doing something important where much energy is needed to avoid mistakes. 

7. Do it Now: The fear of something grows constantly through imagination as it goes beyond the limits of reality. Preventive anxiety is worse than action. Ask yourself why you are late. There is a lack of information, a lack of self-confidence, a lack of stimulation or a starting point. Indecision is the greatest "time thief". Making it now saves time and effort. In the case of 95% lack of information there will be no better information in the future. If you need additional information, take a shot to get them.

8. Organizing your place: A place for every thing and every thing in its place. Archiving saves time. Horizontal archiving is more effective than vertical. The mountain of papers in the office usually consists of things that you will decide later, you do not like doing it, you hope they will disappear, and they are difficult to be handled.

Following the previous rules will help to create the time you need to protect. If you are exhausted, it is unlikely to work effectively. Take care of yourself, find time to rest and do not face life as a continuous fight. No one wrote in the funeral plaque "I would like to spend more time in the office”.

title: Customer satisfaction measurement systems
description:
The design of customer satisfaction measurement systems is a matter of particular specifications since the disclosure of results internally and externally raises a number of requirements that should be met. Let’s see eight points that are the main features of a successful customer satisfaction measurement system.

1. Emphasis on integrated measurement systems: Oneof the features of customer satisfaction measurement systems should be their integrated character. This means that the internal quality indicators assessed at the same time with customer satisfaction indicators and that allcustomers contact points are covered. An integrated quality indicator system includes both measurement and coordination issues between definitions, methodologies and implementation procedures on a case-by-case basis. 

2. Developing valid methodological frameworks: Customer satisfaction measurement is based on valid methodological frameworks that are developed by specialized executives to measure customer satisfaction as well as link it to other business concepts, such as customer loyalty, and profitability. Customer satisfaction measurement is implemented on a number of occasions with"discounts" on the completeness and reliability of the methodology. This includes designing surveys, designing questionnaires, sampling, how to collect data, quality control of the survey and finally, analysis of the results. 

3. Separation between design, implementation, and assurance of customersatisfaction measurement systems: In most cases, the development of customer satisfaction measurement systems is a result of collaboration between the quality directorates of the respective bodies, specialized consultants for planning and, finally, research firms undertaking the implementation of the surveys. Accordingly to each case, there are variations in the exact way this tripartite schemeworks, but in any case there is a clear separation between the discrete components of customer satisfaction measurement systems. 

4. Emphasis on setting upcontact points between telecoms and customers: The measurement of customer satisfaction indicators should cover the presence of multiple points of contact between the business and customers. In most businesses, one can measure satisfaction metrics per contact point, such as pre-sale, sales, product and service provision, after-sales service, scheduled visits, and emergency service. It is also needed to add the need for different measurements in relation to the type of business customers.

5.Adjustment: Customer satisfaction measurement should not be based solely on "global standards" and so, in spite of the similarities between different systems, customer satisfaction measurement systems need to be adapted to each country and to any business. Also, customer satisfaction measurement systems are constantly adapted and updated to respond to ever-changing market conditions

6.Proactive - Timelessness: Customer satisfaction measurement should include proactive prevention issues before they become bulk and presented to the majority of business customers. In addition, measurements should be timely so that the firm to be able to monitor the evolution of its"relationship" with customers beyond and along with its sales progress.

7.Integration of the system into the general business culture: Customer satisfaction measurement should be integrated into the overall customer service plan, and therefore what is of great importance is the optimal use of measurements in the direction of improving customer service. This means practically that the development of customer satisfaction measurement systems, after a period of validity and dynamism, are policy tools inside the organization both for allocating resources to different agency activities and for targeting at the operational level and administrative units.

title: Employees’ exhaustion and how to deal with it
description:
Exhaustion is the stress from work. Sometimes it is due to the individual but in many cases, it is the result of the culture that prevails in the workplace. Exhaustion usually occurs through lower job satisfaction, less commitment to the company, and increased willingness to do something different. In some cases, you will also see the following warning signs: reduced self-esteem, a decline in the feeling of being able to achieve it, and a neutral or negative attitude towards colleagues and customers. 

Exhaustion is generally the result of long-term involvement in situations with negative characteristics, such as excessive workload, conflicting requirements, unclear objectives, monotonous work, interpersonal conflicts, minimal reward, minimal recognition of employee contributions, failure to achieve clear success.

Therefore, exhaustion is not only a function of the number of hours worked. Someone can work countless hours and still feel motivated. Unfortunately, most people runout when they feel more pressure and have no support in their working life.

Exhaustion can directly undermine your company's efforts to maintain your employees and if the company gets the reputation of exhausting its employees it will face the problem of not recruiting good employees. Even worse, the more active workers, ie those who are highly committed to their work are even more vulnerable to exhaustion.

Sometimes, some managers contribute to the problem of exhaustion without realizing it. Most tend to load all major tasks to the few people whose performance is top notch. And then when these successors accomplish it with one project, the managers immediately charge them with many projects. 

Some strategies to combat this problem are intelligent staff management, exhaustion management and tactical re-engagement of your top talents.

Intelligent Human Resource Management: One way to avoid excessive workload for employees is to create a long-term, staffed personnel management plan that ensures that there are enough employees who fit with the job. Here's how:

·        Have production supervisors to work closely to human resources and senior management in order to define a staff management strategy that meets the needs of the department and the company.

·        Make sure that the staff is properly trained. People who are properly prepared for their work are more likely to be exhausted.

·        Arrange the workload: If your department has a particular staff shortage and has no capacity to increase its potential, keep a strategy on employee requirements. Assess a job based on the value it adds to customers. 

Managing exhaustion: Another way to avoid the high cost of excessive workload is to minimize managers the work-related stress. Here are some things that can be done:

·        Regularly check your workload, especially top-performing employees.

·        Show your appreciation of the valuable workers. 

·        If a valuable employee shows signs of exhaustion, take a look at the job description. The positions and responsibilities of his/her position may exceed the capabilities of even an excellent employee. In these cases, talk to the human resources department and your staff by redesigning your job.

·        Above all, be a shrewd observer and a goodlistener. 

·        Re-attracting your top talent: Do not take your valuable employees for granted or suppose that they will always want to continue working for you. Remember that the job market for some specialties is quite profitable and provides great mobility for top employees. Consider that at times you have to reclaim these people. Identify people with top performance and then:

·        Remember to yourself that your best employees are a potential target of your competitors.

Show to your hired workers how much they appreciate them and give them little but essentially symbolic gratitude gifts or bonuses.

title: Boeing 737-Max raises Questions..
description:
As airlines and safety regulators worldwide scramble to understand why two Boeing 737 Max 8 jets crashed in chillingly similar accidents, more indications are pointing to how an automated anti-stalling system may be linked to the model's unusually deadly debut. The safety feature— the Maneuvering Characteristics Augmentation System (MCAS)—appears to have sent both planes into their fatal dives as pilots struggled to keep aloft. The 737 Max 8 and 9 were grounded by regulators around the world last week.


Here are key details that have been reported — about a series of engineering, regulatory, and political missteps that preceded software being installed on a widely used plane without pilots apparently fully understanding its risks.

> NEW PLANES BUT NO NEW TRAINING

Boeing designed the 737 Max 8 to be similar enough to existing 737s that it could keep the same “type rating”—meaning, that pilots who already flew 737s wouldn’t have to be retrained on a new plane and airlines would save a lot of money.

Yet the Max 8 is different from previous 737s in one major way:

It has larger engines placed farther forward on its wings. The new design increased the risk that the plane could stall if pilots angled the nose too high. To counteract this risk, Boeing introduced the MCAS, which automatically nudges the nose down if onboard sensors detect that the plane risks stalling.

The software is designed to work automatically and only in extreme situations. Boeing decided pilots didn’t need any new training to understand MCAS.

> Failure of FAA Oversight

The US Federal Aviation Administration (FAA), along with European aviation regulators, sets the tone for much of the world's flight safety standards. Boeing did much of the work of certifying that the 737 Max 8 was safe to fly. FAA managers pressured safety engineers to delegate more and more of the safety analysis to Boeing to get the plane approved faster. In some cases, FAA engineers didn’t even read the technical documents Boeing sent them.

> Warning Lights Optional

Boeing designed a warning light that would alert pilots when the sensors measuring their plane’s angle of attack differed widely, which would give notify them of a faulty MCAS activation. The manufacturer does not install the warning light as a standard feature on the 737 Max 8. Airlines have to pay extra for this.

> US Govt. Shutdown delays a Software Fix

After the Lion Air crash in October 2018, Boeing promised a software patch to make the MCAS safer by January. The fix has since been delayed until April because of “engineering challenges,” “differences of opinion” between federal and Boeing officials.

> Ceding more controls to the Computer

The safety analysis Boeing sent to the FAA reported that the MCAS could only move the plane’s horizontal tail 0.6 degrees (out of a physical maximum of a little less than five degrees). But during later flight tests, Boeing discovered that 0.6 degrees of movement wasn’t enough to avert a high speed stall. Despite quadrupling the amount that the MCAS could move the plane’s tail, Boeing never updated the documents it sent to the FAA.

Now,Boeing also plans to train pilots on the system and mention the MCAS in flight manuals.

title: The Web as a distribution channel
description:
The Web as a new form of distribution channel has revolutionized the methods of transmitted the goods from the supplier to the final customer introducing a new age in the field of marketing. 

There are many advantages of using the Web asa distribution channel to the supply of the products and services. First of all, a Web distribution channel can approach many users and ship mass productsin different nations without having much expenditure. This entails a great expansion of the brand and an increasing number of customers who are aware of the companies’ facilities and its product’s benefits due to the brand promotion and advertising on the Web. In fact, Web allows people to have access to goods that cannot usually find in their own country, as most sites that sell goods ship them all over the world. Moreover, Web distributional channels reach new larger markets and contribute to the better collaboration between the companies leading to better prices and effective supply chain. Besides, it is commonly known that a company that is interested in expanding its operation in foreign markets needs significant consultation of the local distributors who are well-informed about the customer’s demand and preferences. Therefore, Web can be of their best assistant, as it eliminates the money waste and the time needed to approach such distributors so as to acquire important information. 

Another benefit is that it functions everyday 24 hours a day; therefore increasing the possibility of augmenting its sales given that there are lots of people that prefer to buy online due to the lack of their free time. Also, the fact that manufacturers can cut down on retail expenses, make products available at a lower price than the price of products that launched in a shop. A direct consequence of this is the increased demand, as each company can target in a larger customer base taking advantage of this pricing strategy.  

From companies’ perspective, Web facilitates the businesses to evaluate the resultsof internet marketing and measure the customer’s preferences by providing platforms that customers can give feedbacks or conduct research and measure traffic to the website. Hence, it becomes easier for a company to know more about the needs and habits of the consumers in a specific region and adjust its marketing strategies to them. Nevertheless, this knowledge and specialization are really precious to create a strong relationship between the company and the customers as it minimizes the consumers that feel left outfrom the distribution channel. As a matter of fact, companies do not need tocreate a new distribution channel but they can use the existed in which they invest a logic amount of money for that.

On the other hand, there are some particular disadvantages of using the Web as a distribution channel. One of the many disadvantages is that this distribution channel is usually very complicated and little flexible within its structure and for this reason, it creates delays within the distribution procedure. Due to the sophistication that it includes,it is very difficult for a company to supervise the selling environment and implement an alternative strategy if the customer’s habits change because they have not adequate and accurate personalized information. Also, it can pose potential channel conflict due to the multiple channels involved, something that needs a daily supervisor and activity so as to prevent misunderstanding, hacking about the product and the brand. At the same time, the Web needs many intermediaries who should be paid for these services leading to an increase in the product/service price which is burdened the final consumer. Moreover, they may have different strategic goals, a fact that may create conflicts during the distribution procedure causing loss of a harmonizer environment due to operational inefficiencies. This is because resellers are free to make changes to things injuring the image of the supplier.

title: The purpose of using standard costs in the financial statements of companies
description:
Standard costing is utilized for determining the costs of direct materials, direct labor, and overheads needed to be produced product units in a specific fiscal year. This information is recorded in a report and presents the costs that a company expects if a particular (ideal or attainable) strategy is succeeded. 

Standard costs of materials (standard quantity and standard price), labor(standard hours and standard rate), and overheads (standard rate and standardquantity) are values that helps decisively the budget determination process and the variance analysis, as they function as a starting point of companies’ financial performance evaluation which in turn facilitates the manager to achieve better costs controlling and a restriction to variances; for this reason it is prepared before the other cost analysis procedures in relation to expected operation conditions. In particular, the material costs are defined by the contracts that the company signs to buy the raw materials in relation to the inflation, while the labor costs are set from the contracts between the employees and the company, as well as from the legal rules that require the minimum level of wages so as to secure the rights of the employees. Also,overheads are predestined from the data acquired by companies’ previous experience adjusted to the inflation or from expected costs due to the operational changes.  

The main purpose of standard costing systems is the arrangement of a company’s operating activities, as well as the efficacy of companies’ decisions regarding the number of costs and the company’s profits. To be more specific, standard costs are compared with the actual costs at the end of the fiscal year by applying a variance analysis. A successful managerial decision should be lead in a balance between the standard costs and the actual costs realizing the decision and the objectives that the company sets. Also, given that standard costs relates to the cost allocation, it can be used along with other costing methods, such as the job order costing system and the process costing system to appropriate allocate materials, work in process, and finished goods inventories with the view to simplifying costing procedures, encouraging cost reduction and fixing the company’s prices. 

Another purpose ofusing standard costs is to ensure better financial performance in the long runby motivating and calculating employee’s and managers’ efficiencies. In fact, the standard cost report “communicates” with employees by giving them guidelines that should be followed. To be more specific, employees are able to be informed about the consequences of the lack of job performance and production efficacy and the rewards that will be given in the case of high job performance. 

Simultaneously, it assists managers to apply the predetermined company’s strategy and facilitates the administration of human resources. Also, it is crucial for the production policy, as it contributes to being constructed a flexible budget, evaluates the dynamics of workforce and shows which are as are not productive. Finally, the standard costs prepare the managers and the employees to be ready for the actual production and informed about the strategy of the company enabling them to focus on a certain objective that should be achieved, hence facilitates their job and urges savings. However, the company should revise the standard costing reports at a regular base so as to see if changes emerged and thus alter the data given eventually achieving a better position for the challenges in the marketplace.

title: Jet Airways Crises
description:
Jet Airways (India) Ltd flew its last flight on Wednesday night—9W 2502 from Amritsar to Mumbai—after lenders declined to hand out emergency funds, bringing the curtains down on an era in which it broke into a state monopoly sector to become India’s largest private airline at one point.


It’s unclear whether the airline will ever return to the skies, but if it does so, it will be under a new ownership structure.


“Late last night, Jet Airways was informed by the State Bank of India (SBI), on behalf of the consortium of Indian lenders, that they are unable to consider its request for critical interim funding," Jet Airways said in a statement on Wednesday. “Since no emergency funding from the lenders or any other source is forthcoming, the airline will not be able to pay for fuel or other critical services to keep the operations going."



The airline said it would await the bid finalization process by the lenders that is likely to bring in fresh equity by the end of May.


If the stake sale process to induct a new investor fails, it will mark the end of the airline that started operations on 5 May 1993, and then went on to become the first Indian airline outside government control to fly overseas destinations. The suspension of operations also marks the end of a year-long effort made by the airline and its lenders to save it from being grounded. The airline had already halted international flights. It operated about 40 flights using five aircraft on Tuesday and Wednesday.


“History and our business dynamics prove that once an airline shuts down in India, it never does restart," said Mark D. Martin, founder and CEO of aviation consultancy Martin Consulting Llc.

title: Socio-economic Transformation
description:
India is in the middle of a historical election which is noteworthy in many respects, one of them being the unprecedented focus on women’s employment.


What Data shows ?


Currently, the participation of women in the workforce in India is one of the lowest globally. The female Labour Force Participation Rate (LFPR) in India fell from 31.2% in 2011-2012 to 23.3% in 2017-2018. This decline has been sharper in rural areas, where the female LFPR fell by more than 11 percentage points in 2017-2018. The answers can be found in a complex set of factors including low social acceptability of women working outside the household, lack of access to safe and secure workspaces, widespread prevalence of poor and unequal wages, and a dearth of decent and suitable jobs. Most women in India are engaged in subsistence-level work in agriculture in rural areas, and in low-paying jobs such as domestic service and petty home-based manufacturing in urban areas.


Education and Work


A recent study observed a strong negative relationship between a woman’s education level and her participation in agricultural and non-agricultural wage work and in family farms. The study also showed a preference among women for salaried jobs as their educational attainment increases; but such jobs remain extremely limited for women. It is estimated that among people (25 to 59 years) working as farmers, farm labourers and service workers, nearly a third are women, while the proportion of women among professionals, managers and clerical workers is only about 15% (NSSO, 2011-2012). 

Time-use surveys have found that they devote a substantial amount of their time to work which is not considered as work, but an extension of their duties, and is largely unpaid. The incidence and drudgery of this unpaid labour is growing. This includes unpaid care work such as childcare, elderly care, and household work such as collecting water. The burden of these activities falls disproportionately on women, especially in the absence of adequately available or accessible public services.


Any government which is serious about ensuring women’s economic empowerment and equal access to livelihoods must address the numerous challenges that exist along this highly gendered continuum of unpaid, underpaid and paid work.


Women have also expressed the need for policies which ensure safe and dignified working and living conditions for migrant workers. For example, in cities, governments must set up migration facilitation and crisis centres (temporary shelter facility, helpline, legal aid, and medical and counselling facilities).

title: Digital Strategy and Approach for Small Businesses
description:
In the era of globalisation, digital strategy for small businesses has become an integral part to meet the business needs and objectives. To get started with the digital approach, you need to first define your goals. The goals that you set can be anything, whether you want your business to increase sales by 15% or aim for 50 social media shares. Once your goals are defined, prioritise them. These goals will be the guide to your digital strategy.



Next, focus on the audience that you are targeting and keep a check of their needs and the channels they use. For instance, if you are targeting young entrepreneurs, Snapchat or Instagram may belong to your digital plans. By keeping these key channels in mind, you can reach your target audience more efficiently.



Small business brands spend 25-43% on content marketing. Content is what the internet is built from, whether it’s emails, social media posts, blogs or visual contents. Therefore, content should be the driving force of your digital strategy in order for it to be effective. You will likely be using more than one marketing channels and loads of content to manage, so build out a calendar or timeline to stay consistent. Keeping everything in one place will help simplify the process as your workload increases.



Once the planning is done and everything that is required seems to be at the right place, it’s time to put your plan in motion. Make sure you have enough resources, money and time to properly execute the items planned in your digital strategy.



The last approach is to monitor and measure the results of your digital strategy. This will help you to analyse what was successful and what wasn’t. By receiving the information, it will help make your future digital efforts even stronger.

title: What Everyone Is Saying About Uber influence on the taxi drivers
description:
The advancement of technologies has not only changed the way to interact with others, but it also has brought some significant changes in many people's lives. These changes can be beneficial for some others but not for all of us. Especially when these changes are related to business or those who make a living from it. These changes have benefited consumers most. Giving them a chance to make choices and to select those choices which they think will benefit them the most. Because of that competition among businesses has increased keeping in mind how they can give their services to the consumers which are affordable, easy to use and how they can more benefit to consumers.

Not one such area might have been left which has not been affected by the advancement of technology. The field which is most widely affected by it is transportation. Now, passengers do not have to wait near the taxi stand to hire a taxi. With just a click of a button, they can book the cab. And the cab will pick up from the desired places. Don’t you think it is convenient? Yes, it is very convenient. You don’t have to do anything at all. This will not only save your time but also relieves you from the tension at waiting at the taxi stand in long queues. All of this is happening with the help of your phone. The company that is providing at the top position currently and is providing taxi services all over the world is Uber. Uber is the cab service provider company. The drivers who are registered with Uber give their services to the passengers who order a cab from Uber.

Another company that provides the cab services unlike Uber is the Ola cab services it works the same way as Uber. They both are providing cab services throughout the world. But Uber is more famous than Ola. The other taxi service provider companies have been affected by it. It seems that local taxi drivers are not affected much as it seems. They had affected but only a little. Only the taxi service provider companies other than Uber and Ola have been affected much by it. 

The surveys done by the Forbes tell that Uber taxi drivers earn more than the other taxi drivers. Because of the increase in competition many taxi drivers have joined with Uber to provide their services to the consumers. As the competition is increased other taxi service provider companies are finding other ways so that they can compete with Uber.

title: Is Being a Freelancer a good alternative to being a Full-time Employees
description:
Nowadays many office workers especially young ones want to become their own boss. They want to work on their own. They should be able to decide how many hours they want to work, which clients they want to work with, where to work and so on. The option for that comes in everyone’s mind is the one and only freelancing. Now people are leaving their office jobs and choosing the path of freelancing which they find a better option than the 9-5 job. In freelancing, they have more freedom and can choose how and where to work. Where everyone is thinking that freelancing is a better alternative than office jobs and a boon for full-time employees there can be both advantages and disadvantages of it.

It is true that in freelancing you are your own boss and you can decide who, where and whom to work with. You have to do all the things by yourself like marketing, negotiating, dealing with the clients and so on. The health insurance bills and other employee benefits will not be covered in freelancing. You have to keep encouraging yourself to do better whenever you feel down. Managing time is one of the most important rules of freelancing. Without proper time management, you will not be able to finish the work. It is true that freelancing gives you the freedom to do work anytime you want. You can even work at any after spending time with your family. But you have to also complete the assignments the time, otherwise, you can lose your clients too. 

One of the disadvantages that every freelancer has to suffer is an unpredictable income. You will never know how much you will be able to earn next month.if you are a pro freelancer then it is not a big issue as you might have some regular clients who will give you regular work. But if you are new to freelancing then finding regular clients might be a huge task for you so chances are more of an unpredictable income.


You are doing freelancing then you are miles away from the office politics. As you have to interact only with the clients then chances are less to get involved in office politics. You can able to choose which assignment to do and which not to do. And the biggest advantage is that you can work remotely without any tension going to the office and can work at your own pace.

Freelancing and office jobs have both their advantages and disadvantages. While choosing between the two, keep in mind what you want to do and which will suit you better. Then make your choice.

title: Beyond Mayday
description:
Jet Airways may have finally run out of runway. Two months after Jet halted all flight operations, lenders to the beleaguered full service airline have decided to refer it to the National Company Law Tribunal and initiate insolvency proceedings in a bid to recover the money owed to them. The lenders’ consortium arrived at this conclusion after unsuccessfully trying to rope in a white knight — an investor who would have helped put the airline’s flights back in the air, thus saving thousands of jobs and potentially helping turn around the carrier. And while, theoretically, the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code was conceived to help achieve a resolution that could potentially protect a running business and help revive it through capital restructuring under a new promoter, in Jet’s case the chances of a resolution seem rather remote now. The lenders have to shoulder a fair share of the blame as the delay in initiating the insolvency process has drastically eroded some of the airline’s key assets, including customer goodwill, its aircraft fleet, routes and landing slots and even its experienced flight crew.


Ironically, while the banks may have viewed Jet’s request for emergency lines of credit in the run-up to the suspension of operations as ‘good money chasing bad money’, nothing could potentially kill an airline more effectively than protracted grounding. And one doesn’t even need to look too far back in time to recall what happened to Kingfisher Airlines.




It would surely have been instructive for the creditors to revisit the Chapter 11 bankruptcies that a clutch of U.S. legacy airlines opted for in the early 2000s. That protection helped Delta and United to not only survive the crisis of confidence in aviation triggered by the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001, the surge in jet fuel and labour costs and the intense competition from low-cost carriers, but emerge stronger and rank among the top five contemporary American carriers. A look at some of Jet’s industry-specific operational metrics, at least until the recent cash-starved implosion, show an airline that had consistently posted growth in terms of revenue passenger kilometres and cargo tonnage till the 2017-18 financial year. So it wasn’t a lack of business that led to Jet’s stall and crash. For the health of India’s airline industry, it will be crucial for policymakers to review several issues that affect viability: from the way aviation turbine fuel is taxed, to the charges airports levy.


The carriers too need to reappraise their pricing strategies and ensure that in the quest for market share they don’t end up in a race to the bottom. The government must take a closer, harder look at the IBC and examine the viability of a framework akin to Chapter 11 that may ultimately be more suited to industries like aviation.

title: How to Send Audio Files via Email?
description:
Do you want to send the file of your favorite song to a long distance friend? Wondering how to send audio clips via email? It is quite easy to attach audio files in emails. Now, you do not have to undergo the hassle of burning songs onto a CD. You can just send audio clips via emails. Here’s how you can do it:

Insert an Audio Clip Directly

Here is the process of attaching an audio file directly. Follow the instructions carefully.

•    First, you will have to find your file.

•    After that, right click on your file.

•    Then tap on Properties in the drop-down menu.

•    Check once before sending your file because many email distributors have a size limitation. For example:- Gmail and Yahoo- 25 MB, iCloud Mail- 20 MB and Outlook- 34 MB.

•    After that, go to your preferred email source on a PC.

•    Now, make a new email.

•    Then enter a recipient and a subject.

•    Thereafter, select and put an audio file into your email screen.

•    Now, tap on Send.

On Google Drive

Here is the process of uploading an audio file directly on Google Drive. Follow the instructions carefully.

•    First, you will have to open the Google Drive website.

•    After that, select the “New” option.

•    Then select File Upload in the NEW drop down menu.

•    Now, choose the audio file which you want to send.

•    Then tap on Open.

•    You can wait for a few seconds for uploading your audio file.

•    After that, tap on Share tab.

•    Thereafter enter an email ID and tap on the Tab button.

•    Now, select Send.

On OneDrive

Here is the process of uploading an audio file directly on OneDrive. Follow the instructions carefully.

•    First, you will have to open the OneDrive site.

•    After that, choose the Upload option.

•    Choose which file you wish to send.

•    Then tap on Open.

•    Thereafter you can wait for a few seconds to upload your audio file.

•    Choose your file and tap on your file’s right side corner.

•    After that, select Share.

•    When prompted, tap on Email.

•    Now, enter your email ID and tap on the Tab button.

•    Then select the Share option.

On iCloud Drive

Here is the process of sending an audio file directly on an iCloud drive. Follow the instructions carefully.

•    First, you will have to open the iCloud website.

•    After that, select iCloud Drive.

•    Then, select the cloud with an arrow icon.

•    Now, select the file which you want to send via email.

•    You can wait for a few seconds to upload your audio file.

•    Select the file’s address.

•    After that right click on the address.

•    Choose Copy.

•    Now, go to the new email screen.

•    Thereafter choose a recipient and a subject.

•    After that, right click on the email screen and paste the address.

•    Now, tap on Send.

Marry James is a Microsoft Office expert and her been working in the technical industry from last 10 year. As a technical expert, she has written technical blogs, manuals, white papers, and reviews for many websites such as office.com/setup.

Source : Send Audio Files

title: How to Resolve Windows 10 Boot Configuration Error Code 0xc0000454?
description:
The Windows 10 Boot Configuration Error Code 0xc0000454 is simply a black screen error code which usually occurs with the Windows 10 Creators Update. Well, these types of errors rarely happen on the screen, and most of the Windows 10 users reported that the error arises when users have installed the latest update on their system. Sometimes, this error pops-up during the startup of Windows 10 PC. Whenever the error code 0xc0000454 appears on the screen shows an error message which says; ‘ The boot configuration data for your computer system is lost or contains errors.’ In recent research, this error is directly associated to the Windows Boot Manager entry which occurs because of the causes, is any missing in the Boot Configuration Data store, or corrupted Boot\\BCD file or many others.

Although this Windows 10 Boot Configuration Error Code 0xc0000454 is considered one of the fatal error as they prevent the system from booting. However, one of the best ways for troubleshooting this bug is just to boot the computer by using the bootable Windows Installation Media and also using system recovery. Are you facing problem in accessing your computer or unable to restart PC multiple times to remove errors from it? Do not fret. In this blog, we will guide you through steps which you have to perform in the same sequence as discussed below.

Steps to Resolve Windows 10 Boot Configuration Error Code 0xc0000454

Below we provide some simple methods for troubleshooting this Windows 10 bugs. However, these solutions will completely depend on whether you manage to boot up the computer system or not. Here are the steps:

Solution-1: Run the Startup Repair Using Pre-Installed Recovery Option

In case if you want to start your system successfully, then you have to troubleshoot the bugs by following some simple methods which are as follows:

  1. Firstly, delete all the external drives, whether it is CD, USB, or DVD from the device.
  2. Then, click on the ‘Power’ tab to restart the system.
  3. After that, long press the F8 key before the Windows logo appears on the screen.
  4. Now, navigate to the ‘Repair your computer’ option by scrolling down the window and choose it.
  5. Press the ‘Enter’ key.
  6. Next, choose the ‘Keyboard Layout’ which you want to use.
  7. Tap on ‘Next’ tab.
  8. Choose the ‘Username’ of your choice, create a ‘Password’ and tap on ‘OK’ tab.
  9. Now, the ‘System Recovery Option’ menu appears on the screen, form it choose ‘Startup Repair’ option if asked.
  10. Restart the computer system to save all the changes.

Solution-2: Run Startup Repair Using Windows 10 Installation Media Option

 Sometimes, if one cannot be able to boot into the computer system normally as the computer shows an error code 0xc0000454 at the time of boot phase, we suggest you create Windows 10 installation media by using DVD or USB drive and connect it to your system. Once finished, follow the steps which are mentioned below:

  1. Restart your computer system.
  2. Hit any key on your keyboard to boot directly from the installation media.
  3. Choose ‘Language, Currency, Time, and Keyboard/input’ option.
  4. Hit the ‘Next’ tab to continue the process.
  5. Tap on the ‘Repair your computer’ option.
  6. From it, choose the type of OS which you want to repair.
  7. Press the ‘Troubleshoot’ option. 
  8. Choose ‘Advanced’ option from the list and tap on the ‘Automatic Repair’ or ‘Startup’ Repair’ option.
  9. Once the computer system diagnoses the issue, users have to choose an issue by which you are troubled or running on your system.
  10. Lastly, disconnect the USB or detach DVD bootable media and try to boot your device.

Source : Resolve Windows 10 Boot Configuration Error

title: 3 Ways To Prepare For Business Fires
description:
A fire at your place of business in Las Vegas affects everyone in your building and is one of the worst disasters that can happen to a business owner. Commercial fire damage in Las Vegas is devastating and must be planned for and prepared for by every business owner. As a business owner, you need to focus on fire risk assessment, fire prevention, and staff education so you can help reduce the risk of a fire occurring and help to mitigate the damage if it does.

Fire Risk Assessment

Fire safety codes must be in place for businesses. You should contact your local fire marshal and schedule a visit for your business so they can help you make sure safety codes are met, and an effective fire prevention plan is in place. Property managers should have a fire escape route clearly defined for the building, so be sure that it is posted in your work area. You can also use the National Fire Protection Association’s website for further information and publications on the fire safety code for businesses. Keeping your place of business in line with fire safety codes will greatly reduce the risk of fires.

Fire Prevention And Protection

Standard fire safety practices call for smoke detectors and fire extinguishers on every floor of the building. Automatic sprinkler systems are also a great tool to provide primary protection for your business in case of a fire. Emergency equipment kits should also be available in your workplace to provide items such as bottled water, flashlights, and escape masks to fight against smoke inhalation.

Fire Safety Education For Staff And Employees

Educating employees and staff on how to respond in the wake of fire will greatly increase the odds of everyone getting out of the building safely and quickly. Here are some ways you should educate employees about fire safety:

Have a fire escape plan in place, and make sure your employees are informed and rehearsed on how it works. Post the fire escape routes in areas that can be seen by all building occupants. Conduct a fire drill at least once a year to keep employees practiced and aware of the fire escape plan.

Designate an office fire safety and prevention officer. Their duties will include composing escape routes that are in compliance with the building manager, designate safe meeting points outside of the building, and offer scheduled fire safety training and education for fellow employees. They will also be sure that fire prevention information and practices are up to date and in compliance with business safety codes.

Install an automatic sprinkler system in your building. Sprinkler systems are cost-effective and have proven to be the best way to fight the spread of a commercial fire. The National Fire Protection Association reported that properly installed and maintained sprinkler systems are 95% effective in commercial fires.

 Make sure all employees know how to activate the emergency response system in your building. Most commercial fire alarms alert local authorities and fire departments when they go off, but it is still good practice to be sure that all employees know how to alert emergency personnel.

If you find your commercial property damaged by fire or smoke, you can contact the professional fire damage restoration team at Design Builders in Las Vegas 24 hours a day! we also provides professional services for commercial construction in Las Vegas.

title: CHANDA KOCHHAR - A LIVING INSPIRATION
description:
“I always believe that, as you start out, while you should have a big dream – a big goal – but it’s also important to move step by step. So, you know, frankly, if you ask me, when I started as a management trainee in 1984, I don’t know that I really thought that I would become the CEO.” - CHANDA KOCHHAR

CHANDA KOCHHAR, a living inspiration to today's women. CEO and managing director of the ICICI bank .She is the backbone of the ICICI bank. And, she is the inspiration to so many of us. 

CHILDHOOD- Born and brought up in jodhpur. She did her schooling in Jaipur from St. Angela Sophia School. After that, she completed her graduation from jai hind college, university of Mumbai. She did accountancy from ICWAI and master's degree from jamnalal bajaj institute of management studies. She was so bright student. She earned Wockhardt Gold Medal for her excellence in Management studies. And also earned J.N.Bose gold medal award for her outstanding performance in Cost Accountancy.

CAREER- She joined ICICI in the year of 1993 and was no looking back since then. ICICI was not a bank then and when she joined the ICICI, they decided to set up a bank. When she joined back then, she was just doing some random projects in the industrial sectors like textile, paper and cement etc. In 1994, she became the assistant general manager and exact after two years in 1996 she promoted to deputy general manager. She was so hardworking, she worked so hard and in 1999 she became the general manager of the company. She was the one who made this company to the top. Her efforts and dedication are just too much. Under her leadership, company started its retail operation in the year of 2000 and the company became the largest retail sector in the next few years. And, she was honored by position of the deputy managing director. From year 2007 to 2009, she worked as the chief finance officer ambitiously. And, her hard work totally paid off in the year 2009 when she was honored by the position of CEO( chief executive officer). 

ACHIEVEMENTS- 1. Retail banker of the year by the Asian banker in the year 2004.

2. Business woman of the year by the economic times in the year 2005.

3. Rising Star Award by the Retail Banker International in 2006.

title: Leader - Woman Super Power!
description:
Every company has president, board chairman or leader. For the most ways we agree that someone individually needs to head a business and social institutions. The success of a business or an industry is determined by the leaders it chooses or inherits. How does someone earn the designation of being a great leader? One of the greatest things about leadership is that everyone bring something different to the table. If we were to read articles on good leadership qualities, we would usually see factors like integrity, effective communication and influence. These are wonderful qualities of a leader. 

Leader is focused much more on the individual capability of the leader: "Leadership is a function of knowing yourself, having a vision that is well communicated, building trust among colleagues, and taking effective action to realize your own leadership potential."(Warren Bennis)

One such leader is a lady superstar, a CEO  of a fortune 500 bussiness entity. we discuss today  here is about Ms. Indira Nooyi, CEO Pepsico India. Indira Krisnamurthy Nooyi, the 62 year-old, chennai-born, Nooyi, was in 2006 appointed as the first female boss of the $63.5 billion turnover company where she has spent over two decades by now. Over the years she became a flag bearer for working women striving to balance the personal with the professional life.

Nooyi has been vocal about the extraordinary leadership traits Indians bring to organisations. An ability to live in a "volatile, uncertain, complex and ambiguous world" makes Indians more resilient and flexible to change, she feels.  

A graduate of Indian Institute of Management Calcutta and later  Yale, Nooyi is credited with earning top degrees, mostly unknown for women in India of her times. Nooyi credits India's pedigreed education system for picking out strong leaders. She has consistently ranked among the world's 100 most powerful women in 2014, she was ranked number 13 on the forbes list of the world's 100 most powerful women, and was ranked the 2nd most powerful woman on Fortune list in 2015.

Nooyi believes in constant reinvention. "The minute you've developed a new business model, it's extinct, because somebody is going to copy it."

Nooyi who is from India, is the first foreign-born CEO of pepsi and the first woman to lead the chips-and-soda company. Her departure thins the ranks of female CEOs running S&P 500 companies and comes at a time when Pepsi's North American beverage unit is stagnating amid a general decline in soda consumption. In 24 years at Pepsi, including 12 years as chief executive, she has helped the Frito-Lay unit grow in a challenging industry and added healthier drinks and snacks to portfolio that includes cheetos and Mountain Dew.

Not able to print: You must check the ink level in the printer cartridges. And then, go and update the firmware. Make sure, you have cleared the print queue and try to print something.

Most Frequent Paper jam: Paper Jam can occur anytime. In such a situation, you need to look into the printing unit for any paper and clear it if you find one. Do ensure that there is no paper in between the rollers. And don’t use damaged or wrinkled sheets.

Connectivity: If you suffer from connectivity issues, you need to uninstall the driver software. If the problem is still there, you must reset the printer. If you are still not satisfied, reconfigure the printer settings. And at last, reinstalling the driver is the only option left.

Ink quality issues: Cleaning the rollers is a must step. You need to ensure that the print head has been removed from the printer and it is cleaned using warm water. This is also important to use genuine ink cartridges.

title: Love Networking
description:
"I hate networking.” 


We hear this all the time from executives, other professionals, and MBA students. They tell us that networking makes them feel uncomfortable and phony—even dirty. Although some people have a natural passion for it—namely, the extroverts who love and thrive on social interaction—many understandably see it as brown-nosing, exploitative, and inauthentic.

But in today’s world, networking is a necessity. A mountain of research shows that professional networks lead to more job and business opportunities, broader and deeper knowledge, improved capacity to innovate, faster advancement, and greater status and authority. Building and nurturing professional relationships also improves the quality of work and increases job satisfaction.

Fortunately, research shows that an aversion to networking can be overcome. 

Most people have a dominant motivational focus—what psychologists refer to as either a “promotion” or a “prevention” mindset. Those in the former category think primarily about the growth, advancement, and accomplishments that networking can bring them, while those in the latter see it as something they are obligated to take part in for professional reasons.

Thankfully, as Stanford University’s Carol Dweck has documented in her research, it’s possible to shift your mindset from prevention to promotion, so that you see networking as an opportunity for discovery and learning rather than a chore.

If you are an introvert, you can’t simply will yourself to be extroverted, of course. But everyone can choose which motivational focus to bring to networking. 

The next step in making networking more palatable is to think about how your interests and goals align with those of people you meet and how that can help you forge meaningful working relationships. Numerous studies in social psychology have demonstrated that people establish the most collaborative and longest-lasting connections when they work together on tasks that require one another’s contributions.


When your networking is driven by substantive, shared interests you’ve identified through serious research, it will feel more authentic and meaningful and is more likely to lead to relationships that have those qualities too.

Even when you do not share an interest with someone, you can probably find something valuable to offer by thinking beyond the obvious. Of course, this isn’t always easy. We’ve found that people who feel powerless—because they are junior in their organizations, because they belong to a minority, or for other reasons—often believe they have too little to give and are therefore the least likely to engage in networking, even though they’re the ones who will probably derive the most benefit from it.

This problem was highlighted in two studies we conducted at the law firm mentioned above, which involved different groups of lawyers at different points in time. We found that senior people were typically much more comfortable networking than junior people were because of their greater power in the organization. This makes sense. When people believe they have a lot to offer others, such as wise advice, mentorship, access, and resources, networking feels easier and less selfish.

A controlled experiment confirmed this finding: People in whom we induced feelings of power found networking less repulsive and were more willing to do it than people assigned to a condition that made them feel powerless.

Another factor that affects people’s interest in and effectiveness at networking is the primary purpose they have in mind when they do it. In the law firm we studied, we found that attorneys who focused on the collective benefits of making connections (“support my firm” and “help my clients”) rather than on personal ones (“support or help my career”) felt more authentic and less dirty while networking, were more likely to network, and had more billable hours as a result.

title: Relationship and Communication
description:
Communication is a process. It does not include primarily talking to people or convey your thoughts to them but to make your things clear to the other person also. And in the 21st century all it requires to be a good communicator to stand in the world. Here are some of the sides of the relationship:

HEALTHY COMMUNICATION

Normally a communication involves a sender, a receiver and a message. But for healthy communication, there are many factors which need to be there. For eg: Encoding. Encoding is a process of interpreting the message by the receiver. Healthy communication sustains when receiver knows the motive behind your message and he takes an active and rational action. Like a husband says "sugar jar is empty". This appears to be a simple statement but here the work of wife is to go and refill the jar. See, the motive and intention matters.

“We speak not only to tell other people what we think but to tell ourselves what we think. Speech is a part of thought.” Oliver Sacks

OVERCOMMUNICATION 

Communication is, of course, a way of telling your emotions but it can be over sometimes. You are speaking the things which the person don't even want to listen or just ask yourself are not you connecting to the person even when it is not required. This happens usually in smartphones world. Some couples are in touch everytime over WhatsApp or facebook etc. This doesn't make the relationship healthy but makes it worse.

COMMUNICATION IN ROMANTIC RELATIONSHIPS

 If you are in a  romantic relationship, you have spent so much time with our partner that you feel you know them inside-out. It is all about how much you know your partner and how curious you are in knowing them. But after so many years, how can you see your partner in a different light?

The best and only way is to try this experiment. Talk to your partner in an absurd way. Note down his reactions. Wouldn't you like to be spoken as if you were valued, appreciated and loved no matter what? same is for him/her. Just think, how would you react to someone who thinks so highly of you? Tit for
Tat. You will see how romantic relation will sustain forever.

COMMUNICATION IN LONG DISTANCE RELATIONSHIPS

“If you can’t change it, change the way you think about it.” Mary Engelbreit

It is often believed that long distance relationships are not meant to be forever. The only reason is less communication. Although, communicating with the person who is overseas can be much difficult but with the technology, it is much easier. Especially when it comes to sharing information and assurance, a video call is much more effective than a text message. Being in a communication is the only trick in a long-distance relationship. Consider a situation when your partner does not respond to tour text or WhatsApp messages even being even being online for several mins. Your mind starts running like a young tiger and you start finding evidence in every corner that your partner has fall head over heels for someone else. Sound similar? Don't let this trap end your relationship because the only way you can solve it is through communication. What if he/she is not ready to communicate ? Give them time, don't be judgemental and don't fall in a trap of negative thoughts.

Always remember these tips:

1. A great technique to improve communication is to have nonviolent communication.

2. Always shut up and listen(mouth+mind).

3. Slove your fights through bilateral talks.

4. We have two ears and a mouth, we should listen more than what we say.

5. Always talk to yourself at the end of the day for at least 5 mins.

6.  The greatest problem of relationship is that we don't listen to understand but to reply and in this era of social media, to make it viral. If you will listen with curiosity, we don't intend to reply but to understand the emotion behind the words.

title: Marketing Technique
description:
Marketing

The marketing is the process of analysing market opportunities, selecting target markets, developing the marketing mix and managing the marketing effort. Target customers stands at the centre of the marketing process. Once the corporate strategy has defined the company's overall mission and objectives.

The marketing plays a role in carrying out the below objectives.

• Delivering Value to the customers:  Marketing alone cannot produce superior value for the customers. It needs to work in coordination with other departments to accomplish this. Marketing acts as part of the organizational chain of activities. Marketers are challenged to find ways to get all departments to think with focus on customer. In its search for competitive advantage, the form needs to look beyond its own chain of activities and of its suppliers, distributors and ultimately customers. This "partnering" will produce a value delivery network

• Connecting with customers:  To succeed in today's competitive marketplace, companies must be centred. They must win customers from competitors and keep them by delivering greater value. Since companies cannot satisfy all customers in a given market, they must divide up the total market (market segmentation), choose the best segment (marketing target) and design strategies for profitability serving chosen segment better than the competitors. 

Strategic Marketing Techniques

Over the years, a number of marketing strategies have been evolved along with the evolution in technology. Here is the list of various marketing techniques.

• Social Marketing: It refere to the design, implementation and control of programs seeking to increase the acceptability of social idea, cause or practice among a target group. For instance, the publicity campaign for prohibition of smoking in Delhi explained the place where one can and can't smoke.

• Augmented Marketing:  It is provision of additional customer service and benefits build around the core and actual products that relate to introduction of Hi-Tech service like movies on demand, online computer repair services, secretarial services, etc. Such innovative offerings provide a set of benefits that promise to elevate customer service to unprecedented levels.

• Direct Marketing:  Marketing through various advertising media that interact directly with consumers, generally calling for the customers to make a direct response. Direct marketing includes catalogue selling, E-mail, telecomputing, electronic marketing, shopping and TV shopping. 

• Relationship Marketing:  The process of creating maintaining and enhancing strong, Value-laden relationships with customers and other stakeholders. For example, Airlines offer special lounges at major airports for frequent flyer. Thus, providing special benefits to select customers to strengthen bonds. It will go a long way in building relationships.

• Services Marketing:  It is applying the concepts, tools and techniques of marketing to see. Services is any activity or benefits that one party can offer to another that is essentially intangible and does not results in the banking, savings, retailing, educational or utilities

• Place Marketing:  Place marketing involves activities undertaken to create, maintain or change attitudes and behavior towards particular places say business sites marketing and tourism marketing.

• Demand Marketing:  It includes marketing strategies to reduce demand temporarily or permanently. The aim is not to destroy demand, but only to reduce or shift it. This happens when there is overfull demand.

title: STRATEGY AUDIT
description:
Auditing Business Strategy/Strategy Audit 

The audit of management performance with regard to its strategies helps an organisation identify problem areas and correct the strategic approaches that have not been effective so far. An assessment of the external environment shows where changes happen and where organisation's strategic management no longer match the demands of the marketplace. Based on such analysis, the organisation can improve business performance by periodically conducting such an audit.

Companies review their business plans and strategies on regular basis to identify weaknesses and shortcomings to enable a successful development plan. The strategy audit secures that all necessary information for the development of the company are included in the business plan and that the management supports it.

The core of Strategy Audit, for any corporate entity, lies on two important questions:

* How well is the current strategy working?

* How well  will the current strategy be working in future?

* How can this be evaluated in present and future?

* How urgent is there a need to change the strategy?

For this, a periodic review and evaluation of the fundamental characteristics of a strategy are necessary.

In short a strategy audit ia an examination and evaluation of areas affected by the operation of a strategic management process within an organisation.

An advantage of strategy audit is that it provides an excellent platform for discussion with the top management regarding necessary corporate actions or changes in the existing business plan. It also identifies the need to adjust the existing business strategies and plans.

Need of Strategy Audit

A strategy audit is needed under the following conditions:

* When the performance indicators reflect that a strategy is not working properly or is not producing desired outcomes.

* When the goals and objectives of the strategy are not being accomplished.

* When a major change takes place in the external environment of the organisation.

* When the top management plans:

a) to fine-tune the existing strategies and introduce new strategies and

b) to ensure that a strategy that has worked in the past continues to be in-tune with subtle internal and external changes that may have occurred since the formulation of strategies.

Adequate and timely feedback is the cornerstone of effective strategy audit. Strategy audit can be no better than the information on which it is based.

To conclude Strategy Audit includes three basic activities:

1. Examining the underlying bases of a firm's strategy.

2. Comparing expected results with actual results, and

3. Taking corrective actions to ensure that performance conforms to plans.

title: BUSINESS PROCESS REENGINEERING
description:
What is a Business Process Reengineering?

Business Process Reengineering (BPR) is an approach to unusual improvement in operating effectiveness through the redesigning of critical business process and supporting business system. It is revolutionary redesign of key business processes that involves examination of the basic process itself. It looks at the minute details of the process, such as why the work is done, who does it, where is it done and when it is done. BPR refers to the analysis and redesign of workflows and processes both within the organisation and between the organisation and the external entities like suppliers, distributors and service providers.

The orientation of redesigning efforts is basically radical. In other words, it is a total deconstruction and rethinking of business process in its entirely, unconstrained by is existing structure and pattern. Its objective quantum jump in process performance in terms of time, cost, output, quality and responsiveness to customers. So BPR is a revolutionary redesigning of key business processes.

Steps involved in Business Process Reengineering:

Step 1.  

Determining objectives: Objectives are the desired end results of the redesign process which the management and organisation attempts to realise. They will provide the required focus, direction, and motivation for the redesign process that helps in building a comprehensive foundation for the reengineering process.

Step 2. 

 Identify customers and determine their needs: The process designers have to understand customers- their profile, their steps in acquiring, using and disposing a product. The purpose is to redesign business process that clearly provides value addition to the customers.

Step 3. 

Study the existing process: The study of an existing process will provide an important base for the process designers. The purpose is to gain an understanding of the 'what' and 'why' of the targeted process. However as discussed earlier, some companies go through the reengineering process with clean perspective without laying emphasis on the past process.

Step 4.  

 Formulate a redesign process plan: The information gained through the earlier steps is translated into an ideal redesign process. Formulation of redesign plan is the real crux of the reengineering efforts. Customer focussed redesign concepts are identified and formulated. In this step alternative process are considered and the best are selected.

Step 5.  

Implementation of the redesigned process: It is easier to formulate new process than to implement them. Implementation of the redesign process and application of other knowledge gained from the previous step is key to achieve dramatic improvements. It is the joint responsibility of the designer and management to operationalise the new process.

                                                      Also, the efficiently redesigned business process provide a firm with many more opportunities for trying, testing, modifying and learning.

title: COMPETITIVE LANDSCAPE
description:
The business environment is highly dynamic and continuously evolving. The changes happening in the external environment challenge organisations to find novel and unique ideas to remain in business and succeed. As the world is getting smaller and the competition is increasing, organisations have increasing pressure to develop their business and strengthen its competitiveness. Strategic thinking and strategic management are highly relevant and important for all the managers in organisations in order to achieve competitive advantage, high performance for success and to ensure survival and growth of business.

A firm must identify its position relative to the competitors in the market. The objective of a competitive strategy is to generate competitive advantage, increase market share and beat competition. A competitive strategy consists of moves to:

* Attract customers

 * Withstand competitive pressures

 * Strengthen market position.

Competitive Landscape

Competitive landscape is a business analysis which identifies competitors, either direct or indirect. Competitive landscape is about identifying and understanding the competitors and at the same time, it permits the comprehension of their vision, mission, core values, niche markets, strength and weaknesses in the market places and helps it to choose and implement effective strategies that will improve its competitive landscape. 

An in depth investigation and analysis of a firm's competition allows it to asses the competitor's strengths and weakness in the marketplace and helps it to choose and implement effective strategies that will improve its competitive advantage.

Steps to understand the competitive landscape

1.  Identify the competitor: The first step to understand competitive landscape is to identify the competitors in the firm's industry and have actual data about their respective market share.

   This answers the question:

  * Who are the competitors?

2.  Understand the competitors: Once the competitors have been identified, the strategist can use the market report, internet, newspapers, social media, industry reports and various other sources to understand the product and services offered by them in different markets.

   This answers the question:

   * What are their products and services?

3.  Determine the strengths of the competitors: What are the strength of the competitors? what do they do well? Do they offer great products? Do they utilize marketing in a way that comparatively reaches out to more consumers. Why do customers give them their business?

   This answers the questions:

    * What are their financial position?

    * What gives them cost and price advantage?

    * What are they likely to do next?

    * How strong is their distribution network?

    * What are their human resource strengths?

4.  Determine the weaknesses of the competitors: Weaknesses (and strengths) can be identified by going through consumer reports and reviews appearing in various media. After all consumers are often willing to give their opinions, especially when the products or services are either great or very poor.

   This answers the question:

    * Where are they lacking?

 5.  Put all the information together: At this stage, the strategist should put together all information about competitors and draw inference about what they are not offering and what the firm can do to fill in the gaps. The strategist can also know the areas which need to be strengthen by the firm.

   This answers the questions:

   * What will the business do with this information?

   * What improvements does the firm need to make?

   * How can the firm exploit the weakness of competitors?

Having a competitive advantage is necessary for a firm to compete in the market. Competitive advantage from a firm's ability to perform activities more effectively than its rivals. But what is more important is whether the competitive advantage is sustainable. By knowing if it is a leader, challenger, or follower, it can adopt appropriate competitive strategy.

Backlinks point the visitor back to your site and appear on the other websites.
