title: Being Intovert !
description:
"Being introvert is not shy, but the two often overlap"

According to a survey, introverts are best people because they like to spend their time alone or with their very close people. And it is best but social gatherings and parties continue to exist and you have to come out of your shell. Then how to be a social butterfly being an introvert. A big question which many of us are finding answers for. Here's how to conserve your willpower without wasting your whole experience.

IT CAN BE WORTH GOING OUT

As food is healthy for us, same goes for parties. Some stuff are very important for your life which you can't leave and yes, parties are inevitable but healthy.

SOME UNNECESSARY SITUATIONS(CAN BE AVOID)

1.  Going to cafes every week :: if you have friends that love hanging out every week then you can avoid going with them because(as it is mentioned) it is not typically necessary. You probably such outings.

2. Weddings/Parties etc. : Going to brother' wife's sister's aunt's wedding can never be mandatory because wedding is cool. It can easily be avoided. If you're an introvert it's easy to stick to special events of your life.

3. Meet unknown people for dating purposes: If you're single and don't want to be then you have to meet new people. That's how life works but it's completely okay if you don't want.

SOME NECESSARY SITUATION( CAN"T BE AVOIDED)

1. Social gatherings at the workplace: work life is not the same as social life. You can avoid going to parties but you must have to attend these gatherings where you can have your golden to impress your boss or improve your contacts.

2. Talk to co-workers: Life is a race but the rat-race does not slow down because you like Netflix more than karaoke. You don't need to talk to every co-worker but you have to talk on a semi-regular basis in order to advance your career.

3. Best friend's party: Introvert too have best friends and their birthdays, OOPS, you can't at all avoid them. you sister's wedding or our parents anniversary, these are must go events of your life even if you feel you don't, Sorry friend, but we all have our social obligations.

4. Your own birthday party: You have birthday, promotions or any other reason to celebrate but you don't want to shudder and shine, that's okay but some other want. Your best friend may be planning a big party for your birthday then it's not okay to have a low-key stimulus to all the arrangements. Obviously, of they wouldn't want to celebrate with you if they didn't care.

There are not any hard and fast rules for any event to go or not to go. (I have avoided plenty of my birthdays) but some you need to attend in order to free your mind. By giving yourself a specific task will not keep your attention to thumping music and brightening lights. 

In effect, the major issue with introverts is that they have to come to the party recharged with their own fuel while extroverts come to the parties and get recharged. Always try to watch movies with social gathering events. F.R.I.E.N.D.S is the biggest example. Always recharge yourself before coming to the party, talk to yourself looking in the mirror. Filling up on you-time before you go to a party is a great way to prepare yourself for socialization, but your tank can still run out before the evening is over. Try to talk to [people in small gaps because as an introvert, other people will hardly care what you think an don't want to know you until and unless you are not going to tell them. This is a fallacy.

Don't be a douchebag. It will improve someday but yes, don't consider yourself a slick person if you are introvert. you are better and best than extroverts.

title: BENCHMARKING
description:
Benchmarking helps an organisation to get ahead of competition. The business organisation can possess a large amount of information that help them in taking strategic and other important decisions. Companies that translate this information to knowledge and use it in their planning and decision making.

A benchmark may be defined as a standard or a point of a reference against which thing may be compared and by which something can be measured and judged. However, the term got popularity much later in seventh decade of twentieth century. Initially, the concept evolved in companies operating in an industrial environment. Over a period of time it covered other spheres of business activity. In recent years, different commercial and non-commercial organisations are discovering the value of benchmarking and are applying it to improve their processes and systems.

What is Benchmarking?

In simple words, benchmarking is an approach of setting goals and measuring productivity based on best industry practises. It developed out of the need of the need to have information against which performance can be measured.

For example, a customer support engineer of a television company attends a call with in forty-eight hours. If the industry norm is that all calls are attended within twenty four hours, then the twenty four hours can be s benchmark.

Benchmarking helps businesses in improving performance by learning from the best practises and the processes by which they are achieved. Thus, benchmarking is a process of continuous improvement in search for competitive advantage

Firms can use benchmarking practises to achieve improvements in diverse range of management functions, such as:

* Maintenance operations,

* Assessment of total manufacturing costs,

* Product development,

* Product distribution,

* Customer services,

* Plant  utilisation levels,

* Human resource management.

Steps in Benchmarking Process.

 (i)  Identifying the need for benchmarking: This step will define the objectives of the benchmarking exercise. It will also involves selecting the type of benchmarking. Organisations identify realistic opportunities for improvements.

 (ii)  Clearly understanding existing decision making processes: This step involves compiling information and data on performances. This will include mapping processes. Information and data is collected by different  methods such as interviews, visits and filing of questionnaires. 

 (iii)  Identify best processes: Within the selected framework best processes are identified. These may be within the same organisation or external to them.

 (iv)  Comparison of own process and performance with that of others: Benchmarking process also involves comparison of performance of the organisation with performance of other organisation. Any deviation between the two is analysed to make further improvements. Feasibility of making the improvements in the light of the conditions that apply within the organisation is also examined. 

 (v)  Prepare a report and implement the steps necessary to close the performance gap: A report on benchmarking initiatives containing recommendation is prepared. Such a report also contains the action plans for implementation.

 (vi)  Evaluation: Business organisation evaluates the result of benchmarking process in terms of improvements through objectives and other criteria set for the purpose. They also periodically evaluate in the light of changes in that conditions that impact the performance.

                        Benchmarking is not a panacea for all problems. Rather, it studies the circumstances and processes that helps in superior performance. Better processes are not merely copied. Efforts are made to learn, improve and evolve them to suit the organizational requirements. Further benchmarking exercises are also repeated periodically so that the organisation does not lag behind in the dynamic environment.

title: ENTREPRENEURSHIP AND INTRAPRENEURSHIP
description:
Concept of Entrepreneur

Entrepreneurship is the attempt to create value through recognition of business opportunity, the management of risk taking appropriate to the opportunity and through management skills to mobilise financial, human and material resource necessary to create an enterprise. Entrepreneurship involves creation of a business idea and the fusion of capital, technology and human talent to give practical shape to the idea. The  person who perceives the business idea and take steps to implement the idea is known as an entrepreneur.


Entrepreneurship is an attitude of mind to seek opportunities, take calculated risk and drive benefits by starting an running a venture. It comprises of numerous activities involved in the conception, creation and running an enterprise.


An entrepreneur is a person who searched for a business opportunity and starts a new enterprise to make use of that opportunity.


An entrepreneur is an individual who conceives the idea of starting a new venture, takes all types of risks, not only to put the product or services into reality but also to make it extremely demanding one.

An entrepreneur is one who:

> Initiates and innovates new concepts.

> Recognises and utilizes opportunity.

> Arranges and coordinates resources such as man, material, machine and capital.

> Faces risks and uncertainties.

> Establishes a startup company.

> Adds value to the product or services.

> Takes decision to make services or products a profitable ones.

> Is responsible for the profits and losses of the company.


Concept of Intrapreneurship

The terms Entrepreneur and Intrapreneur are frequently used in the business world. Many people use these terms interchangeably because they think that they both contain the same elements. However, the fact is that there exists a fine line amidst, these two terms. While the former refers to a person who starts his own business with a new idea or concept, the latter represents an employee who promoters innovation within the limits of the organisation.

An intrapreneur is nothing but an entrepreneur who operates within the boundaries of an organisation. He is an employee of a large organisation, who is vested with authority of initiating creativity and innovation in the company's products, services and projects, redesigning the processes, workflows and systems.

The intrapreneurs believe in change and do not fear failure. They discover new ideas, look for such opportunities that can benefit the whole organisation and take risks, promote innovation to improve the performance and profitability of the organisation. The job of an intrapreneur is extremely challenging. They get recognition and reward for the success achieved by them.

It has now become a trend that large corporations appoint intrapreneur within the organisation, to bring operational excellence and gain competitive edge in the market.

title: RIVALRY AND SUBSTITUTES
description:
The Nature of Rivalry in the Industry.

The intensity of rivalry in an industry is a significant determinant of industry attractiveness and profitability. The intensity of rivalry can influence the costs of suppliers, distribution, and of attracting customers and thus directly affect the profitability. The more intensive the rivalry, the less attractive is the industry. Rivalry among competitors tends to be cutthroat and industry profitability low when

(i) An industry has no clear leader.

(ii) Competitors in the industry are numerous.

(iii) Competitors operate with high fixed costs.

(iv) Competitors face high exit barriers.

(v) Competitors have little opportunity to differentiate their offerings.

(vi) The industry faces slow or diminished growth.

(i) Industry Leader : A strong industry leader can discourage price wars by disciplining initiators of such activity. Because of its greater financial resources, a leader can generally outlast smaller rivals in a price war. Knowing this, smaller rivals often avoid initiating such a contest.

(ii) Number of Competitors : Even when an industry leader exists, the leader's ability to exert pricing discipline diminishes with the increased number of rivals in the industry as communicating expectations to players becomes more difficult.

(iii) Fixed Costs : When rivals operate with high fixed costs, they feel strong motivation to utilize their capacity and therefore are inclined to cut prices when they have excess capacity. Price cutting causes profitability to fall for all firms in the industry as firms seek to produce more to cover costs that must be paid regardless of industry demand. For this reason, profitability tends to be lower in industries (for example, airline, telecommunications) characterized by high fixed costs.

(iv) Exit Barriers : Rivalry among competitors declines if some competitors leave an industry. Profitability therefore tends to be higher industries with few exit barriers. Exit barriers come in many forms. Assets of a firm considering exit may be highly specialised and therefore of little value to any other firm. Such a firm can thus find no buyer for its assets. This discourages exit. When barriers to exit are powerful, competitors desiring exit may refrain from leaving. There continued presence in an industry exerts downward pressure on the profitability of all competitors.

(v) Product Differentiation : Firms can sometimes insulate themselves from price war by differentiating their products from those of rivals. As a consequence, profitability tends to be higher in industries that offers opportunity for differentiation. Profitability tends to be lower in industries involving undifferentiated commodities such as, memory chips, natural resources, processed metals and railroads.

(vi) Slow Growth : Industries whose growth is slowing down tend to face more intense rivalry. As industry growth slows, rivals must often fight harder to grow or even to keep their existing market shares. The resulting intensive rivalry tends to reduce profitability for all.

Threat of Substitutes.

A final force that can influence industry profitability is the availability of substitutes for an industry's product. To predict profit pressure from this source, firm must search for product that perform the same or nearly the same function as their existing products. Real estates, insurance, bonds and bank deposits for example are clear substitutes for common stocks because they represent alternate ways to invest funds.

The threat of substitutes is great in many high tech industries as well. For example introduction of digital filmless cameras virtually replace the film cameras and threatened the existence of Eastman Kodak and Fuji Film. Further, the introduction of smart phones has replaced cameras to a great extent.

title: THREAT OF NEW ENTRANTS
description:
A firm's profitability tends to be higher when other firms are blocked  from entering the industry. New entrants can reduce industry profitability because they add new production capacity leading to increase supply of the product even at a lower price and can substantially erode existing firm's market share position. To discourage new entrants, existing firms can try to raise barriers to entry. Barriers to entry represent economic forces (or 'hurdles') that slow down or impede entry by other firms. Common barriers to entry include:

Capital Requirements: When a large amount of capital is required to enter an industry, firms lacking funds are effectively barred from the industry, thus enhancing the profitability of existing firms in the industry. For example, huge investments are needed to build production facilities and establish brand awareness among people for entry into the pharmaceutical industry. This makes the entry of new companies into this sector very difficult.

Economies of Scale: Many industries are characterized by economic activities driven by economies of scale refer to the decline in the per-unit cost of production as volume grows. A large firm that enjoys economies of scale can produce high volumes of goods at successively lower costs. This tends to discourage new entrants. For example, in the semiconductor industry, larger companies, such as IBM, Intel, Samsung and Texas Instruments, enjoy substantial economies of scale in the production of advanced microprocessors, communication chips and integrated circuits that power most consumer electronics, personal computers and cellular phones. This acts as a barrier for new entrants.

Product Differentiation: Product differentiation refers to the physical or perceptual differences, or enhancements, that make a product special or unique in the eyes of customers. Firms in the personal care products and cosmetics industries actively engage in product differentiation to enhance their products features. Differentiation works to reinforce entry barriers because the cost of creating genuine product differences may be too high for the new entrants.

Switching Costs: To succeed in an industry, new entrant must be able to persuade existing products. To make a switch, buyers may need to test a new firm's product, negotiate new purchase contracts, and train personnel to use the equipment, or modify facilities for product use. Buyers often incur substantial financial costs in switching between firms. When such switching costs are high, buyers are often reluctant to change. For example, high switching costs in moving away from Microsoft's Windows operating systems used in personal computers and corporate servers powered the company's stunning growth over the past decade in the software industry.

Brand Identity: The brand identity of product or service offered by existing firms can serve as another entry barrier. Brand identity is particularly important for infrequently purchased products that carry a high unit cost to the buyer. New entrants often encounter significant difficulties in building up the brand identity, because to do so they must commit substantial resources over a long period. For example, during the 1970s, Japanese companies such as Toyota, Nissan, and Honda had to spend huge sums on new product development and promotional activities to overcome the American consumer's preference for domestic cars.

Access to Distribution Channels: The unavailability of distribution channels for new entrants poses another significant entry barrier. Despite the growing power of the internet, many firms may continue to rely on their control of physical distribution channels to sustain a barrier to entry to rivals. Often, existing firms have significant influence over the distribution channels and can retard or impede their use by new firms. For example, because of control over distribution channels in India by HUL, P&G and Godrej etc., small entrepreneur find it difficult to sell their products.

title: Behavioral interviewing
description:
“When you go in for a job interview, I think a good thing to ask is if they ever press charges.”   -Jack Handy

When you are preparing for a job, it's important to be prepared to handle known as the interview or "behavioral interviewing". This type of interviewing is done to see if an applied candidate is able to do handle the situations confronting to him/her. The specific situations are provided to see the responses. The interview wants examples of what will happen in particular challenging circumstance, what you did and how did you achieve a positive outcome.

The best you can do to prepare for behavioral interviews is to discover about the company as much as you can, discover about the position of the job you are applying for, read through about your job of what different situations can occur so you have an idea of what the employer wants and you can be as smart as you can. Answering specific and direct points to interviewer will obviously increase your chances of hiring.


Prepare for best

Before going to the interview, prepare as much as you can. There might be a situation that interviewer didn't ask you a question so don't prepare only for behavioral questions. You should always be ready for every type of question because it's better to be ready in case.

Techniques

Start from collecting your ideas, think of possible situations. Take time and frame your responses. Look in the mirror and try answering in order to boost up your confidence. Also, prepare for how to handle the situation or in case you are asked any uncertain question which is for you become very difficult to answer. Don't worry in case you don't need the answer in you don't understand the question, ask for clarification. This will buy you some extra time to think about how to answer and what to answer. Your answer should be presentable and try to answer in most intelligent and clever way. Be sure to include some points in your answer:

(a) A situation of some specific genre

(b) The action you will take

(c) The think or task to be done

(d) The outcome i.e. what happened

Do keep in mind that there are no wrong or right answers to questions and especially in the case of a behavioral interview. The least you should do is to be confident about the answer you are giving. This will create a good impression on your interviewer. How you will respond will determine that t\if there is a match between your skills and the position the company is seeking to fill.

Listen carefully your question. don't interrupt while somebody is asking something even if you already have understood the question. It's very important in interviews to act smart but not over smart. There is a chance they may throw you out directly. If your answers are not what the interviewer wants then this position is not the be the best job you are looking for anyway.

Notes for interview

Was there something you wished you have said during the interview or something you wished you had never said which changed all the game? Your subsequent notes will give you a chance to improve this. It's also an opportunity to reiterate your interest in the job and the company.

Preparation, punctuality, active listening, respond quickly, taking an active decision, displaying an assured self-confidence, optimism, being able to talk beyond your initial, expressing your attitude for the hiring committee's at the end of the interview is what these days interview demands and play a vital role in your hiring.

Remember, if you are nervous before the interview or your first interview then there is nothing bad about it. Even professional feels stomach in their butterflies before the interview. Try to calm yourself by drinking water, steady your nerves, try to talk to people, dress in a very elegant way as dressing plays a very important role in building your confidence, arrive early so you can take some time to adjust to the situation and can calm your breathing.

title: STANDARDS TO FOLLOW UP YOU NEED TO KNOW TO GET RICH
description:
1. Riches Is a Vehicle to Freedom

Be that as it may, accomplishing genuine riches gives you the extreme opportunity. This opportunity implies you get the opportunity to do what you need, with who you need, when you need.

2. Rich People Aren't All Rocket Scientists 

With regards to standards, you have to know to get rich. A typical topic is that you don't should be the sharpest individual in the room only the most engaged. Indeed, there are individuals like Elon Musk and other people who are unbelievably clever. Be that as it may, most moguls have indistinguishable IQ from whatever remains of the world. title: SUPPLY CHAIN MANAGEMENT
description:
MEANING OF SUPPLY CHAIN MANAGEMENT

The term supply chain refers to the linkages between suppliers, manufacturers and customers. Supply chain involve all activities like sourcing and procurement of material, conversion and logistics. Planning and control of supply chains are important components of its management. Naturally, management of supply chain include closely working with channel partners - suppliers, intermediaries, other service providers and customers.

In other words supply chain management is defined as the process of planning, implementing and controlling the supply chain operations. "It is a cross functional approach to managing the movement of raw materials into an organisation and movements of goods out of the organisation towards the end consumer who are to be satisfied as efficiently as possible." It encompasses all movement and storage of raw materials, work in process inventory, and finished goods from point-of-origin to point-of-consumption. Organisation are finding that they must rely on the chain to successfully compete in the global market.

Supply Chain management includes more aspects apar from the logistics function. It is atool of business transformation and involves delivering the right product at the right time to the right pace and at the right price. It reduces costs of an organisation and enhances customer service. 

IMPLEMENTATION OF SUPPLY CHAIN MANAGEMENT

Successful  implementing supply management systems requires a change from managing individual functions to integrating activities into key supply chain processes. It involves collaborative work between buyers and suppliers, joint product development, common systems and shared information. A key requirement for successfully implementing supply chain will be network of information sharing and management. The partners need to link together to share information through electronic data interchange and take decisions in timely manner.

Implementing and successfully running supply chain management system will involve:

1. Product development: Customers and suppliers must work together in the product development process. Right from the start the partners will have knowledge of all. Involving all partners will help in shortening the life cycles. Products are developed and launched in shorter time and help organizations to remain competitive.

2. Procurement: Procurement requires careful resource planning, quality issues, identifying sources, negotiation, order placement, inbound transportation and storage. Organizations have to coordinate with suppliers in scheduling without interruptions. Suppliers are involved in planning the manufacturing process.

3. Manufacturing: Flexible manufacturing processes must be in place to respond to market changes. They should be adaptive to accommodate customization and changes in the taste and preferences. Changes in the manufacturing process be made to reduce manufacturing cycle.

4. Physical Distribution: Delivery of final products to customers is the last position in a marketing channel. Availability of product at right the place at right time is important for each channel participant. Through physical distribution process serving the customer become an integral part of marketing. So, supply chain management links a marketing channel with customers.

5. Outsourcing: Outsourcing is not limited to the procurement of materials and components, but also include outsourcing of services that have been provided within an organization. The company will be able to focus on those activities where it has competency and everything else will be outsourced.

6. Customer Services: Organizations, through interfaces with the company's production and distribution operations, develop customer relationship so as to satisfy them. This helps in producing positive feelings in the organization and customers.

7. Performance Measurement: Performance is measured in different parameters such as costs, customer service, productivity and quality.

title: Demonetization
description:
Demonetisation is a principle or a tool followed by the rulers to bring in financial stability in the country. It has been followed right from the historical ages till now. It has been stated that an ancient Indian ruler Muhammad Bin Tuqlaq once had this practice of demolishing all the gold coins and changing it to copper coins. The demonetisation policies of India came into existence on 8th November 2016. When the PM declared that the 500 and 1000 rupees notes were declared invalid. According to him “the banning of notes of higher values may make it difficult for the wrongdoers to store money in such a large notes.This as he said would bring into limelight about the black money holders.

 

Generally from the survey conducted among bankers, businessmen and employed it is noted that all the three of them have more negative impacts than positive impacts. One thing very good about demonetization is that it had brought a fear and check on the corrupt people. But for bankers they feel that their work has been so tiring and hectic as they get pressure both from public as well as officials. Businessmen think that there should be have been a proper execution of the policy as they depend on public and banks for their business. On the other side, general public evidently suffer a lot of damage as they could not carry out their day to day transactions, standing in queues for money, blocking of card transaction, restriction on withdrawal of cash and so on. It can be concluded that sudden banning of a currency which is being in circulation of 86% of total circulation will have a negative impact on money supply which will in turn have its effect on liquidity and investment as both are depending upon flow of money.

title: Are you accustomed to the term… IOU?
description:
Numerous monetary exchanges are so normal and casual that a lawful contract would appear needless excess. Rather, various individuals want to utilize a less confused strategy called an IOU. An IOU, which can be in composed or verbal shape, is a casual affirmation of a little obligation, as a rule between companions, colleagues or relatives. A worker who acquires some change from an insignificant money finance, for instance, may comprise an IOU to represent the cash.

 

The name originates from the exacting phonetic spelling of "I Owe You." When working out a formal note recognizing an obligation, the indebted person frequently thought that it was a lot less demanding to contract "I owe you..." to IOU. Despite the fact that the birthplace of the shortened form in English, different nations likewise perceive the significance behind the term.


An IOU isn't the equivalent as a formal promissory note or another monetary contract. There are seldom any observers to the drafting of an IOU, and the reimbursement commitments might possibly be explained specifically. Authorizing a casual assertion like this in court may turn out to be troublesome, since the archive may not be legally approved or even recognized by the borrower. It is viewed as an affirmation of an obligation, yet the entirety might be negligible to the point that lawful gathering activities would be counterproductive.


Since an IOU isn't in every case legitimately official and the reimbursement terms might be non-existent, moneylenders and borrowers ought to consider constraining the measure of any credit anchored along these lines. Anything over a companion or relative's customary range of familiarity ought to be anchored with a more formal promissory note, not a casual or verbal assertion. An IOU is principally utilized as a budgetary placeholder for little obligations or ostensible installments.

 

In certain betting circles, a losing bettor may request an extraordinary IOU called a marker to guarantee reimbursement to the gambling club. Occasionally, the club or another loan specialist may choose to gather on this marker, particularly if the speculator happens to win a substantial total of cash somewhere else. Club and other betting outlets routinely hold a noteworthy number of IOU markers from constant speculators.


To put it plainly, if a man isn't sure whether an exchange is a credit or a blessing, it might be best to inquire as to whether a casual IOU is important. The bank may not, in any case, try to gather on the obligation, however at any rate the two gatherings have remembered it and have some composed record of the exchange.

title: The "viral" phenomenon. How could your ad go "viral"?
description:
Viral marketing refers to the distribution of online marketing campaigns among consumers who possess the motivation to share a message with others, which has either commercial nature or not. The main characteristic of the viral phenomenon is that it can be quickly shared on social networks and become popular through the number of views, likes, and subscriptions.

In fact, viral marketing has capitalized the Internet invention to influence people to pass along messages through peer communication. For this reason, viral advertising is characterized as a “new media” advertisement that helps companies to disseminate the message wanted. Yet, it can bring about unexpected publicity because viral or buzz marketing is primarily based on the word-to-mouth marketing method. This kind of advertising seems to be very effective as companies are not involved directly in the expansion of the company’s image, but common people; entailing the empowerment of credibility and impartiality of the processing message. 

In addition to this, viral marketing is an effective mean to combine the culture of your brand with the particularities and interests of the community to show that imbues with the same ethos, values, and virtues creating empathy among the customers and provoking an intimacy to the brand. 

 

Now, how could you manage to make your ad go viral?


Without a doubt, companies launched viral ads provide a fresh approach to marketing communication. This is achieved by using visual content, storytelling, and emotional copywriting to provoke positive feelings to potential customers and create strong bonds with them.

In particular, by inventing an influential, emotional, dynamic, and enchanting story to tell your customers contributes to building brand preference and maintains consistent the marketing ROI. 

Another piece of advice is that the ad should include a short-time video that doesn’t make the viewers be tired by barraging them with too much information. Instead, it should disseminate a clear, short and simple message at the end of it so as to be imprinted in the customers’ mind.

Apart from that, you should focus on finding social modern or vintage themes, such as the universal power of love, friendship, affection moments of people, families or animals, namely themes that provokes intense emotions that remain inedible to people’s mind. For example, in global rankings, animals’ ads have taken the first place in the customers’ preferences as it has proven to be one of the most favorable and popular subjects of the viewers on the social platforms and on internet searching. Tried it and tested it. Do not forget that imitation is the prime psychological effect on advertisement nowadays. Therefore, many people are receptive to share a popular social theme, as the concept interests the majority of viewers.

After finding the ad’s theme, it will be clever to combine such themes with a lot of images, pictures, and entertaining content so as to offer amusement to the viewers. In a nutshell, the imaginary and the positive feelings that emotional ads offer urges people to trust the brand and make them want to share the video, hence making it viral.


Once again, you should always bear in mind that if you want your ad to go viral your prime goal should be to cause lovely, cozy, and pleasant feelings to the customers so as to be motivated to see the ad again and again, and share it with others.

The key to successful marketing is to focus on captivating customer’s fantasy and creating an unforgettable content that ends up going viral.

title: A platform for Business
description:
We do remember the days having a cab driver's visiting card in all our purses so that we could go home on a rainy day by calling him before an hour we finish work, then wait for him to come, pick us up. We also remember the days when we know 2 or 3 restaurants that deliver food home so as to skip a day's cooking. But now it's all changed.

We book a cab, in minutes, it arrives and we go home. A million options to choose from while we sit at our desk ordering food. How does this all happen? Goods and services delivered through an app have made the world, even more, smaller, faster and lazier. 

These apps are widespread in all sectors. Allow me to give you examples.

Food sector - Swiggy, Zomato

Cabs             - Ola, Uber

E-commerce- Flipkart, Amazon

Services       - Practo, Tuner automobiles.

So how do these apps enjoy profits?

In the case of Swiggy, the app has provided a platform for restaurants and customers to order and deliver food. A certain amount of commission is given to the app for food ordered through the app i.e The app lets people know that such and such restaurant delivers food, a person orders through the app, so new customers are created for the restaurant and this service is turned into profit. Swiggy also gets paid for delivering food for restaurants that do not have a delivering facility.

In the case of Tuner automobiles, the app offers various car and bike services on the app. One can simply order for a car wash, select the nearest service station and get it done on spot. The platform provided is "encashed".

Several of these startups are now business giants but companies like Uber and food panda, with a lot of investment, are serious competition nevertheless.

title: Internet and communication
description:
If there was any interest in the revisiting of the "interpersonal communication" within the alleged international web village, it would be appropriate to complete the image with a similar brief glance on the Internet features. 

The ethological observations we have seen from time to time may be valid concerning to the communication via the Internet. However, here it has its place-a more general observation. As in various other issues caused by the development of technology, the new technological means of communication (typography, telegraph, telephone, radio, Internet), it seems that the fresh ethical challenges are not at all new. They are simply enlarged but without introducing a new category of reflection: the multitude of their repercussions, their intensity and the temporal depth of their consequences are all increased significantly. However, there are no "new" qualities of ethical concern.

In principle, the low cost, the fluency and the almost unlimited scope of communication between individuals and ideas have already contributed to the productive and cultural development. However, we do not yet have sufficient empirical data on the malfunctioning of the Internet in order to establish a convincing theory and to be able to move rationally towards an optimization. Nonetheless, we must to systematically record the disputes and the side effects. And for those associated with Internet use for advertising purposes, we apply what we noted for the advertisement last time.

For the more specific direction of the confirmatory communication between individuals (a direction whose feuilleton underline particularly importance), it is interesting to note that the Internet has actually created new conditions:

A) The number of messages you receive may give you additional choice and time available, though,with adverse effects on your mental health. And the potential consequences of 'solitary ' work, somewhere here are classified.

B) The prevalence of English has broadened the communication between people that come from different cultural backgrounds with all the humanistic consequencesof this event. 

C) The phenomenon of "friends" search on the Internet has not yet been sufficiently analyzed. No one can disavow the fundamental communication pleasure that this street offers. However, it has been recognized that anonymity and heteronomy (the possibility of retiring completely and unilaterally from the relationship) may invalidate the benefit of the institution.

D)The ability to harm individuals or groups via the Internet (from promotion to abuse, to theft of funds), sometimes sounds nightmarish. And it shows how muchcommunication can be put in a society. The scale differs only and unfortunately differs exponentially.

Finally, we should take into account that there are millions of disabled people around the world (blind, deaf, paralyzed, etc.) who, thanks to additional Braille software, vocal composition etc are now able to communicate on the Internet, study and communicate with anyone staying pinned in the wheelchair or in the prison room. 

To sum up, Internet is a modern way of communication that facilitates our lives in various ways and achieves to increase its quality. As this constitutes an important asset, we should not forget that Internet is a blessing to some extent!

title: How to limit Wi-Fi speed of TP-link router?
description:
This is a common question among all TP-link users. This blog is being prepared by Support Router’s TP-link router support technicians. TP-Link router Australia is a third-party company that provides support for TP-link routers. Now follow the instructions below to limit the Wi-Fi speed of your TP-link router.

  • Double click on your browser and go to its’ address bar and type 192.168.0.1. You will get a popup that will ask for login credentials. Now after using correct credentials click on the option called IP QoS. Noe from the left-hand navigation menu goes to Advance Setting.
  • In the Advance Setting, you will find options like bandwidth type, bandwidth applies, ID, ID range, mode, bandwidth, description. These options are important because whatever value you will enter during the time of configuration will be responsible to control your bandwidth’s speed.  Now check the option Enable IP QoS to enable it.

On the other hand, with a maximum bandwidth limit, each client can decide how much maximum speed they wish to acquire.
  •  Rule Description: Here you need to type the full description of the rule that you have already set.
  • Now enable each rule by clicking on by checking all the ‘Enable’ buttons. And finally, click on ‘Save’ button.

Python programming language
description:
This language was written by the Dutch developer Guido van Rossum in the late of 1980-1990. The version 2.0 was released on October 16, 2000, and the version3.0, which is not generally compatible with previous releases on December 3,2008.

Pythonis a "high level" language (other examples of such languages are FORTRAN, C, Java etc). The code of such a language must be converted to a "machine language" to be executed by the PC. This is done by interpreters and compilers. In the case of python, the processing is done by interpreters.

Python is a programming language with simple syntax, excellent readability, portability,and has modern features that make it suitable as the most approachable programming language. Its success is largely due to the fact that it is an interpreted language. This means that the Python compiler produces intertextual (bytecode)code that can be executed by the interpreter in many different computationalenvironments. Interpreters for Python are available for all popular operating, such as Windows, Linux, MacOS.

If your personal computer uses the Linux or MacOS operating system then Python is already installed (make sure you have the Python 3 interpreter). Otherwise, you can install the Python envelope named Canopy from the Enthought website.

Many peple use the Linux operating system and have, of course, installed the interpreter for Python 3. They also contain the IDLE shell, an interactive Python interpreter with a built-in copywriter. The workshops of the course willbe on these computer systems, but you can use your own laptop.

The Python programming language has lots of benefits because:

·        It is an Open Source Language (available at http://python.org).

·         It is of general purpose

·        It is a high level programming language.

·        It is easy to be learned (simple syntax). 

·        It has possibilities in various directions (powerful programming language). 

·        It is suitable for beginners and experienced developers. 

·        It is object-oriented, as there are several support packages (libraries)

Variable operations with Numbers: We can give multiplication and division of numbers toget the result

Types of variables: 1. int (integer) 2. float 3. bool (logical variable: gets True orFalse) 4. NoneType (takes the value None, indicates no value)

Variable names: They may contain letters and numbers (alphanumeric characters) but they must start with one letter. The pedestrians are distinguished by capitals. It may contain the underscore (_).

Keywords: They are reserved words of special importance. Some of them are >>> keyword. kwlist ['False', 'None','True', 'and', 'as', 'assert', 'break', 'class', 'continue', 'def', 'del','elif', 'else', 'except', 'finally', 'for', 'from', 'global', 'if', 'import','in', 'is', 'lambda', 'nonlocal', 'not', 'or', 'pass', 'raise', 'return','try', 'while', 'with', 'yield'].

Errors:

Editorial error. Let's look at the following

>>>print c SyntaxError: Missing parentheses in call to 'print' >>>print(c,Nick) Traceback (most recent call last):   File "", line 1, in      print(c,Nick) NameError: name 'Nick' isnot defined 

The first command has a syntax error that Python calls SyntaxError. The second command has an error that Python calls NameError. The interpreter gives us information about each mistake.

Let’s see some examples of important errors. 

>>>print (3,2) 3 2

We printed two numbers. There seems to be no mistake in the above. But if your purpose was to print 3.2, then we have made a semantic error. That is, the command gives a result, but it is not what we wanted.

title: What is Python Programming?
description:
Python is probably one of the few programming languages that are both easy and powerful at the same time. Programming languages, such as Java, VB, C ++, etc. are the core stone in the programming world. Often, however, developers want to write a small application that covers a particular need quickly.

Python is a simple yet powerful programming language that allows us to develop gadgets quickly and easily.

Python is a dynamic programming language of very high standard. Its main objective is its increased developer productivity and readability of the code. It has built-in data structures, such as lists and dictionaries and a fairly large library, guiding the batteries includedphilosophy.

Python has some common elements with oblique, object-oriented, but also it has functional programming without imposing any specific programming, unlike Java.

Its features make it a good choice for prototyping, but also for a multitude of applications where performance is not so important.

Python is a learning and yet powerful programming language. It has efficient high-level data structures and a simple but effective anti-routine programming.

Python's stylish syntax and dynamic formulas, along with its function as a predictable (instead of compiled language), make it an ideal language for creating scripts and for rapidly deploying applications across multiple platforms.

Python is a very beautiful, highly fuzzy,object-oriented, high-level prediction engine. Its type system is fully dynamic and memory management automatic, its standard implementation (CPython) is a bytecode compiler and interpreter and its library is rich.

Note that the basic principle of Python programming is that the developer's time is much more important than the machine cycle and relieves him/her from the low-level details that he has totake care of in C / C ++ or, to a certain extent, in Java.

title: The basic concepts in Python
description:
Literal constants: An example of literal constants is a number such as 4, 6.23, 5.25e-1 or a string like "This is a string" or "A string!". Its value is defined in a cycling way. Season 2 represents this and nothing else. It is consistent that the price of e can be changed. So, all these are referred to as literal constants.

Numbers: The Python numbers are of three types: the integers, the floating points andt he complex numbers. An integer example is 4 and is just an integer. Samples of floats are 3.23 and 52.3E-4. The E symbol indicates the power of 10. In thisc ase, the 52.3E-4 means 52.3 * 10-4. Missing numbers samples are (-3 + j) (3.3 - 2.6j).

Strings: Atoken is a sequence of characters. The strings are a bunch of words. The words can be in English or whatever language that is supported by the Unicode prototype.

There are no "ASCII-only" symbols because the Unicode standard is a superset of the ASCII. If an ASCII-encoded byte stream is required, then you should usestr.encode ("ascii"). By default, all of the strings are in the Unicode language.

You can also set strings with single quotes. For example, 'They call me Tonia and Iearn to program Pythion'. Formatting e.g. whitespace and tabs remain as it is.

Double-quote strings work exactly as they do with singles, for "How does Python look like?"

You can define multiple-triple strings with triple input ('' '). Use single quotes and double quotes freely in triple quotes.

Escape sequences: Suppose you would like a token that contains a single input. How do you set it up? For example, the cave is "I do not ignore you!". You cannot define it as 'I'm not ignorant' because Python will be confused with the beginning and the end of the string. So you have to specify separately that the introductory id does not state the end of the string. The solution is by using the so-called escape. Define the singleintroductory as \ '. For example 'I do not know!' /

Another way of defining this particular code is by using double quotes. Similarly, you need to use an escape character for a double quote within an input pipeline string. You also have to indicate the left side slash \ \.

And if you want to roll a two-line tower. One way is by using tread inserts or by using an escape character.

Raw settings: If you need to specify some strings and do not want special procedures, set a raw value or Rin the font. In this string, a new line will not be printed because there is \n why in raw strings the escape characters are not analyzed.

Immutable: This means that after you have created a string, you can not change it. Although it looks like something bad, it is not.

Contextual String Concatenation: If you place next two blocks, they are automatically joined by Python.

Note for C / C ++ developers: There is no separate char type of data in Python

Note for Perl / PHP developers: Remember that singlea nd double quotes are the same. They do not differ in any way.

Note for Regular Expression:  Always use raw strings to handle regular expressions. Otherwise, excessive use of the escape character will be required. For example, reports can be defined as' \\ 1 'or' r '\ 1'.

title: How to use a source code file? The first Python script
description:
Whenever we learn a new programming language, the first program we write and run to be “Hello,World!”. All it does is to say “Hello World” when we run it. As Simon Cozens pinpointed it is the “traditional spell to programming gods to help us learnthe programming language better”.

So, to display the"Welcome to Python world!" message in our first script, we should open the Python GUI. Then, we should choose File → New Window or press Ctrl + N and enter the print ("Welcome to Python world") program.  Next, to that we select File → Save or Ctrl +S and save it as welcometopython.py. Then, while staying in the code window, we should select Run module and press F5.

We can also run this program by opening a shell (Linux terminal or command line in DOS) and importing the Python 3.3.2 welcometopython.py command. Bear in mind that before you give the command to run helloworld.py, you must have moved to the folder where the welocometopython.py file is stored. After that, some remarkable remarks are worthwhile to be mentioned. Python gives you the output of the line directly. What you write is a statement in the Python language. Use the “print” order to get whatever value we provide

Closing the console: To close the console, press ctrl-d (EOF-End Of File symbol) if you use IDLE or a Linux / BSD shell. Respectively, if you use the Windows command prompt, press ctrl-z and then press enter. If you have received an error message, re-write the above program and run it again.

Note that Python is case-sensitive, for example print is not the same as Print. Also, make sure there are no spaces or tabs before the first character (letter) on each line.

Let's stand on the first two lines of the program. These are called comments. So whatever the right # symbol is a comment. Comments are mainly used as notes for the program reader.

Python ignores the comments except for the first line special case. Thisis called the shebang line. Anytime the first two characters of the source file are # followed by the location of a program. This tells the Linux / Unix system that this program should be run with this interpreter when it's time to run.

For example, write:

#!/usr/bin/python3.3

#Filename:welcometopython.py

print ("Welcome to Python world!")

Note that you can always run the program on any platform by specifying the interpreter directly at the command line. For example, if you use Python 3.3.2, press welcometopython.py.

Use comments in your programs to explain some important details of the program. It is very useful for readers of your program so they can easily understand what the program does.

Comments are followed by the Python command. Here, we use the print function that simply prints the text “Welcome to Python world!”. In any case, remember that whatever you enter between parentheses will be printed on the screen

title: Why does Python dominate over Perl and Ruby?
description:
Perl is another extremely powerful, popular, open source, and interpreted programming language. Programs in Perl are very easy when they are small and language excels in small hacks and scripts of commands that "do their jobs". However, it quickly becomes intolerable when you start writing big programs.

Compared to Perl, Python programs are definitely simpler, cleaner, easier to write, and therefore more comprehensible and easy to maintain. I really admire Perl and Iuse it every day for different things but as I write a program I always begin to think about it with Python terms because it has become so natural to me. Perl has suffered so many hacks and changes that seem to be a huge hack itself. Unfortunately, the upcoming Perl 6 does not seem to make any improvements in this domain.

The unique and themost important asset that Perl has is the huge CPAN library Comprehensive Perl Achieve Network. As its name suggests, it has a giant collection of Perl modules and it is really hard to grasp its size and depth. You can do anything on a computer using these modules. One of the reasons why Perl has more libraries than Python is because there has been much longer than Python. However, this seems to be changing with the ever-increasing Python package count.

Ruby is another popular, non-codeable, interpretable programming language.

So, Python or Ruby? Python is strongly suggested in terms of ease of learning. Several programmers find it difficult to understand Rubby language, but those who understand it are glorifying the beauty of the language.

Python is distinguished and recognized by great developers. 

EricS. Raymond is the author of "The Cathedral and the Bargain" and he is also the one who proposed the term Open Code. He said that Python became his favorite programming language.

Bruce Eckel is the author of the famous books Thinking in Java and Thinking in C ++. He said no language made him feel more prolific than Python. He also supported that Python is probably the only language that focuses on making things easier to the developers.

Peter Norvig is a well-known writer of Lisp and themanager of Google Search Quality. He said that Python has always been an internal piece of Google. Looking at the Google Jobs ads that display Python knowledge required for software engineers.

title: Python’s characteristics
description:
It's simple: Python is a simple and minimalist language. Reading a good program in Python is like the English language, but very strict “English”. This resemblance to pseudocodeis one of its strong points. It allows you to concentrate on a solution to a problem rather than the language itself.

Easy to learn: It is extremely easy to start with Python. Python has an unusually simple syntax.

Free and TracingCode: Python is an example of free software and open source software. Simply put, you can distribute copies of the software, read its source code, make changes to it, and use its tracks in new free programs. Free software and open source software is based on the idea of a community that is related toknowledge. This is one of the reasons why the python is so good. It has been constantly being developed and improved by a community that only wants is a better sign.

Portable: Due to the elevation of the code, the group has been implemented, that is, it has been changed to operate on many platforms. All scheduled programs can run on any of these platforms without having to change them if you are careful enough to avoid using the commands that depend on each system. You can use the mouse on Linux, Windows, FreeBSD, Macintosh, Solaris, OS / 2, Amiga, AROS, AS / 400,BeOS, OS / 390, Palm OS, QNX Damage, VMS Damage, Psion Damage, Acorn RISC OSDamage, VxWorks Damage, PlayStation, Living Sharp Zaurus, Damaging Windows CEand the PocketPC !

High Level Language: When writing programs in Python language, you never need to know about the low-level details, such as managing the memory used by your programs, etc

Interpreted: A program that you write in a compiled language such as C or C ++ is converted from the source language, for example C or C ++ into a language spoken by your computer using a compiler with various flags and options. When you run it program, the link copies the program to memory and starts running it. Python, from the other, does not need to be compiled into a binary file. Just run the program directly from the source code. Internally, the Python converts the source code into an intermediate form called bytecode, and then translates it into the PC language and after that it runs the program. All this actually makes the use of the Python much easier because you do not have to worry about spreading the program, linking it with the appropriate libraries. This also makes the programs of the library extremely portable, since you can just copy the Python that you made on another computer and work that way.

Expandable: If youneed a critical piece of code to run too fast or if you need to have a bit of an algorithm that is not open, then you can program that piece in C or C ++ and then use it from your Python program.

Object-oriented: Python supports both procedure-oriented and object-oriented programming. In the process-oriented, the program builds on processes or functions that are not hing but re-used tracks in these programs. In object-oriented programming, programs are built on objects that combine data and functionality. Python has a very powerful but very simple way for object-oriented programming especially when compared to other languages, like C++ or Java.

Embeddable: You can integrate the Python into the programs in C / C ++ to give them "scripting" capabilities for your users.

Extensive libraries: The template library is really huge. It can help you do various things in terms of regular expressions, document creation, unit views, filming, databases, web browsing, CGI, FTP, email, XML, RPC, HTML, WAV files, (GUI) graphical user interfaces, Tk, and other things that depend on the system. Remember that all of these are available whenever the Python is installed. This is called the "Batteries Included" philosophy of Python. In addition to the standard library, there are several other high quality libraries such as Python, Twisted, Python Imaging Library and many more.

title: Historical evolution of Python programming
description:
Python is an interpreted, interactive and object-oriented language programming that was developed by Guido van Rossum, in 1990. Its name was taken by one of the most successful TV shows of van Rossum, the Monty Python's flying circus.

Python is a language that combines significant power with very clear syntax. It uses modules, classes, exceptions as well as very high dynamic data types. Python’s interpreters are available for most operating systems and the Python is provided without charge. 

Python's development began in 1990 at CWI in Amsterdam and continues at CNRI's Reston. This programming language has an elegant though not very simplified syntax and a small number of powerful and high-level data types.

Python can be extended by adding new mods that are written in a compiled language, such as C or C ++. These extension modules can define new features and variables, as well as new objective types. Python is often compared to other interpretive programming syllables, such as Java, JavaScript, Perl, Tcl and Smalltalk, but comparisons can also be made with C ++, Common Lisp or Scheme.

Its main goal is the readability of its code and user-friendly. It is distinguished by the fact that it has a lot of libraries that make it very easy for a lot of ordinary work and for the speed of learning it.

Python is developed as an open source and managed by the non-profit Python Software Foundation. The code is distributed with the Python Software Foundation License, which is compatible with GPL. The name of the language comes from the group of comedians Monty Python.

Initially, Python was a script language used in the Amoeba operating system, also capable of system calls.

Python 2.0 was released on October 16, 2000. Version 3.0, known as py3k or python3000, was released on December 3, 2008. Many of the new features of this release have been shifted to backwards versions 2.6 and 2.7.

Python3 is basically the first programming language that breaks backward compatibility with previous versions to correct some mistakes that existed in earlier releases and to make it even clearer the simple way in which things canbe done.

title: Qualitative Metrics to Consider in Dropshipping
description:
The hard statistics like exclusive PageRank and linking domains will be very helpful in shaping how hard this can be to outrank the competitors, but it is also very vital to look at some qualitative factors:

1. Site Quality and Effectiveness – Visit the best ranked sites for your market and place yourself in the shoe of the customers. Do they appear welcoming and inviting or they are outdated and old? Are the sites easy to navigate and well-organized, or is it even a struggle in finding the search box? Are they providing detailed product listings and high-quality information or do you need to squint to create the grainy product imagery?

Concisely, how possibly would you be in purchasing from these sites? If you are being blown away from these top sites in the market, it will then be difficult to distinguish yourself and you can take into consideration a diverse market. But when there are lots of room for a progress or, as we can see it, chances to add value – that is a good sign.

2. Customer Loyalty and Site Reputation– An online dropshipping business can have a solid standing based on the years of treating the customers well, despite the outdated site and the drab design. On the other hand, the most beautifully planned sites might have the widespread reputation for a terrible customer service. It may be really hard to judge the book by their cover.

Have it check with the best Business Bureau to spot if the company had the history of customer criticism. You may also want to make the web search to observe what the people states in the online forums and the communities and on the social media. When the top competitors slacked in the satisfaction and service department, there can be a breach for the store with a superior service.

Important Note on the Search Results

When you’re performing a search, it is very important to understand that the Google personalizes the outcome you witness based on the geographic location, the browsing history and some other factors to consider.  When analyzing the market, the unbiased results must be observed so that the actual competitive landscape can be understood.  Also, when you are residing outside the states and planned on selling to the US customers, you need to have access to the investigating results in the US-based clients will see, since these are the websites you will be competing with. 

To get around the issues, you have to know these two ways:

1. Incognito Search:  When you are using Chrome as your browser, you may still browse in the web 'Incognito'.  Within this mode, any browsing history or personalized settings will be discarded so that you can have the unbiased idea about how the sites actually level. You will start the Incognito browsing sessions through going to the file. The other web browsers that have the similar ‘hidden searches’ mode will then clear the browsing history.

 2. Forcing Nation-Specific Outcomes:  If you would want to see the outcomes that appear for the nation other than the ones you own, you may add a bit of text at the URL’s end on the Google result pages to get a particular specific result.

title: Jet Set Fly Speaks of the 5 trends of e-Commerce to be Taken into Account in 2019
description:
Online purchases continue to increase in the US UU Recent reports show that the e-Commerce industry grew by 16%, or approximately $ 460 billion, in 2017 alone.

We hope that this trend continues and we encourage companies in the sectors of business to consumer (B2C) and business to business (B2B) not to miss this opportunity.

Listed below are the 5 e-commerce trends that will definitely gained highlights in 2019:

Machine learning and artificial intelligence

Machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) are becoming an integral part of many industries, and e-Commerce is no different.

A more personalized experience as an online buyer expectation becomes demanding, AI and machine learning is now necessary elements of a successful web shop.

Negative feedback will be reduces through these technologies as they provide specific shopping experience. These technologies will be increasing in use in 2019.

Search by voice

Voice search is usefulness is gaining popularity. It is now seems as a necessary factor in search engine dominance.

It is now recorded that 20% of all search engine activities are based on voice search. This trend is also applicable to e-Commerce. Forbes reports that the current voice purchase market of $ 2 billion will grow to $ 40 billion by 2020.

This massive increase in market share will only continue as buyers accept Alexa-type voice assistants for their daily shopping activities.

Convenient shipping and collection of products

With 40% of the total participation in the e-Commerce market, Amazon leads the way, especially in regard to logistics.

The normal behavior of deliveries on the same day or the next day will be affected and change as companies compete to immerse as Amazon’s customers first choice.

There will be other changes that can benefit buyers like month monthly shipping subscriptions, unpaid programs, and "buy online / pick up offline".

Augmented Reality

As e-Commerce companies try to improve their sales techniques, augmented reality could become a successful tool.

Most of today's buyers use online stores to collect information about products, but a large percentage is still in favor of making final purchases in physical stores.

So what guides this behavior? Online purchases involve uncertainty which is the factor to this behavior according to research.

When a person shop or buy in the internet, he or she cannot really see the actual item and they cannot touch it either. You have to use your imagination and fill in those blanks. For some buyers, that's good enough.

For others, not so much. With augmented reality added to an existing e-commerce site, companies can help their customers obtain a "real-life" product experience.

Giants like IKEA and Amazon already use these technologies, but we can expect this trend to extend to the medium and even to some small companies throughout 2019 and 2020.

 

Chatbots customer service

Although still underdeveloped in some parts of the world, customer service chatbots are reaching the spotlight with commercial and e-Commerce websites and we can expect to see more of this in 2019.

In fact, chatbots will be the first direct experience of many consumers with automation based on artificial intelligence.

The similarities to human service make this chatbots capable to be on the same level of customer services guidance.

Where they fall short is in non-typical situations, and this can be potentially harmful to businesses.

 

 

The Jet Set Fly movement is really about you, we are inviting you to grow with us. We are about motivating the hungry, purpose driven and determined individuals to take initiative and to go after their dreams but more importantly we are about providing the information for you to utilize once you become motivated so you have a complete roadmap to get exactly where you want to be in life.

Everything Josh King Madrid encourages is backed by real results and years of experience. We want you to speed up your personal learning curve, so you can reach success faster with less setbacks.

title: Big Data and Data Analytics as a means of achieving companies’ competitive advantage
description:
The competition along with the customer expectations have increased a lot in the past years and therefore it is supported that businesses should find more innovative ways in order to increase their profits and remain enough competitive to maintaining their leadership or their brand positioning to themarket. 


One of the most useful ways to achieve this is by collecting, using and correctly interpreting the data that are available to the organization. In this attempt, the contribution of Big Data and Data Analytics can be an invaluable strategic resource for the organization. Exploiting data analytics tools, managers can make more accurate decisions as these decisions would be based on facts, quantitative research and not on suppositions. So, analytics is highly related to the decision-making process and constitutes not only a competitive advantage for the company but a strategic resource as well. Particularly, he expressed the notion that such competitive advantages can stem from the good use of business intelligence and predictive analytics. These tools are also well-implementable to every industry and every sector of the organization, such as marketing, operational department, quality management. 


However, to effectively use analytics, organizations should have Big Data and expertise people who can interpret them. Simultaneously, researchers have shown that companies used data analytics they should have the following characteristics: analytics supported a strategic, distinctive capability; the approach to and management of analytics was enterprise-wide; senior management was committed to the use of analytics, and the company made a significant strategic bet on analytics-based competition. Also, data analytics gives a competitive advantage to companies as data are cheaper to be collected comparing to previous years, there are useful tools that can interpret them without needing to invest a lot of money to infrastructures and there are people that can make this work and find the value that is hidden behind those data. 


For example, Internet of Things (IoT) assists companies to see their customers’ attitudes regarding certain products at a real-time base; hence giving companies the advantage to correspond quickly to customers’ behaviors. Apart from that, analytics can be used as an asset for companies since it provides a great chance for them to make extensive research concerning the market trends and the organizations’ operating activities, something that facilitates organization to see the sales trends, the improvements or the amendments needed to be done inside the organization, as well as the opportunities that emerge to the market. Also, organizations which exploit data analytics are able to innovate in the Market by making significant modifications in their processes or their products/services or by creating entirely new business models. This means that analytical practitioners are basically concentrated on operational improvements and strive to bring about data-driven innovations. Particularly, the most successful companies that used analytics exploit the artificial intelligence technology soas to increase the employees’ skills, save time from “big” projects and help managers to concentrate on the strategic details of the projects rather than involving managers to administrating processes demanded on such projects. Also, through this procedure, companies have the ability to detect and exploit new opportunities concerning their partnerships that can boost their business value chain. Along with this, companies that use data analytics, they increase their access to only useful data; hence saving time and money.


From the analysis above, it became more than apparent that data analytics contribute companies in miscellaneous ways, from resolving strategic issues to providing technological improvements such as cloud computing which ultimately concluded to acquire companies a sustainable competitive advantage.
